Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: hopbrew
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is a located conveniently just a few blocks away from Union Square. You can catch a trolley down to the waterfront. Our room was very clean, but there was very little about it or the decor that make it stand out. The hotel itself was pretty quiet. The staff was friendly and attentive. All in all, we were happy with our stay, but nothing about it was distinctive. That being said it's a very good value for San Francisco, and a good choice if you want to be near Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: traveldorks
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a few blocks from Union Square and just steps from the Powell Street cable car lines. There are numerous restaurants in the area and Chinatown is a short walk away. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, nicely furnished and quite large.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: treadmark
Reviews.Content: Our overall experience with the Orchard Hotel was excellent. The staff were friendly, professional and helpful. The room was well appointed and clean. It was in a good location for walking to Chinatown and Union Square, (we also walked to Fisherman's Warf and Haight/Ashbury, but we like walking), and the trolley was right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: HomeOnceAgain
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, from the staff, the rooms and the resturant. Everythng was spotless and well maintained. The staff bent over backwards to assist in every way even follwing up on every comittment offered from dinner reservations to storeing luggage to ensure we wer 100% satisfied. When we go back to SF we will be staying at the Orchard Hotel. Thank you to the staff for a great experience

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: hipnhappy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this superb little hotel over the Easter weekend and absolutely loved it. from arrival to leaving we could not fault the staff, we were always greeted in a friendly manner and we felt we were the only people staying as we heard no noise from any part of the hotel, no lift noises, no banging doors. The hotel was very clean and well presented, the bed was very comfortable and the furniture was of a good quality. The location is excellent for sightseeing, the cable car stop is just outside the door,although we wish you luck catching it there as they are always full, but you can alway walk in a downhill direction and find plenty to see and do. We did not eat here so cannot comment on the food. We will return to this hotel when we visit the city again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: silverscreen76
Reviews.Content: Great location in the city, easy walk to Union Square, China Town and beyond. Big rooms, very well maintained and quiet. The staff was helpful and friendly. I would definitely book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, quality, quality”
Reviews.Author: Bob/Paula
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here with another couple and found it totally satisfying. We'd pretty much endorse others' recent comments - nice sized room, king bed with unusually good support. We were on the 5th floor overlooking Bush St. and found it completely quiet. Staff are friendly and eager to help, including making change for the Muni. Wifi was strong in our room. Can't comment on Daffodil (the restaurant) as we didn't eat there. It's an easy walk (in an SF vertical sort of way) to all sorts of dining, Chinatown, etc. One irritating fact of life is that not only is hotel parking predictably exorbitant ($40/day), the valet requests 30 minutes notice to get the car. No harm done since we walked or took the bus everywhere, but in case you need a further reason not to have a car in SF...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - walking a little inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: AndreaZ299
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, bathroom was nice. The 2 beds we had were small but comfortable. The restaurant is only open for breakfast, but there are many other food options near by. Safe location, 3 blocks from Union Square. The only thing I didn't care for was the walk up the large hill (the last block) to get to the hotel; if you take cabs everywhere it doesn't matter. If you are trying to lose weight then this is the hotel for you. They did allow a late checkout which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: eatseesleep
Reviews.Content: Huge room. Huge bed. We were amazed at how spacious the room was. We got a king size bed that was so comfortable it was hard to leave it for the day. In fact we asked what brand of bed it was. The staff were always very courteous and effective. The Orchard is right on the corner of Powell where the cable car line runs and if you get a 3 day MUNI pass the cable car rides are included. We ended up using the cable car more than any other mode of transportation so the hotel location was perfect (besides being mere blocks away from Union Square). One tip: if you don't want to be disturbed during a mid-afternoon nap definitely put the Do Not Disturb sign on the doorknob outside. The cleaning staff seems to make multiple rounds asking if there is anything you need. No big deal but it did take us two days of this to figure out that we needed to let the staff know with the sign not to bother. Will definitely be staying here again. One of our best hotel experiences in both the US and Europe in recent memory.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value - Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: PMendozaNE
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about The Orchard Hotel. We were in SF celebrating our 10 year anniversary and the service provided by all staff members added to a memorable experience. We arrived on Easter Sunday, before check-in time, but our room was ready and were able to check-in early. Anytime we left the hotel, they asked us if we needed assistance with transportation or directions. When we returned, we were welcomed back. Our room was clean, comfortable and spacious. At the end of our stay, the hotel staff were again very accommodating by arranging our transportation to the airport and allowing us a late check-out time so that we could get in a little more sightseeing and rest before our departure. The Orchard Hotel is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: csantos1256
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for business travel. Staff was outstanding, everything nice, loved it

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Orchard”
Reviews.Author: TeoSarkic
Reviews.Content: Spending 12 nights in Orchard Hotel was very pleasant, room was comfortable, with everything needed for a business trip (quiet and yet inspiring surroundings). All I can do is to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: TrishHWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at The Orchard, for six nights and on a lower floor in room 204. I'm picky about hotels and can tell you there is value for your money here! Our window faces Bush Street but the room is surprisingly quiet for being almost ground level. The room is spacious, clean, adequate lighting, with all amenities that you need--bar niche with refrig. and complimentary coffee & tea, large and nice bathroom, ultra comfortable featherbed & down pillows, free wifi. Hallways are bright and clean. Go downstairs and the hotel personnel are friendly and helpful. There is a restaurant off the lobby. Orchard is located half-way up Nob Hill, very close to Union Square, an excellent location. The walk is a bit of a climb back up to the hotel, but not worth complaining about. I feel at home here! San Francisco hotel rooms are typically small, so this hotel, coupled with reasonable rates, is a stand out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a really central location”
Reviews.Author: richierich1969
Reviews.Content: The Orchard is a great hotel conveniently located in Union Square. From the warm welcome of the doorman, to the attentive service from the front desk staff, my first impressions were fantastic. I was pleasantly surprised by the generous room and tasteful decor. A quiet hotel, yet right in the heart of the action. Would recommend the Orchard Hotel to anyone and look forward to staying there on my next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - just outside of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Canadiantraveller027
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great stay for six nights at the Orchard Hotel. My only complaint was it was up a hill with a steep grade, but only for the 1 block ... but that was not the hotel's fault, but keep in mind if you have difficulty walking up hills. The room was superb with a great view onto Bush Street. You could hear the cable cars running on the Mason-Powell Line / Mason-Hyde Line ... but it was not loud enough to be a bother and they shut down later in the evening. Bed was good, room was clean and house keeping did a great job as did the doorman / conceirage with friendly chat and advice. We did not use the restaurant, but there are a number of cafe's and restaurants in the area. If your environmentally aware, the hotel does not provide free papers (which I hate anyway, as I never have time to read them and they always hit the waste bin when travelling) and the building is LEED certified (although I have not followed up as to what catagory and level). All in all, not complaints. It is a very good location to access the city by either cable car / trolley / bus or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Large room and perfect location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: seekbeauty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orchard in March, 2012 for two nights for business/personal. After much research, I decided The Orchard was reasonably priced (for San Francisco) and well located. I wanted access to the hotspots of The City without being in the middle of crazed tourisits. I am thrilled with my experience at The Orchard from the large room and wonderfully updated and HUGE bathroom (again, for San Francisco). I have stayed at many a "boutique" hotel that were absolutely tiny but so opposite at The Orchard. Chinatown and Union Square are both within walking distance and you can get a great work-out from those hills. Chinatown is 2 blocks away and if you go straight through the neigborhood across the street from the hotel, the hill(s) and stairs are exactly what you need before hitting an authentic Chinese restaurant and bakery! Remember, look for the restaurants who serve the local culture, not the tourist traps in ethnic neighborhoods. You will have a much better, inexpensive, and friendly experience. We chose to valet park our vehicle at The Orchard. We simply needed to leave and come back once a day so felt it would be easier to spend the $45 ($40 + $5 parking tax) to have it parked for us. If you choose to use valet, call down for your car 15 minutes before you are ready to leave. One morning, it took them 20 minutes to retrieve our car (even though we pre-called) and the next morning it only took 10 minutes. They will call your room if the car is ready before you come downstairs. I always request the highest floor possbile when traveling. I like a view and I like quiet. We were on the 10th floor on opposite end of hotel from Bush/Powell corner and I was shocked at how quiet our room was. Quieter than my house and noise from my neighborhood! I can't say enough good things about The Orchard Hotel and I look forward to staying there again in a few months!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: lovemy2kiddos
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I just spent two nights at the Orchard hotel and almost all of our experience was fabulous! Only bad part...at check in the lady looked right into my husband's eyes and asked if he would like his "lady friend" (that would be me who he has been married to for 10 years) to have a key to the room. Note to Orchard: DO NOT ever call wives lady friends! Besides that the location, room, and doorman were wonderful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Say Hello to Cornell, the Doorman!”
Reviews.Author: Nanarocksween
Reviews.Content: Cornell, the Orchard Hotel's long-time doorman will always make you feel welcome. We remembered him from our stay last year--he's one of the reasons this hotel is a standout...all the staff members are kind and welcoming. The hotel is fairly priced, comfortable, and in a great location. Free wifi too! But the thing you will remember most is how welcome Cornell made you feel every time you walked in the door.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay in the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: alisaCrisp
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orchard several times in San Fransisco and every time is a true pleasure. Cornell the doorman is so friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and quiet, and the location (right next to the cable car) could not be better. If we come to San Fransisco again, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Back again this year!”
Reviews.Author: Nanarocksween
Reviews.Content: We're back again at the Orchard Garden...it's so comfy, it's like we're home again. The people here are all so friendly!-- It's a pleasure to return here after a busy day of site seeing. The rooms aren't fancy, but they are clean and comfortable. I love the King Suite...lots of room, and the bathroom is huge. It's hard for me to find a hotel where I'm truly comfortable--the Orchard Garden gives me that feeling. I'd definitely recommend it. Oh, and with the trolley right outside and only a few blocks from Chinatown--great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good San Francisco hotel”
Reviews.Author: duomogal
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Orchard Hotel for business and had a very good experience. My room (904) was plenty spacious and quiet. The decor is not hip, but of standard hotel traditional fare, and my room was very clean. Old-style tv (not flat screen) but it worked fine. I very much appreciated the free wi-fi and the friendliness of the staff. The concierges, in particular, were wonderful. The daily parking rate ($40) seemed high, but may be standard for the area. I was warned when I checked in that retrieving my car each day may take 15 or 20 minutes, so I always called down from my room a few minutes before I was leaving, which worked just fine. The location is good -- just up the hill from Union Square (although, to be fair, it's a big hill!). The only downside - the hotel restaurant was empty the entire four days that I was there, and thus I didn't eat there. Menu options seemed limited and I was reluctant to try an empty restaurant with so many attractive eateries in SF. I have no idea how they keep it going. I'd recommend this hotel to friends and coworkers, and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: thej
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several nights in March. The first few nights my friend from college days and I shared a double room on the 9th floor. The last few nights my husband joined me and we had a king room on the 6th floor. I really liked almost everything about this place. It was very quiet and peaceful. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and spacious enough. The beds are very comfortable. It is very close to union square - a block or two away. Close to many good restaurants and art galleries, etc. I will stay here again! One thing they could do better - soap! They gave us two pieces of tiny tiny soap. In fact, when my husband and I checked into the king room, there was only one tiny tiny bar of face soap. I did not eat at the restaurant there or use room service, though my friend used room service for breakfast one morning. The staff there is great. Friendly, helpful, they would do whatever they could to be of assistance. Nice place, and reasonably priced for that location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: Stefano964
Reviews.Content: The Orchard is very high in Tripadvisor ranking and I think it deserve it. The location is very convenient, very close to Union Square, just the first uphill to do when coming back. The building is modern and the hotel is kind of small, compared to the big chain hotels. The hall is very small, you just have the reception and the lifts, you do not have space to wait or to chat with somebody, if needed. My room was at the 7 floor, so it was higher than the closer building, so i could see around and had a lot of light. The room was fine, comparabile to a big chain hotel, Bee was very confortable, bathroom was big and well equipped. Overall very good value, I would strongly suggest the place, considering also price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: superusta
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The sound of cable car can be loud and I could hear it from our room in the morning (I didn't realize the sound and the vibration was from the cable car until I went out from the hotel.....kind of cool). Our room was really dark and small. Clean but outdated and traditional. It was good for one night stay. Comfotable, but nothing outstanding. The valet parking was expensive, but I guess it is normal in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Okay Room”
Reviews.Author: Neutrino_FL
Reviews.Content: Okay, I stayed at the Orchard during a HUGE conference at the Moscone, so I have no idea how their prices are generally, but the week I stayed it was _expensive_ and that colors the review a bit. The room I had was nice - nothing special, but clean. Free WiFi, coffee in the room, all the things you would expect from a good SFO hotel. It's not a room I'll remember in a year's time... no surprises. It was pretty big, though, which I appreciated. The thing that moved the hotel up to "very good" for me though was the staff. I have to say, you can measure a hotel by the doorman, and the one at the Orchard was *very* good. He remembered my name from the first time I met him and gave me a good recommendation for dinner; similarly, the front desk was helpful and efficient. I'd come back for the people, without a doubt. Never ate in the restaurant, so can't tell you much about how that is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a three-night stay here in August. We found the room to be outstanding, the customer service well above par, and the location to be ideal. We will try to stay here again when in the area. We found the lounge an ideal spot to relax in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “WoW, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kellie D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic and right in the middle of it all. The staff was kind, helpful, and personable at all hours of the day or night. The rooms were spacious and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor”
Reviews.Author: CeCe82
Reviews.Content: I liked the decor. The room was very comfortable. The door staff and reception were very friendly. The tea and coffee making facilities were not sufficient. The small coffee maker worked fine, however, a tiny sachet of creamer was not enough. There were only two. I requested milk from reception. Was sent to the restaurant and was charged three dollars 50 odd for a small glass of milk. Wasnt overly impressed. That aside, the location was fab. A cable car stop just on the next corner, the Union Sqaure shopping area, very close. China town in walking distance. Extremely comfortable bed. Bathroom was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.”
Reviews.Author: OwensMommy09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few days ago, as I was attending a conference in town. I agree with many of the comments made by other reviewers. Loved that this is a smaller hotel, with smaller corridors. The rooms are very nice and for the most part, clean. I found hair in the bathtub upon check-in which grossed me out. The bottom sheet on the bed is not fitted, nor is the mattress pad, so if you toss and turn even a little during the night, the bed becomes a big, uncomfortable, lumpy mess. And the sheets were very rough and scratchy. Low water pressure in the shower, and if you are taking a shower between 6 am and 8 am, don't expect hot water. The front desk staff were ok. I asked a few questions about the area and they couldn't answer my questions. The bellman/conceirge was busy most of the time playing wtih his iPhone. It was these little things when added up, led to my 3 star review, but most of these items can be fixed if management pays attention. However, the location is good and in a safe, comfortable, convenient location. And as a woman travelling alone, I felt perfectly safe going out after dark and walking down the hill to Union Square. And the trolley is only steps from the hotel on Powell St.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Patti J
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this hotel and I would definitely stay here again. Every person that works at the hotel that we interacted with was so friendly and helpful. The location is terrific - very convenient to lots of neighborhoods. The rooms were nice and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, service”
Reviews.Author: Guz V
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, clean and well located. Complementary Internet and the concierge was very nice! Would recommend it 100%

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at Orchard”
Reviews.Author: NoRoadsXPD
Reviews.Content: The Orchard was a great hotel for us. The location was simply awesome, the rooms were excellent and large on San Fran basis and the staff were excellent. When we return to San Fran we will stay at the Orchard. By the way we stay in room 904 on the ninth floor facing Bush Street and it was very peaceful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia07
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop of a tour of California and a fantastic start it was. San Francisco is just amazing. The hotel is situated in a good location with a few bars near. China town is just down the road and Macy's was just a block away. We picked up a hop off/ hop on tour bus from near the hotel (a must!!!!). There were 8 of us in our party which included 3x double 1 x single rooms.The staff are really friendly and although the hotel bar is quite expensive the staff are happy to advise on things to do and see. The rooms are quite big and furnished beautifully. The beds were especially comfortable - after a long flight they were just what was needed. I think for the price of the hotel and what you got I would definatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: david_trafford1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times and are going back again in May 2012. It is an excellent simple hotel, more aimed at American business travellers but is very accommodating and comforatable and well priced. Location is excellent just up the hill from Union Square and a couple of minutes walk from Chian Town, an excellent base for exploring teh city and beyond. The hotel staff are all excellent and very helpful. The restaurant is good for breakfast with a vast range of fare available.

Reviews.Title: “GLIB Tour”
Reviews.Author: BoroniaBoy
Reviews.Content: Really well positioned, courteous staff and comfortable rooms. This hotel is well worth your consideration.

Reviews.Title: “A little more effort would make a world of difference”
Reviews.Author: Zoobeefoo
Reviews.Content: With amazing consistency, the Orchard got things "almost" right. It's like being nickel and dimed to death - or death by 1000 small cuts! One pair of slippers, not two. Missing toiletries not replenished. No fitted sheet (the flat sheets used on the mattress were never quite big enough nor anchored quite well enough to prevent bunching up overnight). A single caffeinated coffee pod, so one person must choose decaf. An old goldfish cracker on the carpet. The location is superb, but the windows on our 6th floor were so filthy, it wasn't much fun to look out over the rooftops in what would otherwise have suggested a Parisian experience. The bathrooms are spacious with lovely tilework, but the floor was so sticky (seemed to be cleaning product, nothing worse, and more water applied - by us, using the bath linens - mostly ameliorated the problem) that it distracted from what would otherwise have been a great first impression. No bathmats scattered around to tempt you to stay longer - tile floors get pretty cold in San Fran in the winter! Not enough hangers. Worst of all, the free in-room internet never did work, despite multiple calls to the toll free number, the front desk, and our firm's help desk. That detail defeated our plan to begin our holiday a little early "because we can work from the hotel room." Think again. No internet service in San Franciso is pretty mind-boggling! We booked this hotel partly because the reviews consistently mention the wonderful staff. And it is true that this hotel is serviced by wonderful staff, without exception. Each person feels like a family member who you really like. The problem is that there are too few of them. Walk into the dining area at any time of day, and no host or hostess is there to greet and seat you. Eventually, someone can be summoned, but . . . death by a thousand cuts again! The TV or radio used by the dining staff competes with the music in the dining room, so every morning one must request that staff choose one or the other, not both. And the single dining room wait staff/host/manager might get in a long conversation with a visiting staff member and forget all about you, jarringly moving the experience from solicitous to abandoned. The food is, however, far superior to the crowded cafe next door, and the room is lovely. Sometimes there is a door man to hail a taxi, sometimes not. The noise outside picks up right at 5:00 a.m. each day, especially if you get a room close to the elevator bank. The price was good, but a little more consistency in the operations would make a world of difference and would have produced a return visit, but we're back to the Hotel Nikko next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Great Place to Stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: G C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was less than 1/2 the price of all the other name brands and was fabulous. Clean, clean rooms. Large room and bathroom. The doorman went out of his way to help and the front desk staff were terrific. During my 4 day stay, no less than 4 employees asked me how everything was and if I was enjoying my stay! Room service was prompt and courteous. No need for me to look any further on my next trip to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Good size rooms, and good service.”
Reviews.Author: bellmeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December and would definitely stay here again. The rooms are a good size, comfortable beds, good bathroom and efficient service. Didn't have dinner here but the breakfast was enjoyable. The location is fairly central, a tram stop just up the road as well as a 24 hour diner which we utilised one night.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: My_CelebTwin
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is on the top of the first very big hill on Powell street. We couldve taken the trolley up but just decided to hoof it up the hill (my calves are still sore). The room was cute and quaint and CLEAN. Im a freak about clean hotel rooms so this was a plus. Initially are view wasnt that great but they were courteous enough to give us a better room with a view of Powell/Bush street. The staff was nice. The valet was very nice as he let us leave our car for a few extra hours while we grabbed brunch upon checkout. The parking is friggin expensive @ $40/night. as are all the taxes and fees the lovely state of California applies. Overall i spent one night here and i would reccomend. Its close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “So Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bopeep2011
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Orchard and were pleased in every way. The staff was friendly and accomodating, the room and bathroom were large and very clean, and the beds and pillows were the perfect degree of softness. What could be better after walking all over SF during the day than to come back to such a quiet and comfortable room?

Reviews.Title: “Location...location...location...”
Reviews.Author: silveyk
Reviews.Content: Pros: On the border of Union Square, one block off Chinatown, and on the cable car line to North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf, The Orchard Hotel is perfectly positioned for a romantic weekend getaway. In terms of SF hotel room size, The Orchard's rooms are quite large and the bathrooms have been nicely remodeled. The hotel also has a library of movies that you can check-out for free. Cons: There was a mix up with beds. At reception we were told that to upgrade from double beds to a king-size bed we had to pay a stiff fee. Also, there were spitballs on our ceiling. I notified the front desk, and they were immediately removed (except one). I do not expect that either situation is common, just bad luck on our part. However, I did not like the mattress pad. It had a tendency to bunch up.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have made a better choice!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOE
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for work for 10 days and also keen to make the most of time in weekends for enjoying SF as it was my first visit. The hotel was perfect in every way. Great room and bathroom, absolutely quiet, and lovely eco products. Free wifi was a must for me for work and was totally reliable and speedy. I was seconds to the cable car, bus routes, and of course cabs. I could walk to ChinaTown, Union Square, Financial District and a fair radius in every direction around the hotel covering the main sites. As a woman returning home sometimes late at night after dinners, I felt totally safe getting back to the hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful with shuttles, information, room service etc. The two meals I had at the restaurant were excellent. I will definitely return here, and in fact can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lawflake
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orchard while attending a 2 day conference at the Presidio. The hotel is in a great location for seeing Chinatown and taking the famous SF Trolley to Fisherman Wharf or to Market Street. There are a lot of restaurants and convenience stores within an easy walk. The hotel room I was assigned was fresh and tidy and decorated in a serene manner. I have no complaints at all. The hotel is small but met all our needs. There is some street noise at night so if that is a problem bring your earplugs. I always carry mine but did not need to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MagicMoments_16
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at The Orchard Hotel. Firstly the location is fantastic - on the border of Union Square and Nob Hill. It is right near Powell St and the cable car line and very walkable to many sites. This is my second time back to San Fran and in my opinion this area is the best to stay. There are heaps of restaurants & bars in the vicinity and also some great shopping outlets. The hotel itself is boutique in nature in that it feels small and cosy (even though there are plenty of rooms). The service from the front desk & concierge was great and they were always willing to help. The rooms themselves are average in size (but not bad considering it is inner city San Fran) although I was impressed with the size & quality of the bathroom. The rooms have standard fittings and inclusions for a hotel of this rating. Being a smallish hotel, the restaurant and bar area aren't huge and there is no separate business centre in the hotel (although you can use a computer/printer in the foyer). Overall, I was impressed with the hotel and felt it delivered very good value for money. There are plenty of ordinary small cheapish places in San Fran and also plenty of really expensive hotels. The Orchard delivers a good compromise in a great location. I would stay there again. 4 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of luxurious calm”
Reviews.Author: MNtraveler1956
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult son, and I just spent a delightful three days in San Francisco at the well-located Orchard Hotel. We chose a suite, which was surprisingly large (so was the bathroom). Usually I request a room in a quiet spot, away from elevators and ice machines, but forgot this time. Although we were right next to both, the room was so well sound-proofed that nothing disturbed our sleep on one of the most comfortable beds we've ever slept in (our son reported that the sleeper sofa was "OK"). The room was very clean, the staff were friendly and helpful, and it was great to walk to Chinatown two blocks away (and a longer but do-able stroll to Fisherman's Wharf - or you can take the cable cars which run nearby). At $300 a night, the price is high, though it is described as a moderate hotel. I feel it does deserve its fine reputation. At the recommendation of one of the staff, we also enjoyed restaurant Plouf, one of the lively bistros of Belden Place alley a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice. Good Value. Something Extra”
Reviews.Author: DadFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night in late October. Very nice. Small, intimate hallways that don't run 1/2 mile. Room was large and comfortable. Our room had a 1/2 bay window that was very nice. Really liked the robes in the closet. Wished there was a mini fridge. Located right by Chinatown and a trolley stop goes right next to the hotel to take you down to Fisherman's Warf. Would love to have stayed longer and will return here next time. A very good value for a hotel in the Union Square Chinatown area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: BayRidgeGF
Reviews.Content: I go to SF on business a couple of times a year and always stay near Union Square, which to me is very centrally located. I had some good and bad experiences with hotels in the area, as the neighborhoods can change from good to bad quickly. This is a very good, reasonably priced (for SF) small hotel near Union Square. The place was clean and my room was of good size and quiet (my room was on the 4th floor and overlooked Bush Street). The bathroom was very big and looked brand new. The Orchard's website claims it is a "Luxury Boutique Hotel". Not sure I would go that far. The "luxury amenities" on the website include conceirge desk and newspaper in lobby. 'Nuff said. I used the fitness center, which was typical for a hotel (1 treadmill, one bike and one elliptical, I think, in a very small room). If you're there for more than 1-2 nights you might want to pay the fee for a day pass to a nearby gym. This is, however, a very good hotel. I walked to and from the BART station at Powell with my wheelie suitcase. And it is nice not to have to stand in a check-in/check-out line 8-10 people deep. The doorman, unlike another recent reviewer's experience, was very attentive and knowledgeable, and the check-in staff was efficient and helpful. I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to sty near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: froggyUK
Reviews.Content: A very decent place. Close to Union Square, but just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Downtown. Very quiet - although just a few steps way from busy Powell Street, very little street noise could be heard. Large, clean room and nice bathroom. Good to see that security was taken seriously - nipped back one lunchtime to drop some stuff off in my room and the maid was there cleaning. She made sure that I swiped my room key (even though the door was open) to make sure I was genuine. Friendly and helpful front desk staff too. Cable car stop just round the corner and even with my fairly easy (but uphill) walk up from the BART station at Powell and Market .

Reviews.Title: “pretty awesome”
Reviews.Author: LombyF
Reviews.Content: Huge room. Huge bathroom. Awesome staff. Great food. Cool Location. Thanks :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: jeachi
Reviews.Content: Definitely highly recommend this hotel. Great rooms (only complaint is pillows were too soft, but that is a personal preference), fabulous location- walking distance of union square, with cable car stop just outside the hotel (just literally around the corner) and its the cable car line going to fisherman's wharf and Lombard street (uphill) or union square (downhill).

Reviews.Title: “A good spot in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: DWJAustin
Reviews.Content: Close to Chinatown and cable car and walking distance to Bart stations. Rooms are big, clean, and have great baths. The restaurant has limited hours and is "dead" but the place next door is great for breakfast. Not a romantic place, but comfortable and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: Anchored
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel in an excellent location . The rooms were clean, good-sized, and well appointed. My husband and I were both surprised at how comfy the beds were! The front desk and concierge staff were very helpful and welcoming. We didn't try the restaurant during our stay b/c San Fran has so many other awesome ones to choose from. The only negative for us was our proximity to the cable car line. The bells were ringing constantly! It might be helpful to take that factor into account when requesting a room.

Reviews.Title: “Union Square Gem”
Reviews.Author: TrailBlazer_7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orchard for four days on vacation. It's clean, quiet and modern. Our room faced Bush St., which is very busy; however, we were on the top (10th) floor and traffic noise was minimal. The location can't be beat. It's near Union Square and Chinatown, at the intersection of Bush and Powell Streets. It's six blocks uphill from the Powell St. cable car turnaround and two blocks from the Chinatown Gate on Bush and Grant. My only negative comments about the hotel are that there was no microwave oven in our room, and that the mini-bar (fridge) was packed with way-overpriced drinks and snacks. There are no guest vending machines in the hotel, but there is a 24-hour Walgreens one block away on Powell and Sutter. Resist the urge to pop open a $2.50 can of Diet Pepsi and walk two minutes to Walgreens where you can buy one for less than a dollar. And it's California, so you can buy beer, wine and hard booze there too if that's your thing. There is a restaurant in the hotel. It's called the Daffodil, and we ate breakfast there one morning. One word: Overpriced. $34 for mediocre fare that we could have gotten for less than half that price at Denny's, and it would have been far better. I mean, $3 for a (small) cup of tea? Gimme a break. For dinner, cross the street and go to Uncle Vito's Pizzeria. I'm Italian, so trust me on this - that was some wicked good pizza. We had enough left over for breakfast the next morning and it cost only $25.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice surprise and very nice people”
Reviews.Author: 4Tigger
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I) just spend last night at The Orchard Hotel and were very pleasantly surprised by how darned nice it was. Normally we stay at the Golden Gate or White Swan, but they were all booked up with the surgeon's convention in town. The folks at the Golden Gate suggested we try The Orchard, and I'm glad they did. We also read the reviews here on T.A. to triangulate. It is more expensive than the others ($279/night), but the rooms are larger and updated with all the amenities you would expect... this was a romantic theater get away, so it was worth the extra bucks. First, it's very easy to pull up in front of the hotel as they have a loading zone with their valet standing by. Even if you are not using their valet parking, you can stop and unload your car. BTW, there are a couple of parking lots on Bush within close proximity if you don't want to spend $40/24 hours for their valet parking. We did use their parking however, and it was quite convenient. I have to say that Cornell, the valet this morning, already had our car waiting for us before we even called... pretty cool. We found that everyone who worked for the hotel (the ones we encountered) were all very nice and could not do enough to help. Okay, so you expect employees at a good hotel to show good manners, but there was nothing forced -- Ariel and the rest all seem to like their jobs, their customers and the hotel, and they show it. As I mentioned, our room was larger than we expected, and well decorated, clean and inviting. The bathroom was also quite large, well lit and fitted up with excellent towels and products. Their robes were a treat and the bed was very comfortable. There was equipment for making coffee and a mini bar (which we did not use, so I cannot comment on the rate.) Based on feedback on T.A., we requested and received, a room on a high floor at the back. The view down was not so great, but across was quite good. No noise problems at all. As others mention, The Orchard is very well located, within walking distance of most everything you want to do in the City: shopping, dining, theater, people watching... it's even close to the cable cars. So thank you The Orchard, for making this a wonderful weekend!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: pinglosangeles
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really charming and welcoming. Enjoyed our stay very much. The location is just a couple of blocks from Union Square and is on two different cable car lines so it's very convenient. Considering the location it was actually pretty quiet at night. We were on the Bush Street side, away from the cable car lines and on the ninth floor so that helped. There is a little cafe next door to the hotel that is very good for breakfast and reasonable. Also, down the street is the Cable Car Cafe...also very good for breakfast. Quite a few restaurants within a few blocks that are worth a try. The dining room at the hotel was always empty. Seemed quite overpriced. Parking is of course expensive...as usual in San Francisco. But there was a public parking lot about a half block away. Don't know their rates. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place in a great city”
Reviews.Author: robertop76
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 3 nights in Frisco and 3 night in Orchard Hotel. It's location is perfect 'cause is close to Union Square and close to cable car stop useful to go in the Pier area.At the lobby people are very kind and the rooms are big and clean.Despite the location (in the center of the city) you can't hear some noise. Really good choise.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy hotel in a great location. We made a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Ravyboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel, Bush Street, San Francisco for 9 nights in October. We had never visited SF before (we live in New Zealand) so we did our homework before booking. What a good choice we made. We enjoyed our stay at the Orchard. Check-in was a breeze, even though we arrived about 10am (check-out was easy too). The room we got was on the 6th floor and was surprisingly large, tastefully furnished with a big modern bathroom. It was clean and the bed was very comfortable, and it had an in-room safety box which was easy to use. A big plus was the free wireless internet. We found this to be immensely useful because we could use our laptop to look up places to visit and find places to eat. And there are plenty near this hotel. Which is one of the Orchard's major good points – its location. It is a 5 minute walk to Union Square with all its shopping and bustle. It also has a cable car stop right outside the door on Powell Street. However, if you are moderately energetic (and don’t mind hills) you can walk to the waterfront for Fisherman’s Wharf, Pier 39 and so on. Great views on the way too. Our room overlooked the front of the hotel on busy Bush Street with the cable cars rumbling up and down Powell Street nearby. We initially thought it might be noisy. But we were amazed – it did not bother us. And we both hate noise. After a day or two we didn’t hear it, even at night. The area around the hotel felt safe. Not once did we feel threatened or even uncomfortable. Can't say the same for some other parts of SF. And lastly, we want to thank the staff. They were great. Attentive but not overpowering. They were there when we needed them and answered all our questions. The front desk staff were nice and friendly, the concierge was very helpful (get him to organise the car to go to the airport – it was great) and the maid service was very quick and thorough. Did we have any grumbles? Yes, but they were minor. The windows were dirty (big city grime?) and there was no way to boil water other than for coffee (we drink tea and water boiled in a coffee maker tastes like coffee no matter how much you rinse it). And their TV was a bit ancient - a flat screen would be nice (although there is so much to do in SF that watching TV is not top of mind). We thought their breakfast was average – they could do better – so we only tried it once. There are lots of other places to eat nearby. This is a very good good hotel in a great location. It is safe, quiet and leisurely. It was a big part of a vacation we really enjoyed. Thanks Orchard - we will stay again. And thanks San Francisco. Your city is great.

Reviews.Title: “October Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maynards
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is an excellent location for tourists located at the top of a steep hill from Union Square and near the best shopping area! Next door is a great cafe for breakfast and the cable car is near on Powell Street...fabulous! So why did I give this hotel only a three (average) rating...well little things add up and need to be balanced against a fairly high cost per night.."little issues" are... often cool showers in the morning, a "sensitive" toilet, wifi not at modern business level standards/ no real business centre available, a "funky" elevator that took me on a few unexpected trips up and down many floors, limited coffee/tea supplies in the room...ok... as I said... small things add up....but if that's not an issue for you...location is great and staff try hard!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Robert K
Reviews.Content: There was a business convention on that week and all the well known hotels were booked out. Selected the Orchard after a lot of research. Seemed expensive, but I guess they all are. The hotel is not huge, with a small dining room which we didn't happen to use. That didn't bother us since eating out was easy, lots of choice, and much more interesting. Our bedroom was clean, very comfortable and surprisingly spacious. The bathroom was well sized and looked like it had been refurbished recently. Staff were friendly and helpful, a welcome contrast to what we've experienced in other US hotels. Location is great, just 2 blocks from Union Square and right beside the cable car route - a great way to avoid walking up the steep hills and for getting to the Wharf (a multi-day pass is best value). Buses and trams run from one block away. We really enjoyed San Francisco. Sure it's got the hobos and the dodgey areas, but that's what makes it real, and interesting. A great city to visit. Take the boat trip to Alcatraz, -good value and well organised.

Reviews.Title: “Very restful nights”
Reviews.Author: Monika35
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and quiet, the beds are comfortable and the location is excellent. Our room faced the street. We took public transportation everywhere and the four block walk was easy, just take the Montgomery station exit. Starbucks is on the corner and China town is next door. This is a LEEDS hotel and it felt good to feel a part of the solution. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: LCB33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel and really enjoyed our stay. The staff were helpful and friendly, the room very clean and comfortable. Bathroom was lovely. Close proximity to everything but be prepared for a steep walk uphill! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: LondonHoppers
Reviews.Content: Positives: Great location: central and very near buses and the trams up to the bay area. Good hotel, very clean and large rooms, with good sized bathroom. I didn't feel like the rooms had masses of character, but they had everything you needed, including wifi. Staff were helpful. Negatives: It was expensive (and our rate didn't include breakfast), though most hotels in San Fran were pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: naylorwilliam
Reviews.Content: Great Location My wife and i stayed in this Hotel for 5 nights in October and i must say this is one of the better hotels ,Location ,Service ,and comfort all you need for a city trip ,would recommend to any traveler

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: AmyLeeSydney
Reviews.Content: What a classic and stylish room this was. It was large in size and super clean. The bathroom was almost as big as a standard hotel room in Manhattan! The location of the hotel was pretty good as well. Walking distance to downtown. We found lots of reasonably priced food options in the food court at the Westfield centre. While San Francisco itself was much dirtier and with a whole lot more homeless people than I remember, this hotel was lovely. I can honestly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Well located & appointed, with some quirks.”
Reviews.Author: COSouthpaw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights at the Orchard just a few days ago. We selected the Orchard as we wanted to be in the center of the city, away from the tourist trap of the wharf and piers. We selected the Orcahrd based off other reviews and after viewing the Hotel's Web site. We booked via hotels.com. Please keep in mind, our review is based off how we travel: we just are after a nice, basic hotel and primarily need a bed, hot shower and bathroom. We don't spend much awake time in a hotel while on vacation. Our room was clean (no bed bugs after inspection), king bed, eletronic safe (that passed the 0000 and 1234 test) and decent sized bathroom. There was no fan in the bathroom and the shower was a tub-based shower with curtain. The grout/caulking was in need for a good scrubbing. Not a deal breaker by any means. The hotel loves to market itself as a 'green or eco' hotel, however the room had no much areas to place plastic bottles, newspapers seperate from the standard trash. Housekeeping may do this, but we made it a point to have those items on the desk with a note asking them to do so. TV was a CRT or non flat screen. Not a big deal for us. The front desk had a DVD collection you could borrow. Oh, no real lobby area if you like to read, drink tea, relax, etc. The room also had a 'sleep CD.' USE IT! Very relaxing and assisted with catching some REM sleep. Speaking of which, this hotel is in a major U.S. city, if you are expecting complete silence, you picked the wrong city to visit. Expect police and fire sirens to happen once or twice a night. Chinatown is two blocks down on Bush. After dropping about $40 (for two) at a nearby diner on morning one, I walked and got a pork steamed bun at a Chinese bakery for $1.10 on morning two. Score. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant. You will find more Walgreen's, Wells Fargo's and Starbucks in this town than anything else. All were within two blocks of the hotel. While more about the city than the hotel, don't support the hobo's. They will be everywhere. (Avoid Market St and the Tenderloin or TL.) In all, we would recommend the Orchard if you travel like we do: drop off luggage, hit the destinations and return to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, easy to get around”
Reviews.Author: OZZYJT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel for 3 nights in September. The hotel is in a fantastic location with the trolley car right outside of the front door. A 10 minute stroll down the hill will bring you to Union Square and Westfields, coming back is another thing though, if you are keen to line up for the trolley car (it can take up to an hour to board) thats the easy way to get back, otherwise walk up a couple of blocks and the trolley car will stop at the corner for you to board. The room is very spacious, a bit dated (I cant remember the last time I saw a square TV (not flat screen)) A flat screen would really update the room, but hey its not everything. Its a very quaint hotel and it has so much charm. The staff are really friendly and help out where they can. The restaurant attached to the hotel is questionable, we had breakfast the first morning and it was ordinary to say the least, the buffet breakfast ($16) is very basic and put me off, the scrambled eggs look like they had been there from the night before. There are heaps of other restaurants is the general vicinity and Loris Diner across from Wallgreens (100m away) is excellent, it really does bring the good old days back. Overall if you want to stay around Union Square this is a great hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: auntie-ellie-22
Reviews.Content: We did alot of research into hotels in San Francisco before we decided on this hotel and booked it because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed, The location was excellent and we walked everywhere and felt safe doing so. The room was so clean and comfortable. We were on the third floor on the front of the hotel and we slept fine. We found everything about this hotel excellent.

Reviews.Title: “ahhhhh...it does exist”
Reviews.Author: aprilnightrain
Reviews.Content: Almost forgot we were in a hotel! No crowds, friendly, highly efficient staff, beautiful decor (explosions of fresh orchids everwhere). This small, sweet sactuary offered absolute silence in it's well appointed, clean, modern, peaceful, lovely room. Super comfortable beds (though I recommend asking for a flat pillow if that's your preference, these were a bit on the fluffy side) lighting in all the right places, cordless phone (not that we had to use it to call them to fix anything) and bonus: the fan doesn't come on when you turn on the bathroom light! Coffee pot for making tea (no leftover coffee flavor) great location, desk with outlets for the computer...everything perfect! Only drawback: being a small, almost boutique style hotel, room service closes at 9 pm. Less expensive than the dreaded Park 55, it's the best deal I've come across in a long while. Thank-you Hotel Gods.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: gcallanan70
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant stay at the Orchard but it is an average business hotel. Don't expect anything more than that, I think the Tripadvisor reviews are a little misleading. Oh and the windows could do with a clean!

Reviews.Title: “A great location to stay”
Reviews.Author: Beverly S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard for 4 nights recently and the location is very central to everything. We were allocated a large room on the 10th floor - this cut out the traffic noise but there was obviously an airconditioning unit in the roof and we were a little distubed at night by the background droning - perhaps the 9th floor would be perfect. The room was really comfortable, with all amenities and the bathroom was huge. The hotel were aware it was my 50th birthday (upgrade would have been good) but provided a small box of chocolates.We did not eat in the hotel but around the corner was a ittle cafe called the Cable Car Diner - perfect for breakfast - we went there twice. On the last morning we ate breakfast at Sears (queues for here most days) but the cable car diner was far superior and much better value. We were advised to buy a 3 day pass for public transport and the queue at the kiosk end of Powell Street was an hour long - we decided to walk al the way down Market Street to the Ferry Building (luckily it was Sat and there was a farmers market - held Tues Thurs Sat) where we were able to buy a pass for public transport from a shop just inside the building to the right for $21 with no queue.We ate one night at the Nob Hill Cafe (don't be put off by the word cafe - more of an up market bistro full of locals) which I would highly recommend - turn right on Powell up the hill to Grace Cathedral, turn right in front of the Cathedral and it is on he right hand side as you walk downn the hill. I would return to the Orchard for it's chic appeal and fantastic central position.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and central to everything”
Reviews.Author: bostonmeg127
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard and were pleasantly surprised by the sleek modern rooms and environmentally friendly products! Staff were very accommodating and knowledgeable and made sure we had directions to wherever we were going. Loved the little French bistro, Cafe de la Presse next door for breakfast and cocktails. Easy access to all the major attractions; would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: Cat_from_rome
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Orchard hotel for one night in two separate occasions, and i wish we had more! The first night they upgraded us into a suite, that was huge and very nice, the second night we stayed in a standard room, still very nice. The location is fantastic to walk around in the city center, breakfast was very nice, the staff was very helpful. It was particularly convenient to arrive there by car, since you can leave the car with them and they sort out the parking. We definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CASTLEFOX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. The room and bathroom were large and clean. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a good location a short walk from Union Square. There is an great cafe round the corner on Powell Street called The Cable Car cafe - the blueberry and fruit breakfast crepe is to die for and the coffee is excellent. There is also a nice Mexican round the same corner on the opposite side.

Reviews.Title: “look no further!”
Reviews.Author: littlemiss77
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on many hotels in San Francisco before choosing the orchard hotel and i must say that this hotel exceeded all my expectations! The rooms look the same as they do in all the photographs. They are very spacious. The king bed was extremely comfortable and turned down for us daily. The bathroom and the shower are very private and spacious as well. The overall cleanliness of this hotel is exceptional. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is dining inside the hotel. Unfortunately, we did not eat there so i can not comment on the quality. It is located in a safe area, right in the center of downtown Union Square. Walking distance to shopping and dining. It is only a few blocks away from the bart system, which we used to take us to and from the airport. The cable car museum is located right across the street and it is only a few blocks walking distance for rental car access. We used city rent -a- car located on 1433 bush st. and spent the day touring the Muir Woods and wine country. Very great experience, highly recommend it to anyone who is looking to get out of the city for the day! I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay again if ever in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well priced and perfectly located and QUIET.”
Reviews.Author: phytowoman
Reviews.Content: Should I return to SF in the future I would stay again .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, excellent service, perfect neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jdhollinger
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The service was excellent from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. The room was clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is perfect for one who wants easy access to all that San Francisco has to offer. And the price was right, too. Excellent value! Will definitely stay at the Orchard Hotel the next time I am in San Francisco, whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “We hated it and will never come back”
Reviews.Author: Raven_Lenore
Reviews.Content: When we arrived it was obvious our toilet had not been cleaned. We didn't say anything, left for sightseeing, came back and someone had obviously been in the room, apparently cleaning. So we went to shower and one of the "clean" towels was covered with dryed on stains, really gross. The coffee bar didn't have coffee, we had to ask for it, two nights in a row. The robe had a torn loop. Checkout took FOREVER. We could never get a manager. When we complained they offered us an item from the mini bar...whatever. It was gross.

Reviews.Title: “Return trip as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: JKFRadnor_PA
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Orchard in August 2010. Loved the spacious suite and convenient location for walking, cable cars and BART. In August 2011 we returned to visit the spots in San Francisco we missed. Of course the Orchard was our choice and did not disappoint! The ameneties, i.e., refrigerator/wet bar, 2 rooms, cleanliness, polite and helpful service , huge bathroom and comfortable beds make the Orchard an incredible value and luxurious stay. Will not stay anywhere else in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “The service is horrible”
Reviews.Author: YJonesy627
Reviews.Content: I actually didn't stay in this hotel.. I pulled up to valet (due to there not being easy parking close by). And the guy gave me the finger to hold on so he could finish his conversation.. Very rude. When we went to check in (after we decided to park in a lot down the street) they said they couldn't find our reservation. They didn't offer to get a us room at the current rate or anything. We left. Customer service is just unbelievably bad here, do not stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic in the Heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: Zoono
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered everything we wanted for a city stay - top quality service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Outsource
Reviews.Content: A reasonably priced hotel in a great location. It is a "green" certified hotel so the water saver shower takes some getting used to, but service was great, room was great. Couldn't ask for much better. If you need a quick dinner, Uncle Vito's accross the street is some of the best pizza I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: OLLIEATBONNYS
Reviews.Content: Efficent, Friendly staff, Clean room , great housekeeping. Comfortable beds, good linen, exactly as pictured. Centrally located to transport, cable cars meters from door, shopping, restaurants, bars, Chinatown all within walking distance, even Fishermans Wharf if you can walk 2 blocks uphill as the rest is downhill. Mature aged couple on first time visit to the city. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is brilliant for seeing SF”
Reviews.Author: IrishOllie
Reviews.Content: Well located for sightseeing in SF. Hotel was in a good area and felt safe even at 11pm when walking back from dinner. Rooms are well decorated and comfortable. Staff were polite but if you're looking for friendly, chit-chatty staff this is not the hotel to choose. However I would stay here again while in SF as it is so close to everything and the rooms are nicely presented.

Reviews.Title: “Nice union square location”
Reviews.Author: david j
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the middle of a VERY steep hill, so the short downhill walk to Union Square and the slightly longer walk to the BART is fine. It's walking back up that VERY steep hill that can be a bit of a pain.

Reviews.Title: “walked to everything”
Reviews.Author: coco091
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I spent two nights sightseeing in San Francisco. Once we checked our car at this hote,l we were able to walk to most of the places we wanted to see. It is close to Union Square, theaters, great places to shop and eat. The service was personal and friendly and we enjoyed our room. The little restaurant, Daffodil, was perfect for dinner before a show. The staff gave great advice. I will stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel~ Big Rooms for the Area”
Reviews.Author: DrewCrew_515
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to stay at the Orchard, while the rest of our buddies in the bachelor party were staying at the Grant Plaza (Based on Tripadvisor Reviews). We pulled up to the door and the friendly bellmen asked if we were staying here or at the Orchard Park hotel a couple blocks down. (Sister property two blocks down). Doubting ourselves we soon found out we were registered at the Orchard Park, well since we were there, we just asked if we cold stay ther... after a call to the sister property everything was a go! So right off the bat, GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE. Once up in the room, I was pleasantly surpirsed at the size of the room and bathroom, being that I have stayed in the area before (Hotel Triton) and the room and bathroom size were not so generous. Furthe confirmed, once we went to our buddies hotel (Grant Plaza) and found that the room was TINY, open the door and almost hit bed, barely enough room to walk to the TINY bathroom. The beds in the Orchard were comfortable, the AC worked great. SMALL TIP- CHECK OUT UNCLE VINNYS ACROSS THE STREET! AWESOME, we just went to grab a bite for lunch, not knowing the reviews on tripadvisor, and the reviews are right on! Excellant food.

Reviews.Title: “The kind of service every hotel should have”
Reviews.Author: BigRed1979
Reviews.Content: After spending lots of time looking for somewhere to stay, I decided to go with the Orchard. I was not disappointed, and found this to be one of the best places I stayed in 4 months of travelling the world. The people there gave exceptional advice and service whenever I needed it, and the room was clean, spacious and very comfortable, with every amenity I needed. Plus, there were little extra touches like having free DVD rental at reception. If there are any cons, I would say that 1) there is no view; and 2) the cable car (which passes right by the front) can be loud at night or early in the morning if you have a room facing Bush St. But neither of these should detract from what was an amazing experience and a great hotel. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special and it doesn't worth to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mehmetbugra
Reviews.Content: It was a standart, low level city hotel. Rooms are spacious but some of them ( maybe half of them) have no city view. If you like backyard view and garbage containers it's ok :) Aaand the most important detail; If you want to use hotel parking and valet service, they are charging usd 45 for one night!! (including tax). no comment, you can guess what i thought about them. So, recalculate the actual cost of room. But, the location was perfect. Next to the cable car station and one minute walking distance from union square. I think you have options...

Reviews.Title: “Very NIce Boutique Hotel-Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: wwman
Reviews.Content: My Family stayed 4 nights in 2 rooms. The hotel was spotless. The staff could not be friendlier. The location is great. 2 blocks from Union Square. 2 blocks from Chinatown, and right by the Powell and Mason cable car line. It is near good restaurents. Our rooms were very large and comfortable. Most importantly, the room was very quiet. On our last trip to SF we stayed at the Fairmont. It was very noisy and musty. This hotel was also 100% green which was nice. The hotel was built in 2000, so everything was up-to-date. The beds were also very comfortable. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: heston55
Reviews.Content: A charming little hotel on the doorstep of Chinatown. Staff were very welcoming and always smiling, no matter what time we came back at night. Quick valet service allowed us to get our car within usually under 5 minutes of requesting it. Rooms are large with a nice view to the street. Great coffee (and nice French cuisine) just across the road. Good to know they are environmentally conscious too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: 3Bucci
Reviews.Content: After checking reviews on trip-advisor and much deliberation we choose The Orchard Hotel for our San Francisco vacation. It turned out to be an excellent choice. The location was ideal, within walking distance of Union Square, Chinatown, the North End and the Powell Street Trolley, Bart and Muni. The staff, without exception, were extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel was attractive, clean and the rooms were more than an adequate size. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend the Orchard Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: magkat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to San Francisco along with my sister and her husband for a lovely few days of child free time. After much research and debate I selected the Orchard Hotel. I booked our rooms directly through the hotel to insure that we got the exact room type we were looking for. The rates were comparable to what I found on line. We stayed in a standard king room. The room was on the smaller side, but well decorated and had all we were looking for. The bathroom was quite large and had a nice selection of toiletries. The bed was very comfortable and the room was nice and quiet. The location of this hotel is the real stand out for me. Very close to Union Square and walking distance to just about everything. Having said that we knew we didn't want to walk to and from the wharf so we took the cable car when it was quiet in the morning and walked back to the hotel in the evening. Since the hotel is on a quieter street, street noise was not a problem in our room. Staff was helpful and friendly and check in/out was efficient. We made use of the house car for our trip to the airport. For $45 it was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend the Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TandPToronto
Reviews.Content: Once again TripAdvisor’s recommendations were spot on. My wife and I had a fabulous time staying at the Orchard Hotel. The hotel deserves its high rating. Location Location Location- you're walking minutes away from Union Square, Chinatown and the Westfield shopping centre. The cable car stops right at the intersection of Bush and Powell, so access to Fisherman’s Wharf is easy. My wife and I took a day trip to Sonoma/Napa Valley and the Avis location to pick up a car was just a few blocks from the hotel. Although parking at any hotel is very expensive in San Francisco, this was offset by parking just a block away at the Stockton garage. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. We requested via e-mail a high room and away from Powell Street. We were very pleasantly surprised upon check-in that not only did they acknowledge the request, but that that they were able to accommodate it as well. The bathroom was huge and clean. There is a mini-fridge in the room as well. Also, wi-fi is available in the room, which was important to us as we have a phone that is wi-fi enabled but without a data plan, meaning that we have access to internet and e-mail only via free wi-fi. The front staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The cleaning staff did a fantastic job every day. The doorman, Cornell, was exceptionally professional, courteous and full of great suggestions as to what bus to take, where to eat and where to visit. One of the best things we did while planning our trip to SF was to buy a CityPass. It gave us unlimited use of Muni & Cable Car for 7 days plus admission to the California Academy of Sciences, Blue & Gold Fleet Bay Cruise, Aquarium of the Bay at Fisherman’s Wharf, the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art (SFMOMA) and the de Young Museum (which we chose over the Exploratorium). The CityPass is well worth the $69, but a really good tip for you is that if you purchase it directly from alcatrazcruises.com, for the same price you can exchange the Blue & Gold Fleet Bay Cruise for an actual tour of Alcatraz prison. Also, if you want to visit Alcatraz, book it in advance as you will probably not be able to get a ticket if you just show up to the ticket counter. It can sell out several weeks in advance. We would definitely go back to the Orchard Hotel as the location was fantastic and the room and staff were impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and would recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: cwm_2355
Reviews.Content: After doing a ton of research on Trip Advisor I decided to book with Orchard Hotel (it didn't hurt they had a room sale for the dates I wanted to stay). Aside from a few minor annoyances (noted below), we had a great time staying here. Pros: Location location - you're blocks away from Union Square and Westfield shopping centre, and there's a street car stop literally outside the hotel. Another bonus for us was the Walgreens a block away, as well as the Starbucks across the street from it. Convenience is a huge plus Staff - all very nice. Front desk clerk cleared up an error that was made with my room rate on my reservation. We were always greeted with a smile and a hello whenever we got out of the elevator, and never had any issues or problems with anyone who worked there. Comfort - rooms were big and spacious, the bed and sheets/pillows were very comfy (many naps were taken after shopping trips) and the bathroom was clean and definitely large enough for both of us to get ready. Cons: Noise - Walls seemed kind of thin, we could hear noises from the room beside ours. Also, there was this strange beeping noise that would constantly go off in the middle of the night. Definitely didn't come from our electronics, seemed like it was the walls or ceilings. Lots of street noise as well, even though we requested a quiet room. Cost of parking - This was almost a dealbreaker for me, it's $45 per 24 hours and that's pretty steep. 4 nights there added $180 to our bill, but what can you do? Overall I would definitely go back. It was nice actually being a few blocks away from Union Square, but close enough to walk down when we wanted to. It was a very pleasant time and other than the things I noted above, I didn't have any issues at all.

Reviews.Title: “spot on all round”
Reviews.Author: samdixey2001
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent right on the tram network. The staff were very attentive and helpful especially as we had to drop off our bags in a hurry and take the hire car back. The doorman was the best of our whole trip and couldn't do enough for us. I do like the odd suggestion without being asked, especially with the limo to the airport at the end of our stay, which worked out cheaper than a cab. The room was large with a view, very clean and well appointed with plenty of facilities. We didn't eat in the restaurant but had a few leaving drinks in the bar. The barman and excellent service extended to the bar area and reception. Can't think of any faults here, give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: johnaaronmartin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the staff friendly, and the location can't be beat. If visiting the city use the Muni. Get a 3 or 7 day pass. Ride the cable car at least once and then ditch it for the F-line, bus, train - anything. You'll save a lot of time. Surrounded by diverse opportunities for a unique culinary experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MumTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of July/early Aug, as a family. We had two interconnecting rooms, one with a king bed and one with two doubles. As mentioned in other reviews here, the rooms are very comfortable, beds are very cosy and the hypo-allergenic pillows are the comfiest I have ever met. We chose this hotel really for its location - 2 blocks from Union Square, right on the edge of China Town, and close to all the transport links for getting everywhere else. The staff are very friendly and efficient, door staff especially coming forward with suggestions of places to go, nice bars to visit etc. We didn't eat at the hotel - we did have a breakfast at Sears, as per one of the reviews here and that was very good, but we preferred the Cafe de la Presse (more expensive than Sears which is saying something) as they offer a good range of French bakery as well as the American classics for breakfast. We loved the tour of Alcatraz, do take the audio tour - it is truly excellent even if you don't normally like audio tours, and we were lucky enough to be there on a day when they had an ex-inmate giving a talk about life in the prison. If we come back to San Francisco, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AKQ
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent stay in the Orchard Hotel. Rooms are spacious with very comfortable bed. Bathroom was larger than average with walk in shower and very nice toiletries. Hotel was spotlessley clean and in a great location for Union square, shopping etc., although it is situated at the top of a hill. There is a trolley stop close by. Front desk staff and especially concierge were very helpful and pleasent. We would certainly stay here again. Tip: Fantastic breakfast in Sears two blocks from hotel. Enjoyed tour of Alcatraz and pier 39.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked The Orchard.”
Reviews.Author: artnak
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at The Orchard and we were very pleased. Great location 2 blocks from Union Square, with lots of dining and shopping options close by. Cable car is right outside on Powell St, which was a really nice way to get to fisherman's wharf. Get a transportation passport which gives you access to buses, cable cars, trains, etc., good value for getting around the city ... trust me when I say that the hills can be very steep for walking after a long day of sightseeing. Price was good value for a downtown hotel and we found the room to be a good size and very clean. Beds & linens were very comfortable. We stayed in room 705 and the housekeeping was excellent, room was made while we were out for breakfast and turned down while at dinner. Doormen and front desk staff always greeted us when we came in or went out. Elevators were quick. We really enjoyed our stay at The Orchard and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again the next time we are in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value "Green" Hotel On Bush Street”
Reviews.Author: azulstar
Reviews.Content: Have enjoyed several stays at The Orchard Hotel which enjoys a good location on Bush Street two blocks above Union Square. The rooms are comfortable, attractive and moderately priced. They use hypoallergenic cleaning products, forbid smoking and meet the standards of chemically sensitive guests like ourselves. While the healthy choice restaurant on the ground floor has never appealed to us, Roxanne's Cafe fourty steps away on the corner at Powell is one of our favorite local places for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The cable car also runs on Powell which provides convenient transportation up and down the big hills when needed. We also like The Orchard's proximity to the Grand Hyatt on Sutter which has a top floor restaurant and bar area providing commanding views of the city and Bay in addition to a good menu. We have many breakfasts there and don't mind the two block walk downhill for a convenient meal in a congenial setting.
