The Orchard fulfills all the basic comfort requirements admirably (hair dryers, robes and nice marble bathrooms) and the staff is polite and friendly. The suites have TVs in both the bedroom and sitting area which provide nice viewing alternatives. We also make use of the DVD player in the room by bringing a collection of our favorite movies from home since we find the local cable selection a little thin. The Orchard is a competently managed mid-tier hotel and an enjoyable place to stay. In the only incident where we had cause for complaint, the management addressed the problem expeditiously and completely satisfied us with their response. We will undoubtedly stay there again. It should be noted that the same company also owns a property called "The Orchard Garden Hotel" a coupe of blocks further down Bush Street. This review is not about that property and guests should be careful to direct their cab drivers to the correct address (665 Bush Street) lest they find themselves unrecognized at check-in (as happened to my son at Christmas).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer090
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally located for all we wanted to do. Union Square just down the hill, China Town on your door-step. Within easy walking diatance of Pier 39 and close to the cable car. The good bus links got us to the museums. Had one meal in the restaurant which was of a high standard. Choose to park your own car rather than use the valet parking. the Stockton garage is only two blocks away and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Dcm1000
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised by all the high reviews here. Other than the location, there is nothing that great about this place. The staff are too busy to ever help out, the parking adds $45 a day to the price, and there are no views at all. Plus there is a garbage truck making heaps of noise outside twice a night. Ok place to stay if you want shopping and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: loosygoose
Reviews.Content: We would agree with all of the good things that other reviewers have said. The location is really central and lends itself to easy transit access (including cable cars) and lots of interesting walks. The only downside was poor service we had at breakfast time in the hotel restaurant. It was so bad, we were looking for the hidden camera. The waiter was apparently unhappy about us wanting the express breakfast, so he put us at a dirty table (in an otherwise empty restaurant), and repeatedly told us that we could only have TWO items (I guess we looked like sneaky types). We chose to not go back which was not a hardship given all the great food choices in San Francisco. However, we would go back to the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Boutique”
Reviews.Author: margaretm56
Reviews.Content: Loved the Orchard Hotel. 2 short blocks to Union Square. On the Powell Street cable car line. Very quiet in a downtown neighborhood. Easily walked to Union Square, Chinatown and the Financial district. Great price, luxurious bedding and bath. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: paulie80
Reviews.Content: My wife and i are travelling the west coast of the US and our first stop was San Fran a place i did not want to leave, our hotel for 4 nights was the Orchard Hotel which was perfect in every way, the staff were very friendly and helpful and with a 2min walk to union square and a cable car outside the door what else could you ask for ? the rooms are very spacious and clean but the most important thing when your staying anywhere is its very quiet at night . The rooms are cleaned daily and if and when i return i will be staying in the same place, the location has everything shopping, restaurants, tour buses all a few min walk ,, hope this helps guys

Reviews.Title: “Only one disappointment”
Reviews.Author: alisonthwaite
Reviews.Content: Overall we found this hotel to be very good. Room was clean and well equpped and the staff were helpful and friendly. Location is excellent, only a 2 minute walk from Union Square and a twenty minute walk to the seafront (with the option to walk a flatter, less tiring route through the financial district). The only thing that spoilt it for us was that on the first morning of our stay, 12th June, we had breakfast in the hotel restaurant and, after paying over $50/£32 for two hot breakfasts (bacon, 2 eggs, potatoes and toast) we were called in our hotel room by the waiter who served us asking for a gratuity (tip) I found this very shocking and also very cheeky. As we were staying for 4 days, we decided immediately that we would not use the restaurant again. I am happy to tip for excellent service or anything over and above someone simply doing there job but as we only received competent service and as I picked up the $10 that the waiter had un knowingly dropped and returned it to him, I felt very let down that he would have done such a thing. I brought this up with the hotel staff when we left and asked that it be passed on to the hotel manager. Haven't heard the outcome yet . . . Anyway, apart from that incident it was an enjoyable stay and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Architectandmusician
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant hotel, well located near Union Square. Rooms are unremarkable and the decor a bit dated but quite acceptable. Front desk staff were helpful. At the time of writing this review it was well-priced compared to competition in the neighborhood. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: TomTraveler12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently on a business trip. It is a small hotel but the rooms are good sized and in excellent, clean condition. Very close to Union Square, but can be a bit of a hike if you are traveling (uphill) from the nearest BART station. Very good value for the price. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but I did not try it as there are some many great restaurants in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location - Centralized to Every District!”
Reviews.Author: prettyinpink4743
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here the morning I was checking in, and that was very fortunate for me! I found a cheaper rate on hotels.com that the hotel honored without hesitation. Upon arrival, my friend & i were pleasantly surprised by the quaintness of the hotel. it's a no frills establishment, but very tasteful and welcoming. The staff & doormen were equally pleasant & helpful in recommending restaurants. The location is fabulous as well! It's very centrally located between all the downtown districts. My friend & i walked the 1.5 miles down to the Wharf & all around the city, but public transportation was readily available & the doormen were eager to help direct you or secure a cab. They did have a computer available for you to print passes, tickets, or travel documents. Internet was complimentary, as were cork screws if you need one! Parking was pricey at $40 per night; however, there was a garage on the next block that had a $26 per day maximum with limited in out & a closing time. If you park here, be sure to drop your luggage off first! the hill is a little steep to be dragging a suitcase - i did it, but i dont recommend it! Enjoy San Francisco & choose to stay here, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT QUALITY AND POSITIONED HOTEL IN SAN FRANCISCO”
Reviews.Author: ghostie270158
Reviews.Content: If you want a reasonably priced, good quality and well positioned hotel in San Francisco then the Orchard Hotel would be an excellent choice. My wife and I found the Hotel of a very high standard - and we tend to be particularly - the staff extremely helpful, informed and understanding. The rooms were well appointed, very clean and of a high standard with all of the facilities that you would expect from a high quality hotel. We would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MLB070
Reviews.Content: Excellent experienced,excellent room,exellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mich-noto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel on June 11, while passing through San Francisco on a business trip to Napa. The location was very central and it was easy to walk to many shops and restaurants. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful at this hotel which strives to be a "green" hotel. Our room was spacious compared to other hotel rooms I've experienced in San Francisco. It was quiet and peaceful, I'd stay here again. Parking was $40/day, but I don't know if that is just the current rate in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed by the absence of a bike in the "health club"”
Reviews.Author: reisiger161
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed by the absence of a bike in the "health club" that had only two devices, the room was reasonably calm considering the hotel is at Bush & Powell (where the cable car is).

Reviews.Title: “Location location location...”
Reviews.Author: kerwei
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is located in a great spot. About 2/3 blocks from town centre (Union Square)/shopping district and right next to the cable car *tourist* line from Fisherman's Wharf. There is a car rental company (National Car Rental) half a block away if you are looking for somewhere convenient to rent and pick up a car. If you want options, there is a cluster of car rental companies on O'Farrell Street which is about 5 blocks away so still pretty convenient. Rooms are nice, clean and comfortable but I wouldn't say luxurious. I know it holds itself out somewhat as a luxury hotel. Nonetheless great value for money. No complaints. Only difficult experience we had was trying to load and unload our baggages from our rented car. Did not seem to us there was a dedicated parking spot that we could leave our car for 5 minutes to check-in/check-out. Ended up having to make a couple of rounds looking for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: adrirod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect- the rooms are big and clean, the hotel staff is friendly, and the location cannot be beat. Right on a trolley stop and just a block away from several bus stops but mostly, very centrally located if you want to walk. My husband and I were able to walk to almost everywhere from here- Palace of Fine Arts, Pier 39, Coit Tower, Union Square and everywhere in between! The only places that we took a bus for were Golden Gate Park and Lands End and the stops were just a couple of blocks from the hotel. We would definitely come back to this hotel if are back in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Did my research and it was worth it ~ Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: kdcNy
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time online searching for a hotel for our visit to San Fran, and I was happy and relieved to see that The Orchard lived up to the online reviews. Our room was comfortable and clean with a large bathroom and the location was great. The people at the front desk, the bellhop and the cleaning staff were friendly and helpful. I will definitely recommend The Orchard to friends and I hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value.”
Reviews.Author: HurdyGurdyMan
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in a name brand hotel so I was a bit skeptical booking this hotel but all my fears were alleviated when I opened the door to my room. The size/lobby may say boutique but the rooms are strictly business class. Good sized and well appointed with beds that make you want to sleep-in.. The only thing that was missing was the flat-screen TV but they make up for it with a DVD player. The bathroom was bigger and nicer than most. The only draw back is that it's a bit of a hike from market street compared to other hotels and the last block up Powell is a killer. I guess the cable car would help but they weren't running and I wouldn't get on line for one even if they were. There is a staircase at Stockton and Bush but I'm not even sure if that saves any energy. I like that they still use the old style mini bar that you can use as a fridge if needed.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: dnascimb
Reviews.Content: When I found out that the Intercontinental was booked solid while planning my latest business trip, I quickly looked on Google and TripAdvisor for alternatives. The Orchard Hotel came up time after time with great reviews by real people. Not only that, but it was about 20% less than my original budget allowed for. I could not be happier with my stay (4 nights) at The Orchard Hotel. The hotel room was quiet and clean. The staff was very helpful with any questions I had. It's located in the heart of the city, so there is no need to rent a car. If you can't walk there from the hotel, the buses will easily get you anywhere you need to go. Stay here. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: alisaCrisp
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and service. Amazing location. No complaints. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: tc1707
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I had in the City so far. Very central but quiet. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “If the staff changes, don't trust them”
Reviews.Author: donnie92673
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the city, you'll love it. The current staff is wonderful, Damian is the manager and made our group of 15 welcome and caterered to our very needs. Great bargain compared to other hotels. Food was great but the dining room is a bit expensive but you have many choices bc youre in SF. I felt like a king!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Montgomerytb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 6 days in late May 2011. We liked our room and the space it offered, we didn't feel cramped as you do in some downtown San Fran hotel rooms. The bathroom was a good size and had the standard amenities. I did miss having a fan in the bathroom, and since the windows did not open the whole room would be a little steamy after having two people shower in a row. All in all the room itself is plainly decorated but clean and has most things you would look for - desk, free wireless internet, minibar/fridge, iron and dry cleaning available. We used the room service menu just once to get breakfast. The tab was $50 and our meals were quite small - my husband had a breakfast sandwich and I had a scone, english muffin, fruit and juice. Not worth the money! Also, the lady making up our breakfast trays called our room twice an hour before delivery (7 AM) because she didn't know if she got our order right. Twice! Needless to say, we didn't do that again as there are many better breakfast options nearby the hotel (like Sear's fine foods, just 2 blocks down or Starbucks). As for amenities, we only checked out the DVD library and hit up the front desk/concierge for advice a few times. DVD library was fairly updated with a good range of movies to choose from. There are no movie channels available so it was nice to have that. The front desk staff were always very courteous and helpful, even calling for a last-minute town car for us at 5:30 AM one morning when we forgot to make reservations earlier. We had a good stay and would consider staying again. Great location, good value, and good staff made our vacation comfortable & fun.

Reviews.Title: “We'll go there again”
Reviews.Author: BikerOntario
Reviews.Content: The Orchard was perfect for us. A relaxed and quiet atmosphere. The room was spacious and very clean with a good sized bath, and, everything worked including the free wi-fi. Staff were all very friendly and helpful including good suggestions re places to eat. The location couldn't have been better - two blocks to Union Square and two more to Market Street, and right on the Powell Street cable car line, yet still relatively quiet. The only thing we felt that could use improvement were the nature and quality of the offerings in the restaurant. If we return to San Francisco, we'll stay at the Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: langsource
Reviews.Content: Very nice, quiet hotel in a great location. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Try this hotel - it's a gem

Reviews.Title: “Can't find fault!”
Reviews.Author: louwest
Reviews.Content: A great Eco hotel, beautiful room, fantastic location and helpful/friendly staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room in a good location”
Reviews.Author: joannkatz
Reviews.Content: The negative- we made our reservation & paid in full more than a month in advance. When we checked in our room was not available (king deluxe). Instead, we were placed in a room with twin beds for 1 night of our 4 night stay & had to change to a new room the next morning. For the inconvenience we were offered complimentary glasses of wine & $10 off anything from the room fridge. This was less than the difference in the room price. We had to speak to the manager & were then offered free breakfasts during our stay. Further, I can't help believe there wasn't a deluxe suite we could have been moved to instead. Bad customer relations. However, the room was beautiful with beautiful bath & great linens. The location was central & right on the cable line. I'd stay there again but make sure my room was available the day before arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jonesy_Travels
Reviews.Content: We booked a King room at the Orchard and everything about the hotel was fantastic. Our room was on a high floor with a view of the streets below and overlooked the Marriott opposite. The bathroom was really spacious with a lovely walk in shower and the bed was just perfect... so comfortable which was great for us after a 10 hr flight. The complimentary internet was always really consistent too. In the morning the breakfast options were great with a nice choice of hot food to order or a set price continental buffet available for around $15. The staff were always very friendly and welcoming on our 3 night stay throughout the hotel. One importance on our short stay in San Fran was the location, and the Orchard didn't disappoint. It's based a block up from Union Square which means you're close to all the shops, restaurants, tram routes etc. You're also just a 10 min drive away from the pier if you decide to do the Alcatraz tour (which is amazing but book in advance!). I wouldn't hesitate to stay in the Orchard again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiamiRoxie22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took a trip to San Fran for our 8th anniversary and stayed at this hotel. We loved it. The staff there were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a very beautiful suite on the 8th floor with a HUGE bathroom, king bedroom and separate livingroom. It is an older place, but looks like it was remodled recently and is very nice and comfortable. It's right in the center of town in Union Square/ Nob hill and the Powell trolley line was right at the corner for us to jump onto and go places. Going left out of the hotel and down the hill to the next block is a Walgreens which came in handy and there is a diner across the street from Walgreens that we had breakfast at to start our day off right. Would go back there if ever in San Fransico again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: jpb-ny
Reviews.Content: Good location--near Union Square and surrounded by a good French and good Italian bistro. Excellent staff--to a one, friendly and helpful. Well appointed room, first-rate bathroom with large stall shower and heat lamps. Valet car parking available. Breakfast and lounge in building. Good place to stop for a glass of wine before retiring. Exceptionally quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: bchill
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at The Orchard. It is in a perfect location. We walked to Chinatown, the ferry building and Union Square. Comfortable, clean, friendly and helpful staff. Would love to return for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable accommodation, exceptional service, great location”
Reviews.Author: eyedoc1
Reviews.Content: We always look for value, and this fit the bill very nicely. The room was perfectly adequate, clean and comfortable. The front desk staff were professional and I must make special mention of the bellman. He was excellent (wish I could remember his name). Please tip the bellman here very well because they are exceptional. The only thing I would say that is missed is that there is not a hot tub/pool area, but I knew that before I booked so just have this expectation and there should be no problem. The other thing is that parking your rental car is VERY expensive ($40/night), but that is par for San Francisco so again, that is the reality there. Stay at the Orchard Hotel....the value is there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and service.”
Reviews.Author: gianouts
Reviews.Content: Located in a superb location, we enjoyed our stay in this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Island_Joe095
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the Orchard for location, value and service. A business associate and I walked to one appointment and then took the cable car to the next. The Powell/Mason line is just around the corner from the hotel. We walked down the street to Sears for breakfast. The hotel staff provides some of the best service I've had. I'll be back to stay again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in San Francisco!!! Hidden gem! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: montauk1
Reviews.Content: What a delightful surprise this hotel was! It was in a very nice location, easy access to the BART and the cable cars and abounds with wonderful shopping and restaurants. We have always stayed at The Palace, the W, or other very large hotels and this was a wonderful surprise. The room was extremely clean, quiet, well appointed for the use of a laptop but best of all, the bed was amazing!!! We went to Sears and Cafe de la Presse for breakfast. Walking to all of the sites of San Francisco is easy from this location but hilly, as another reviewer said. Don't miss the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art while visiting - amazing to see! Also, there is a WWII submarine that you can actually go on in Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Ok rooms, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Margarita_gem
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. The only one positive moment is location. Yes, the rooms are ok, but the service is terrible!!! I've never experienced this in my life! All the staff is very tired, bored, unhappy and doesn't care. No any single smile during whole our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at a Boutique Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: cabernet13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. It's a boutique hotel with a helpful staff, large comfortable rooms that are well appointed, comfortable beds, with a location near Union Square and a block from a public parking lot. I highly recommend this smaller, cozy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: abott
Reviews.Content: Modern comfortable hotel in an ideal location. This was our 3rd time staying at the Orchard, our first stay was in 2005. The rooms are comfortable, the bed and linen were of high quality and supported a sound nights sleep. The bathroom (just like the bedroom) is spacious, clean & modern. The hotel location is perfect - Union Square is an easy 3 - 5 min walk (downhill). The cable cars stop at Powell & Bush which is less than 50 metres from the front door of the hotel. Chinatown, the Financial District and SOMA are all within an easy 15 mins walk. There are many good restaurant located around the hotel - search TripAdvisor for suggestions. Beware of eating in the hotel restaurant... it is only for the brave (check out the reviews on TripAdvisor).

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: KakiDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel in SF for our honeymoon and could not have been happier with our stay. The room was very nice and quiet, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was very spacious. Front desk staff and housekeeping were friendly and helpful. Location is terrific also. We liked it so much we came back for our return trip after visiting Sonoma Valley. The Orchard is our destination in SF!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Mide
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with a special 3-night discount deal for April direct from the hotel's website, which meant we paid less than £90 per night. The hotel is really well located, just a minute's walk from Union Square, where everything seems to happen from (you get the tour buses here, the big shopping stores are here and it's a cool place to chill out and people watch etc.). It's also very close to a few good eateries and cafes, Market Street as well as the start of Chinatown. However, if you have mobility problems, it may not be the best for you as it is quite a steep hill to come back up from Market Street/Union Square. The hotel staff were friendly enough and the rooms were a decent size. The King size bed was probably the most comfortable I've ever slept in (including my own at home!) and the big TV worked well. Had a coffee maker in the room (you can to use this to make tea) and the bathroom was nice and big and well stocked with eco-friendly products. Also, unlike many hotels in SF, it has a little laptop in reception for you to check emails etc. for free. The breakfast room doubles for a restaurant and bar, neither of which we utilised as it was a bit lacking in ambience. Now to the few negative points. Firstly, you cannot open the windows, although the air con works fine.....just makes you feel a tad claustrophobic on the odd occassion. The second point was that when we booked, we were to receive breakfast included in the cost of the room. When we arrived we got some vouchers to use each morning, but they were only for 2 pastries and 1 cup of tea or coffee each (although 'pastries' included some rather delicious home made scones and muffins). The breakfast staff seemed a bit miffed when we said that's all we wanted as it was enough to get us out of the door in the morning and we just had brunch later on when we got hungry. Just double check that if your room includes breakfast, what type of breakfast it is! However, probably the most annoying thing on our entire trip to America was the Chinese cleaner lady. For some unknown reason, she felt it necessary to try to clean our room at 8 o'clock every morning while we were either still in bed or in a state of undress! When I told her we didn't want our room cleaned, she still came back later in the day and was very persistent.....even when I put the do not disturb sign out! Got a bit annoying after a day or two. I really don't know why hotels don't offer discounts on your room if you don't want it cleaned while you're there. I was trying to save them money changing towels etc. which for an eco-friendly hotel, I'd have thought they'd appreciate! Anyway, aside from the few minor points, I would stay here again, if for nothing other than the excellent location and seriously comfy bed!

Reviews.Title: “As good as we expected!”
Reviews.Author: HMHC
Reviews.Content: My daugther and I recently stayed at The Orchard during our mother-daughter vacation to San Francisco. It was everything we expected from the website and we were thrilled at the rate we got online. We stayed for one week in May. Our room was on the 3rd floor facing Bush Street and although we normally prefer a higher room it was not noisy and we did not ask for a higher room. The staff were all very friendly. The location of the hotel is ideal -- a couple of blocks from Union Square and a cable car stop right nearby! We enjoyed several meals at Roxanne's cafe on the corner but did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on their food. There are a number of small restaurants/cafes in the area including a Starbucks and a Walgreens just down the road. The rooms/bathrooms and corridors felt to us quite European in their style. The lobby was the only area which felt like it could use an upgrade as it is quite small but given the location and size of the building perhaps this is unavoidable. Everything was very clean and comfortable though. We will stay here again if we visit SF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: Celtickai
Reviews.Content: Located in a nice neighborhood, the Orchard Hotel is walking distance (two blocks) from Union Square shopping and many restaurants. The rooms are spacious and comfortable for an older San Francisco boutique hotel; the towels are thick and luxurious. The service was excellent and staff friendly; very willing to help find a restaurant or call a taxi. Overall, my two day stay was excellent. I would recommend staying at the Orchard to anyone either on a business trip or for a leisure stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel, chic but not pretentious”
Reviews.Author: Laconicsurf
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. We were greeted by an enthusiastic and cheerful porter and immediately we felt at home. The room was spacious and very stylish. The staff were extremely welcoming and attentive. The restaurant must easily rate as one of the best in the city. It was here that i had the best steak i have ever eaten, and i have tasted a few! My partner had fish, also cooked to perfection. It is not cheap but you get what you pay for and what you get at the Orchard is pretty close to perfection.

Reviews.Title: “The sweetest fruit from a small and compact beauty”
Reviews.Author: LondonDavidS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Easter 2011 for 4 nights. I arrived with a major back problem and staff went out of their way to source me with a local doctor to resolve my problem. Their care and consideration made a very uncomfortable situation more than tolerable. Across our entire stay the staff were attentive, helpful and considerate. We stayed in room 802. I was initially worried that it's proximity to the elevators would mean it would be noisy but our room was very quiet and we slept soundly. The standard of furnishing and fittings were more than adequate and we found our room to be excellent. We only had breakfast on our first morning. This was good but you will find up to a dozen eateries within a 10 minute walk. All charge around about $20 per head for Breakfast and all offer a good choice. The hotels location is excellent, close to Union Square and Market Street . There is a Cable Car stop about three minutes away on Powell and you can buy Muni passes from the Walgreens on Powell Street 2 minutes away. We arrived back late on a couple of evenings and never felt threatened or worried. Whilst there are cheaper options in San Francisco I doubt if you will find any that are better. This is one of the best small hotels we have ever stayed in and we would not hestitate to return, in fact we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mrldctguy
Reviews.Content: After considering several hotels and reading multiple reviews, I decided to stay at The Orchard. It turned out to be an excellent choice. The hotel is in a great location 2 blocks from Union Square. The clerk at the front desk was friendly and welcoming and check in was a breeze. Very nice room, good sized and nicely decorated - bathroom was spacious and well lit. Extremely comfortable bed. Complimentary WiFi is a really nice amenity and worked well. Each morning when I went to breakfast, I would hang the sign on my door requesting that my room be made up early and it was always done by the time a returned an hour later. Outstanding! In general, the hotel was excellent and I had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, no frills boutique hotel that won't blow the budget”
Reviews.Author: kz_78
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located just north of Union Square and west of China Town. The location was ideal for shopping and other attractions and was literally right on the Cable Car line. This was convenient for traveling north to south (that is when you could actually get on mid-ride). The rooms were comfortable. We stayed in a king room that had plenty of space and a refrigerator, while stocked as a mini-bar, it still had room for our drinks and food. The room was clean and well maintained. Despite the urban location, I found the room to be quiet and one morning actually slept in. There was lots to do around the hotel--you just needed to ask the Concierge. Brent or Bret, gave us fabulous recommendations for dinner and drinks. It was a great night out and one we will not soon forget. The front desk was also very helpful in assisting us with navigating public transportation--like the bus lines, which we used to get to AT&T Park and other areas throughout the city. I'm not sure I understand the negative comments about the staff as we interacted with numerous workers at the front desk. The only reason this hotel didn't get a five star rating is because prior to our stay we spent three nights at a wonderfully, charming inn in Napa and this was just slightly less romantic. But as far as boutique hotels go...you can't go wrong with the Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: 88KW
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with this boutique hotel fantastically located next to a cable car stop, 2 blocks to the left to Union Square for shopping and 2 blocks to the right to Chinatown for great food & cheap shopping. The bed was comfy, the room quiet and very clean, with excellent staff at the front desk. Great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a clean, green, and convenient hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: two_green_peas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed two nights at this hotel in the Union Square district of San Francisco. It was super convienient - were able to take the BART from the airport and walk there from the Powell street station (portions were uphill - we were ok but the walk is not for everyone!). This hotel is right on the cable car line (which is why I rated the sleep quality 4/5 - I'm a light sleeper and I was awoken by the clanking several times) which was very convenient for exploring the city and seeing the sights. The staff was extremely professional and helpful in giving us guidance on travelling around the city and activities. When we shared that we were celebrating our 5 year wedding anniversary they upgraded our room to a King Suite, gave us a box of chocolates and a voucher for the mini bar!!! They also allowed us to check in early so we could have a nap after our long journey (we were so grateful as we were exhausted!). The rooms themselves are gorgeous - very tastefully decorated in neutrals with high end bedding and sturdy furniture. It smelled fresh (no chemical or musty smells like many hotels in older buildings) and everything was very clean. We loved that this was a green hotel with LEED certification. Best of all, the price was right! This is an excellent place to stay in San Francisco - I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nealwBoston
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is literally steps away from the cable cars, which you can see from your window. You walk two blocks down Bush and you're at the gates of Chintatown. You walk two blocks down Powell and you're at Union Square. You walk one block up Powell and you're at the top of Nob Hill. All around are great restaurants, shops, all-night diners, 24-hour Walgreen's, places to rent a car, etc. The hotel itself is very nice -- the rooms are big and comfortable. We got adjoining rooms to accommodate teenagers and could not have been happier with the hotel. We got great restaurant recommendations each night and, while I was trying to stay off the Internet all week, I did sneak down to the lobby, where there's a free computer. Bottom line: No complaints. And if you see other people complaining on this forum, I would just ignore them.

Reviews.Title: “Fitted what I needed”
Reviews.Author: 1980winetraveler
Reviews.Content: Location is good: not too far and not too close to buisy Union Square. Rooms are nice and spacious. Didn´t see the fitness center, but had a good continental breakfast. Staff was helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: garycmcdonaldjr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location. The hotel is small and has basic services. The hotel rooms are large and bathrooms are updated. The hotel room furniture and television are dated and worn. We found the bed to be hard, and didn't sleep well. Our last morning, the staff woke us up at 7 am by calling the room to ask of we ordered room service. For location, I give the hotel a 3. Otherwise I rate it an average 3.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: JBrisgel
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel a lot. It's in a good location that makes it easy to walk the 2 blocks to Union Square. It was quiet and well decorated. The only complaints I have: 1. The room we stayed in had the outside of the shower / tub broken and was fixed with a bad patch job. It just didn't fit in with the feel of this nice hotel. 2. The day we checked in the A/C was broken. The front desk staff never thought to inform of this. I had to find out when I called down later as the room was really hot. A/C didn't get fixed until the next day when we checked out. I think it would have been good customer service to inform us they were having problems upon check in. We did ask them for a fan and they brought one to the room. That was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “a little worse for wear”
Reviews.Author: sohohubby
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to the Orchard hotel every year or two for the last eight years. It's been my favorite hotel. I always select the rate that includes the breakfast. Early on the breakfasts were perfect for me: meats, cheeses, fruit, granola, great pastries, and self serve coffee. A couple of year's ago, a waiter became involved and the coffee was no longer self serve. The waiters generally deliver coffee at a much slower rate than I would like unless I pester them. This year the meats, cheeses, granola and a few other items were gone. I don't think the continental breakfast is worth the cost anymore although the items that remain are good. The TVs are the same ones that were there many years ago, old fashioned analog monsters that didn't seem bad then but seem sadly deficient now. All that said, this is still a good hotel in an excellent location, for me, and the cost is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, rather anonymous, well-located lodgings.”
Reviews.Author: QueenBee016
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here for our 30th wedding anniversary, and found it to be a solid value. Our room (905) was quiet and very pleasant; the staff were likewise helpful without being at all obtrusive. Our only gripe--and this applies to so many hotels now--is that the windows didn't open, so the air was very stuffy and we slept poorly. My husband caught a cold, so the recycled air was more of a problem than usual.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: AllysonJS
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at The Orchard Hotel based mostly on reviews from TA and was not disappointed. The hotel was ideally situated for us - close to Union Square, Nob Hill, Chinatown and BART -- all within easy walking distance. The staff was pleasant and the room was spacious (by SFO standards) and well-appointed. Very comfortable beds and relatively quiet room, even though we were facing busy Bush Street and the Cable Car line. The breakfast in the morning was good, as was the room service dinner we had delivered. All in all it was a very good experience and we would definitely stay here again. Note** - if you are considering a room there with 2 over-sized twin beds, make sure you check that the bathroom shower is adequate for your needs. We are two relatively tall people and the hand shower (for disabled guests) was a bit challenging to use.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer333
Reviews.Content: My headline says it all. It is by far significantly cheaper than any hotel of comparable quality in the city, and for you get it is such an excellent value. I attended a conference at the Westin in Union Square, and Orchard was half the price for a much bigger and modern room. It's very quiet, and not prone to the street noise you'll get in other Union Square hotels either. Small, friendly, intimate, clean, huge bathroom, and the restaurant and room service are really good. I ordered a burger from room service and it was one the best I have ever had in my life. Cable car right outside and short walk to Union Square. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: raleggett
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, small and comfortable, with plenty of space in the rooms. The staff is friendly, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, faultless stay and great follow up service”
Reviews.Author: CGFurniss
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our stay at the Orchard Hotel in January. Our rooms were large, elegantly furnished, immaculately clean and with very comfortable beds. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. On arriving home, we realised that we had left an important document in our room safe. We contacted the hotel by email, had a response the next day that the document had been found, and the hotel then organised Fedex to courier the parcel to us. It arrived safely a few days later. We live nowhere near the USA...so were relieved with this prompt and efficient service. We will highly recommend this hotel to our friends if visiting San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel & only steps to cable car”
Reviews.Author: colorado-okie
Reviews.Content: This is the second time to stay at The Orchard and the same great, friendly people still work there! From the minute we got out of the rental car the concierge/doorman greeted us and took our luggage to our room so we could return the rental car on time. We received a phone call when the room was ready. Room was on the 8th floor facing Bush Street, quiet, clean, comfortable bed and plenty of pillows, TV reception was okay, but we did not watch TV and listened to music on the DVD player. A relaxing CD is provided to listen to when falling asleep. Mini bar with coffee maker, except coffee maker is set up for one person with a regular and a decaf coffee packet provided (Starbucks are not hard to find!). Nice large desk for laptop, etc. and 2 comfy chairs. Enjoyed having a large bathroom with fluffy towels, wonderful amenities and bathrobes. You can have your bed covers turned down each night if you wish. Never tried the hotel restaurant so I can't comment, although it never looked busy. Hotel is at a great location, 6th & Powell and the cable car runs up/down Powell, so hotel is just steps to catch a cable car to Union Station or the opposite direction to Fisherman's Wharf. China town is a short walk. San Francisco is a food lover's paradise! Uncle Vito's Italian Restaurant is across the street and everything is good from the pizza, salad to pasta dishes. Sears Fine Food is 2 blocks down on Powell and don't pass up their famous silver dollar pancakes! Also enjoyed eating at E.O. Trading Co. and The Swell is a small place walking distance from the hotel with succulent dishes. Need I say more about In & Out Hamburgers, which is a must at Fisherman's Wharf! Visit the Ferry Building by the water front and taste and see -- go to the Ferry Plaza Seafood Restaurant and have a cup of clam chowder and try the dungeness crab tower with flavors of grapefruit, avocado and grapefruit vinegrette topped with flaky crab meat - oh yes, it is delicious! We walked to the Ferry Building which is a good hike, but took a cab back to The Orchard at $6.50 for quick transportation. The trip to San Francisco was fabulous, 30 minutes from airport and will stay again on the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Find”
Reviews.Author: patfriedlander
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Amazing service, lovely rooms, great location, free wireless. I found this on a hotel search for San Francisco and decided to give it a try. I met many other business travelers in the lobby and elevator--we all remarked how wonderful the hotel is. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard Hotel - Great for San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: rmebob
Reviews.Content: Rooms were ready when promised, but not early. The hotel conveniently stored our luggage and delivered the luggage within 10 minutes of our return. Requested 2 rooms close together and received adjoining rooms - WOW! Regularly greeted by the front desk when departing and returning. The concierge / doorman gave us excellent information when we asked. Both the king and the 2 twins were very clean, cleaned daily and had an afternoon turndown service. The was a desk and chair, well stocked refrigerator (didn't buy anything) with room to store our food, an oversized bathroom with nice accompaniments, an older TV with an adequate set of channels and a working alarm clock. The location of the hotel was perfect for our travels. We had a seven day muni/cable car pass (City Pass for San Francisco) and the Powell street cable car stopped 100 feet from the hotel entrance. Union Square (shopping, eating, etc.) was 2 blocks away, Chinatown's southern entrance was 4 blocks and the Powell & Market bus & subway station 6 blocks. I definitely would stay here again and would recommend this hotel to families as well as business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard Hotel was a great find and an exceptional hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tpool
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at the Orchard hotel. I have been traveling to San Fran for almost a decade and have always stayed at the Maderin Oriental. But after the last several years I had noticed a drastic decline in the level of service at the Manderin, so I decided to try the Orchard. What a great change... I wish I had done it sooner. The reception and service were excellent. The room was spacious and extremely comfortable (I had a larger room with king bed.... there are apparently two sizes of 'regular' rooms, and I would suggest the larger). And the location could not be beat, with easy access to nob hill, union square, chinatown, and many others. Even the immediate surrounding of the hotel was perfect, with great restaurants and bars within feet of the place. The hotel bar was nice, low key, and rarely crowded at all.... with friendly bartenders eager to engage. The overall value of the room was unbeatable for San Fran. There was one rather minor, but annoying, 'con'..... the food. Particularly breakfast. They provide a continental breakfast buffet which was seriously lacking. Stale sliced bread, bland bagels, some limited fruit, and maybe some muffins and scones. It's what you'd expect from one of those horrible Best Western 'free' breakfast, not a nice boutique hotel in San Fran. And while my breakfast was included as part of a promotional deal, I overheard another table complaining that they were charged $14 per person for this "buffet". The hotel was even going to charge me for a coffee only (instead they just made my included breakfast). It's those type of meaningless annoying charges things that really turn me off (just raise your room rates by $3/night and give me the coffee for free... it's a huge appearance plus). So breakfast was a disappointment... and I'm not even a big breakfast eater! That being said, I will still return with pleasure to the Orchard Hotel. I look forward to returning in fact. It is a truly exceptional hotel in a great location. I hope they fix the breakfast, which would require little effort. But even if they don't its an easy to walk to one of many nearby restaurants and coffee places open in the morning, so that one failure will not keep me from returning. It's a great hotel with all pluses and just that one 'con'.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised how genuinely comfortable and friendly it was, especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: kgia
Reviews.Content: Well located, right at Bush & Powell cable car, but the room was quiet with a lovely comfy big bed. The first night the rumble of the cable car was a bit distracting, but after that it was just fun. NO street noise! The staff and concierge were very very friendly and helpful. I got a super cheap price, by shopping around first on Kayak.com. I called and asked the hotel whether they could meet that price, which they did gladly. I later called and arranged to come a night earlier. Friday nights should have been more expensive, but they still offered the bargain rate. Great room service/restaurant, but also a nice little diner, Roxanne's, right next door and a number of other places close by. An easy walk to BART, Union Square, Chinatown, and a little farther but still easily walkable to North Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious, clean!”
Reviews.Author: theimaginarygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the King suite, it was like having an apartment right on Union Square! The furnishings were all very nice, the bed was very comfortable and it was quiet! The only down side was that the restaurant was not good, but that was easily remedied since we were in San Francisco and you can't trip and fall without landing in a gourmet restaurant. I highly recommend staying at The Orchard, the staff were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Convenient to everything in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: selake92
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights at the Orchard Hotel and really loved our stay. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and responded to every question and concern. The hotel was convenient to Union Square, China Town, trolley, buses,restaurants, water front. Much to do within easy walking distance. Some reviewers had suggested that the rooms were noisy - we found ours very quiet - very clean, no problems - we requested a "quiet" room and were on 10th floor and not street side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: gnewburypark
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. The bed was very comfortable and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. If I were coming back for business, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with an exception”
Reviews.Author: zigzagg
Reviews.Content: Now, as far as being one of the finest hotels in San Francisco, no it isn't. But I've seen this with Trip Advisor before. The rooms were tastefully decorated, almost elegant. The staff very accommodating. We were there on a weekend so prices were reasonable for a San Francisco hotel near Union Square. In fact, a bargain. Parking was pretty expensive though, about a third of the cost of the room. The room we had was a little loud even though it was on the seventh floor. Street noise and the cable cars but after all it is in the middle of San Francisco. The fitness room was just basic. The room had an older tube TV, minibar prices were reasonable, robes nice. The bathroom was a nice combination of original and updated. Now for the two irritants. one small, one not so small. The in room coffee maker was set up for one person. A single cup. So you got one cup of decaf, one of regular. The big irritant was the WiFi. Just awful. Slow, dropped connections, rude customer service. It was a third party vendor called "The WiFi Guys" and their business was to sell you an upgrade to their "free" service by making the "free" service as unusable as possible. In my opinion, WiFi is either free or it isn't. No sort of free. This was free, but terrible service and presumably better service, if you paid to "upgrade". Now, they did tell me at the front desk that "The WiFi Guys" were going to be gone next month. I wasn't the first to complain. So over all a nice experience but again, not one of the finest hotels in SF, but a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Making Things Right”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Funk_11
Reviews.Content: In mid February, I made a quick 3 day business trip to San Francisco. I arrived very late in the evening and was told there had been an "incident' and that my room was no longer available. As you might imagine, this was distressing news for a weary traveler. Although, I never learned exactly what happened with the room, I can say that the people at the Orchard Hotel most definitely made things right. In my opinion, they went above and beyond to ensure that I was well cared for even as I was being temporarily relocated to another hotel. All too often, hotels treat business travelers as just another person passing through, but those at the Orchard treated me as if they wanted my business now as well as in the future. I very much appreciate the fact that they turned what could have been a terrible stay into what was one of my best experiences in San Francisco. In addition to kind and professional people, the hotel itself is gorgeous! Dr. Funk

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Benjithehunted
Reviews.Content: No complaints. Friendly, quiet, clean and efficient. Great location but a steep walk from Union Square. Good sized room for couple and baby.

Reviews.Title: “More catered for a personal than business type hotel.”
Reviews.Author: soonteo
Reviews.Content: Small meeting room that is not catered for business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: melbournegirl001
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Fantastic location near Union Square, on the cable car line and short walk to Chinatown. Clean room, comfy bed, helpful staff. Didn't try the restaurant/breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The best & mist comfortable hotel in SF for business or tourist traveler.”
Reviews.Author: Wfederman
Reviews.Content: The staff is excellent starting with the doorman/conceirge to the front desk. This is a small hotel that wants your repeat business. The rooms are large and those facing Bush have excellent natural light. For tourists, you are on the Powell trolley line and two blocks to China town. Business travelers are 6 blocks to the financial district - all downhill!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff but a little dated room decor.”
Reviews.Author: AdventurousColorado2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard during a business trip and was greeted by professional staff. I valeted my rental car through the hotel, but there are cheaper garages in the area if you'd like to walk with your luggage. The hotel is more of a boutique property, which suited me fine. The location is right on the trolley line and blocks from most of the convention centers, Union Square and restaurants. My only disappointment were the rooms themselves. They are very comfortable and quite spacious, but the decor is a little too dated for the hotel (which is only 10 years old). They are promoting themselves as a LEED-certified hotel (which is why I chose it), but my room did not have the automatic control system that they touted on the website. Overall, my stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is well worth a stay as is well situated.”
Reviews.Author: druzzie53
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights December 2010. Location was at top of the hill, 2 blocks up from Union Square. Rooms comfortable, some rooms with baths. Not great views as in city and only 10 floors high, internet access was very poor and you had to stand at reception desk to use. I found staff to be helpful overall, day staff much friendlier. Good choice of restaurants nearby and laundromat handy.

Reviews.Title: “Finally- the ideal downtown SF hotel!”
Reviews.Author: coloartist
Reviews.Content: My 20-something daughter and I stayed for a couple nights. We got to check in early, so we could get ready for my brother's wedding. When we drove up, we left the car out front while we checked in, and took our bags up to the room, just left the car key with the bell captain in case. Then it was a short drive down Bush street to the Sutter/Stockton garage. If you want, you can get valet parking, but at 40+ dollars a night, I opted for the 23 dollars I paid by doing it myself. Our room was on 8th floor, and faced the back, so was very quiet. Nice and spacious, comfy bathrobes, iron and board in the closet, daughter used the WIFI for some work, and we loved the easy access to shopping and eating and galleries. With the super comfy beds, sleeping was great, although the toasty down comforters were a tad warm unless I cooled off the room. Didn't eat or drink in the hotel, but everyone we encountered was friendly and welcoming. And it seemed like for two people, the rate was very fair.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else? It's our new home-from home!”
Reviews.Content: Small, very personal hotel. Staff are friendly and very eager to help with extra arrangements prior to your stay. We were planning a surprise birthday trip for a family member and they couldn’t have been more helpful to help us pull it off without a hitch! Great location. Easy to jump on and off cable cars, walk to Union Sq, nearby restaurants (or Starbucks for the morning coffee run!) Excellent value with nicely furnished rooms & pristine bathrooms with bath robes. We were initially concerned about the location being so close to the cable cars but we didn’t hear a sound. Breakfast was good – although could have done with some cheese or cold meat on the buffet table. It initially seemed slightly pricier than elsewhere but we soon discovered that nearby external restaurants add additional taxes and charges – which makes it about the same cost but in much nicer surroundings. The hot breakfasts were good as too were the happy hour appetizers. The Orchard hotel and staff made it feel like a home-from-home. We will certainly be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: eccysteve
Reviews.Content: Well priced and well located, this hotel makes for a great base to explore the city. Very close to the business district and near to Union Sq and it's shopping. Generous sized rooms, free wi.fi and friendly knowledgable staff.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was sleeping on a cloud.”
Reviews.Author: joanjurado
Reviews.Content: Great location, great room, incredible bed and bathroom, helpful staff. Our stay couldn't have been better!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Goldlox1969
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from San Francisco and stayed at the Orchard (by accident). We had booked in at the "Inn on the square" - but unfortunately felt compelled to leave it without staying a night - as the "penthouse" we had booked was anything but. Anyway - back to the Orchard - having rushed around trying to find other accomodation we stumbled accross the Orchard (cnr of Bush and Powell). Google searches didn't give us much. The doorman Bob took us up to a room to have a look. Having sussed out the Four Seasons (very good, but would have cost us $1200 per night - for interconnecting rooms), the Westin (had conferences on - and you couldn't get a lift. Waits of 5-15 minutes each time) and a couple of others - the rooms at the Orchard were large, clean and looked a lot more welcoming than what we have seen elsewhere. The bathrooms were large and good quality. As a result we moved accross straight away - initially to just 2 rooms and then changed over to interconnecting rooms the next day - the staff were very helpful (although communication was a bit lacking). In the days that followed we discovered that the location was very good. While not right in Union Square - and those hills in SF are quite demanding - it was right on the Cable Car route - and if you buy a 1 or 3 or 7 day pass - you can jump on the cable cars on the way up (or down) Powell St. For restaurants we generally travelled down Bush St to Chinatown (for Chinese) and nearby alleyways for Italian. The staff at the Orchard can steer you in the right direction though. Note we are a family that usually stay in 4 to 5 star hotels etc... - and while the Orchard doesn't sound like one of the bigger chains - it went toe to toe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: txslk
Reviews.Content: We only had one evening in San Francisco and this was a fantastic location to be in. They hotel was very impressive. The rooms were comfortable and clean. I wish we had more time to enjoy the room and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Skywren520
Reviews.Content: Clean, affordable & quiet. Also, great location. I'll definetely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “More Than Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Semipermeable
Reviews.Content: My wife and I scheduled a last minute trip to San Francisco for my birthday. We found the Orchard online and took a chance based on its price, reviews and proximity to Union Square. We found the room to be adequate +, but it's beginning to show some wear particularly in the bathroom. The view is nothing to write home about and the windows were in need of a wash. The bed and linens were very good. I found the room to be quiet while my wife thought it was a bit noisy at night - go figure! The hotel staff was very friendly and we felt cozy and safe. The hotel is well situated and access to food, sundries and shopping is very convenient. China Town gate is just down the street, the cable car stops virtually in front of the hotel and there's a terrific local italian joint accross the street (Uncle Vito's) that was fun for a late evening bite and beer. I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and VERY comfortable bed! Great location, large room.”
Reviews.Author: Camelliamom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great visit to SF near Union Square at the Orchard Hotel. We have stayed here once before a few years ago and had a great stay that time as well. The rooms are comfortable, well furnished, relatively large, clean. We have stayed at many of the nice hotels in the Union Square area including The Mark, St. Francis, Fairmont, and the Ritz Carlton. This room was as nice as any of the other places! We did not have the breakfast that is included in some of the room rates and we did not use any services except the valet parking and internet. Internet fee was included in our room rate, which was very reasonable, and the wi-fi worked well. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, fun location, warm hospitality”
Reviews.Author: franverma
Reviews.Content: New to San Francisco lodging, I took a shot in the dark and got lucky with the Orchard. We arrived late and staff were warm and patient. There were 4 children in our group ranging from 1 year to 11 years old. Room was pretty, spacious, and comfortable. The rate was excellent, and the neighborhood shops and restaurants were fun.

Reviews.Title: “Location of Hotel is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mshamilton29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location downtown, near everything and public transporation. I won't stay again because my stay was so noisy, other guest were running down the hall, playing in the hall, loud talking in the hall.. ALL nite long. Me and my husband were unable to have a quiet night together because of the noise outside our door and it was our 1st year anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: anacodave
Reviews.Content: This hotel has joined a growing list of "green" hotels that force guests to avail themselves of ineffective gel soaps and 'bleach-free' toilet paper that feels more like sandpaper. It's nice that the owners of these establishments feel the need to save the planet, but, please, don't expect your guests to feel comfortable using these products. Having stayed here several times in the past, I was expecting the same experience this time -- but came away disappointed by the tired appearance of the place and unwashed windows.

Reviews.Title: “great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: 69redolds442
Reviews.Content: we were traveling to S.F. for x-mas at Union Square. Orchard was great value just a couple of blocks from Chinatown and Union Sq. staff was extremely courteous and worked very hard to let us access all the amenities of the hotel. The best 2 things about the hotel are 1) extremely clean....bathrooms and linens were immaculate 2) the hotel was one of the quietest in downtown. We've stayed at most of the high end hotels within a couple mile radius of the financial district and the Orchard was one of the best and quietest sleeps we've had

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TripAdvice52
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Orchard Hotel over Christmas. We got in early and asked for early check-in. The desk clerk was very accommodating and gave us an excellent room on the 8th. The bed was very comfortable and the room was big enough for two. The bathroom is a good size. Can't beat the location and cost. We wished the windows were clean so we could take some pictures. And the furniture is getting banged up. Neither of these would be a reason not to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EvaCri
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this hotel over Christmas and had a great time. The hotel is very clean, the room spacious, the bed comfortable and the service really good. The location is superb for seeing every part of San Francisco. The only downside is that you cannot open the windows, but that is normal I think for ****hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: donita2
Reviews.Content: I was in S.F. on business for 5 days and loved staying at the Orchard. Every time I returned to the Hotel I was greeted and made to feel I had returned home. The location is perfect! I could walk everywhere, or easily get any type of public transportation (the cable car was 20 seconds away). I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “So Long to The Orchard”
Reviews.Author: CocoMaKai
Reviews.Content: It was hard to decide between a 1 or 3 Star Review. I decided on 3 afer all the years we have stayed here, brought a family reunion once to this hotel and suggested it to other travelers. First off, we have stayed at The Orchard every Thanksgiving and a few other times over the past 8-9 years. The pluses have been the location, the room price (minus the expensive valet), size of rooms and seeing Cornell, a long time exceptional employee every year. The cons we noticed this year were the same furnishings that have been in the rooms for all these years. I think it's time for some replacement pieces do to wear and tear. The bed is long over do for replacement. I have a neurological condition and the springs poking through sent me into a massive flare. I have never had this problem with other hotel beds. There's a staff member operating the breakfast area who could care less he was even employed (I see this mentioned in another review as well). Although the price of the hotel is attractive, they make-up a good portion on parking. I would suggest literally going around the corner and parking for almost 1/2 the price. On our last night, a water pipe broke on our floor around 11pm and it caused massive flooding. The entry way into our room and past the bathroom was soaking wet. I'm sure this was nothing compared to the other damage in the hotel. It looked like there was a good 1" in the hallway and we were told it flowed from the 9th to the 5th floor. Disasters happen and I feel bad the hotel had to deal with this mess. What was unacceptable was the way they did deal with it. I completely understand the need to get the water up ASAP and make an attempt to dry it before mold infests and mitigate further damage, but the people operating the machines were yelling the entire night. As we layed awake listening to them, they weren't just yelling about the job at hand...they were also yelling idle chit-chat without any regard to the guests in the rooms. Sometime around 7am, I heard one of them yell.."Well it's time for these people to wake-up." I don't think anyone ever slept! If I was the manager of this hotel, I would have bent over backwards to apologize and provide service above and beyond. If I was in charge, I would have provided free coffee to all the guests in the lobby and maybe opened their Continental Breakfast to everyone in the hotel as a way of showing good faith at minimal cost. After our 4 night stay at check-out, we were charged for the last night. Really? You must be kidding? After some negotiation, we were offered a discount on our next stay. NO! Then, it went to 20% off. NO! Then, it went to 50% off. NO! Then finally, the Manager removed the charge for our very long, sleepless night. From the beginning, there should have been NO question that the night would not be charged, not only for us, but for all the guests that endured the brunt of it. The hotel has to have insurance to cover these disasters and loss of revenue, so from a financial standpoint, the charge was senseless. My only hope is they got the place miracously dried out and maybe it will light a fire for some refurbishing.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel I have stayed in in years! The service was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Redhead97
Reviews.Content: Friendly, well trained, knowledgable staff. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. An excellent experience. Will return on my next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: loganCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Great location - corner of Powell and Bush Streets. The room service food, (I assume it was from the hotel's restaurant, The Daffodil), was horrible and way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good sized rooms, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: LilacLady08
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Orchard Hotel to be close to Union Square. The rooms are a good size and very quiet considering the location. We will stay again the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Icemanlaa
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and choose the Orchard based on that. We were very happy with the room, the staff (except one area), or the location (two blocks to Union Sq, Chinatown, restaurants, etc.). We were on the 6th floor street side and were not bothered by normal street noise. The room was very clean, bed was comfortable, and room service excellent. In fact we had to put out 'Do not Disturb' sign because the maids kept trying to freshen the room all the time. One issue is the restaurant and bar which I don't recommend due to lack of experienced staff. There are Plenty of nice little places nearby for your breakfast or a drink. Overall, highty recommended, though the Management needs to improve food & bar service staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard was a Perfect Choice!”
Reviews.Author: KnDRanch
Reviews.Content: Of the many places to choose to stay, we could not have been happier with The Orchard. Two blocks from China Town entrance, two blocks from Union Square, directly on the Powell Cable Car line and Stockton Muni line, the location was superb! The room was was spacious and very comfortable, and bed was awesome. Upper floor (9th floor) provided quiet sleep. Staff was friendly and "right on" for dining and entertainment recommendations. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love about this place. Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: PickE
Reviews.Content: Paid 169/night on their website. Frankly put, one of the best 3 hotels I have stayed in. The most gracious and friendly staff, from the front desk to the restaurant. Rooms are SPOTLESS, large and a huge bathroom. Rooms are quiet, and some areas of chipped paints, etc - but it did not bother me. Locations is close Union Sq, though beware, both approaches to this hotel on foot involve steep SF hills. Breakfast was 14 bucks for the buffett and excellent and good quality eggs. Free WiFi. Maid service prompt and they even did turndown service, unbelievable for a hotel at this price point. Would recommend this hotel ten times over, what a fabulous gem.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value with so much class!”
Reviews.Author: AyiManila
Reviews.Content: I was initially attracted by its "green" hotel tag only to be so pleasantly surprised by its quality! The rooms are large and cozy. The beddings are fantastic. The full en suite bath is sparkling and large. The location is unbeatable, just a few steps away from Union Square. I can't say enough great things about this hotel. The staff? Very friendly and helpful, true Sanfranciscans in their global disposition. Well done, Orchard!

Reviews.Title: “Big, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: SweetsFrankfurt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and were very happy with the hotel. We were given a big, spacious room on the 6th floor. The room had everything we needed, including free WiFi, and the staff were very friendly. The location was great too - walking distance to the shops and Union Square. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Clean Hotel in the Heart of it All”
Reviews.Author: Traveling1_2010
Reviews.Content: I took my mom to San Francisco for her birthday and did extensive research on clean/smoke-free hotels in the Union Square area. The front desk staff was very friendly and even allowed early check in. As requested, we were placed away from the elevators and our room was unbelievably quiet (despite the World Series celebration that was going on a few blocks away)! I was very pleased with the cleanliness/condition of the room. The location is ideal-a couple of blocks from Chinatown, steps away from shopping, etc. Basic amenities such as ability to print boarding passes, internet access, newspaper were available. There was an uphill walk from the Powel station, but that wasn't an issue since we had very little luggage. I'd return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “would have been great, except for...”
Reviews.Author: yphilippe
Reviews.Content: I agree with most other reviews... nice place, great location, roomy rooms. The restaurant wasn't inspiring enough for me to eat there other than to get the express breakfast which was provided for free, the breakfast buffet is minimal (the croissants were good though), and the restaurant staff didn't seem to care much about customers. The BIG problem: I stayed there 2 nights, and both nights I awoke in the middle of the night with a very strange and strong smell in the room. It smelled like rubbing alcohol, or strong glue. It was very strong, and I had a hard time going back to sleep. When I checked out, I told them about it, and apparently they decided to clean the elevator during the night with some horribly smelling product. To me this is just unacceptable: the product was probably highly toxic, and it affected pretty much everyone in the hotel. I'm guessing they were hoping that most people would sleep through it. They should have shut down the hotel to take care of this issue, but this isn't the kind of things customers should be exposed to. Oh, and they claim to be "green". So, for this reason - and I realize this issue is probably not going to happen often - I will never, ever, ever consider going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still #1 hotel in San Francisco for price and value.”
Reviews.Author: lagunatravel
Reviews.Content: After staying at many hotels in San Francisco, the Orchard is our favorite for the value. The rooms are well designed with good lighting and well insulated for sound. The mattresses are very comfortable for a great night's sleep. And, the rooms are spotless. The location makes for an easy walk to Chinatown, Union Square and the cable cars. The main drawback is that the windows do not open for fresh air, but that is true in most city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AnneLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard Hotel in February 2010 while travelling on business and loved the hotel so much that I returned in November 2010 (checked out of a hotel downtown following a conference to stay at the Orchard for some weekend sightseeing). The hotel is perfectly situated just outside Union Square with a trolley car stop at the front door and easy access to Market Street and other transportation via a quick trolley car ride. The rooms are quiet, well decorated and spacious. The staff is gracious, friendly and accomodating. I highly recommend the Orchard Hotel and look forward to coming back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ladyswat
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in California and stayed two nights at this hotel. The bed was the most comfortable bed from the entire trip. The hotel was very clean and the location was perfect. It fit all of our needs. Also we were able to check in before the check in time which was very helpful. I guess the only negative is we asked for a newspaper in the morning and never got one. Tip- The cafe right next to the hotel right at the cable car stop had excellent breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “up the hill”
Reviews.Author: dedicated-doctor
Reviews.Content: this is an excellent hotel. The beds and beddind was superb, extremely confortable. I had arrived after a 24 hour overseas trip Iand I had requested a room on the higher floors, away from the elevators. My request was granted immediately and we were also able to check-in at 2 pm. The ladies at the front desk were very helpful and polite. Rooms and bathroom impecable, and all for a fair rate. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The only disadvantage for some people may be its location at the top of a steep hill up from union square and market street, so if you have to go to the hotel several times a day it may be tiresome for some.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: tami2010_10
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel very much. The room was large and although nothing frilly ... it was very clean. We were on the sixth floor and had no problem with street noise. Could not ask for better location. Can catch the cable car right on the corner. The staff was welcoming and friendly every time we came in and went out. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for expensive city”
Reviews.Author: tomb3006
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days during a trip in the Southwest USA. Very nice room in an excellent location. Walking distance to most things, and cable car stop at the door. Parking is expensive, but thats no different from the rest of the city. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: pch80
Reviews.Content: The beds were AMAZING. I did not want to leave them The concierge was nice. The front desk help have limited knowledge of english and so it is hard to get recommendations from them or help of any kind. The restaurant was beyond belief expensive and he food was blah. Our room faced another hotel which sucked. No view. I could hear people in the rooms next to me talk and move about. It's just really not impressive in any way. Yes, the location is good but besides that it's like a step above a Bed Western or Hamptons inn. It has that mediocre feel. But if you like those types of hotels, don't like spending too much money on a hotel than you will like this,

Reviews.Title: “A great value, espically with upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: junkrus
