Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Great location at Bush & Powell. Trolley to Wharf on Powell St. Quiet street, but only three blocks from Union Square and two blocks from Chinatown/Grant St. All staff members were helpful. The valet even told us where to park cheaper than hotel offered. Nice size room, which is the reason I chose it, plus we were upgraded to a suite! We travel alot and this was the first place we ever been upgraded, except for our Honeymoon. Their beds were super comfy too, we had 2 great nights of sleep. I Highly recommend it. On a side note, we ate at Millenium for dinner and Greens on the Marina for lunch both excellent choices, especially if you are vegetarian.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: IncidentalTourist1
Reviews.Content: This "green" hotel is clean and the staff pleasant enough but considering the many raves here, I was disappointed in the quality and layout of my corner room (902). While very clean, the furniture was older, chipped and banged up and there was less than a foot of walking clearance between the bed and the TV cabinet---somethig the hotel clearly recognizes by the fact that foam padding has been glued to the bed frame to minimize foot damage, which was mostly yellowed and peeling off. For the rate, the room did not live up to its billing and was not as cheap as advertised (with taxes over $700 for three nights). Had I not been given a substandard room, I may well have used Hotel Orchard for future business trips. Also, while it didn't bother me, the location at Bush and Powell is atop one of the city's steepest hills and may be an issue for those with mobility problems.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: SusanneDenver
Reviews.Content: great hotel, great rooms, good price. Room service menu for breakfast was a bit boring. It would be nice if the hotels would start offering gluten free breads to substitute wheat products. Otherwise great location, quite rooms, very clean. Loved the king suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bikerrn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to California for vacation and while in San Francisco we stayed at the Orchard Hotel. We highly recommend this hotel for it's cleanliness, friendly service and fabulous location. When and if we return to the San Francisco area we will definitely stay at the Orchard. Great Boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet, comfy”
Reviews.Author: shygirl57
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. There is no pool, spa, etc., but it has a great location, clean rooms and bathrooms, and very comfy beds. We did not have breakfast included with our rate, so can't comment on that. It was a great place to return to after great but exhausting days in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, romantic, relaxing hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: mbs35
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 3 nights here and LOVED it! The location is perfect: a cable car stop steps away on the corner, walk down the hill two blocks to Chinatown, an awesome, small, local italian joint (Uncle Vito's) on the next block. The bed was incredibly comfortable, the front desk & housekeeping staff very welcoming. The breakfast buffet had nice homemade scones & muffins, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, breads etc. Waitstaff was hit or miss for helpfulness. Overall we loved this hotel and are so very glad that we found it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TheRealBishops
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orchard for 5 nights on a recent road trip to California. The best two things about this hotel are it's location, and the value for money. Rooms were large, and clean. Reasonably basic, but we weren't expecting anything other than that. If you're looking for a hotel near Union Square, this is ideal. It's on the tram line too, which will save you an hour wait in the queues at the bottom of the hill. The only reason this isn't 5 stars is the $40 valet parking fee, but there's plenty of other car parks nearby you could use which are around $25 for 24hours. We also found the shower a little too cold in peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suite, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Toptraveller4
Reviews.Content: The one bedroom suite was perfect for our family with 2 teens. The bathroom was huge, the decor made the place feel like we were staying in someones guest room in a home, which was a good thing. The bed was very comfortable. It was a short walk downhill to get to Union Square and the hotel is located on a somewhat more residental street although still just around the corner from shopping, Chinatown and many choices of restaurants nearby. The lobby is small, breakfast in the restaurant was good, all in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Don B
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in central part of the city. We were able to walk to many interesting sites. Friendly service, clean comfortable room...would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: roots_controller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights over the Labor day weekend. Staff were very friendly and we were always greeted as we departed or arrived. As other people have said, this hotel is in a very good location, Chinatown is down the road, Union Square is down the hill and a cable car stop on the corner. Room was spacious and clean, with one of the comfiest beds we've ever slept in. Cannot comment on the restaurant as we did not eat there - there are plenty of eating establishments within walking distance. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel to you all.”
Reviews.Author: GeoffnJenny
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel, ideally located just a few blocks from Union Square. Staff were friendly and helpful, standards were always high. Can't speak highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Uphill From Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: webeenthere
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Friendly staff, close to everything, very nice clean rooms, limited amenities, business center is a laptop at the front desk, no spa or pool which you'll need after walking uphill from either downtown or chinatown. Fitness center is the same hills. If this is a major concern don't stay here. The lounge and restaurant are good and the sevice is very good. Lots of restaurants and high end shopping very close by at Union Square. Cable car line is adjacent to the hotel and cabs are numerous. Just a nice place to stay. By the way, very good beds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melflan
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for four nights and found a wonderful little hotel. It was small, quaint, clean and in a perfect location. We were right between China Town and Union Square so could easily walk to either location. The cable car to the wharf was right outside out door also. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem, close to everything and excelent value.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBallarat
Reviews.Content: An excelent quality small hotel, close to everything, China town, Powell St and Union Square. The hotel had a classy feel and the price we paid favourably compared with lesser quality hotels in poorer areas. The only complaint we had was a lack of service at breakfast but nothing serious.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, Amazing Staff, Great Location, Good Nights Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Harveysgirl
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at The Orchard last year and upon checking out made a promise to the staff to return again this year and when we walked in on Sunday, 9/5 we were greeted so warmly and I was even reminded of my promise to return by the staff and we did! We spent 6 wonderful days in San Francisco and The Orchard had a lot to do with it. We didn't encounter any problems during our stay this year or last. We always had plenty hot water, the room and bathroom was kept clean, the staff was friendly and always greeted us with a smile upon leaving and returning and was always helpful with suggestions and we didn't have any problems at all with the free internet. I just plugged in my laptop and logged on, no problems at all. Everyone has different experiences, but if you are looking for a place to stay that is clean, quiet, helpful staff and a great location, then The Orchard Hotel is what you are looking for! If you are looking for a place with a big fitness center and evening wine get togethers then this isn't the place. But if you do stay here you will get in some good exercise walking up and down the hill! Hubby and I enjoyed the walks and looked forward to the hill everyday! The location is great, 2 blocks down the hill to Union Square and the Westfield Centre, 2 blocks down to Chinatown, the cable car stops on the corner that will take you to Fisherman's Wharf, many other shopping stores, restaurants, jazz clubs and coffee shops located so close together! We enjoyed our nightly walks around the city and only 2 people asked us for money and neither one looked homeless. We will definitely stay at The Orchard Hotel again and have no problem recommending it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, great location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Zoysiaplug
Reviews.Content: It's been a challenge finding a hotel in downtown San Francisco that made us want to stay there a second time. Until this trip. We will definitely stay here again. The staff are very responsive and the rooms comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickisora
Reviews.Content: If you don't like walking up hills, this could be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “SAN FRANCISCO”
Reviews.Author: visarpe
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at the Orchard Hotel. It was our first time in SF and we would like to come back someday. The location is perfect. Little walk to Union Square, Chinatown and business district. You will find good restaurants very close to the hotel ( I suggest an american breakfast in Loris) We stayed in three nights. We visited the city in this short time so everyday we had to leave early at morning and came back at midnight. We were very pleased taking our rest in the confortable king bed of our quiet room. When you are tired, you really appreciate to have a clean, quiet and nice place to charge the batteries. In the result, we wish to come back to SF because of the nice city but also because of the nice stay in The Orchard Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: bubbino
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of the cab, the Orchard Hotel made San Francisco worth travelling to. The bell man 'Cornell' has terrific service and almost risked his life trying to flag a cab down for us in the middle of the road! The rooms are spacious with comfortable beds. For the cheap price we paid, we thought this was excellent. The hotel has an old homely feeling which we loved. They also offer breakfast for $5. However, we ate out because there are so many beautiful cafes that are also yummy. The location was superb. We walked to the local cinema one night and caught a cable car back up the hill that stop right in front of the hotel. Would definitely go back to San Francisco and stay at the Orchard again!!

Reviews.Title: “We will certainly stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: mannythek
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor's rating encouraged us to try the Orchard Hotel. We were very pleased with our selection. The rooms are very clean, and large; there is plenty of storage space. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location book online for great deals!”
Reviews.Author: AnniroK
Reviews.Content: Great room....spacious...clean....well stocked...robes....wet bar ....eco-friendly soaps. Great location and great guide books on dining, activities & eco friendly businesses in the S.F. area as well as public transportation info at your desk in room. WiFi Internet is sub par (slow) but work good if you aim your laptop at the hall ......our room was off the street ..no view but quiet which was great.....i know where the city is when i wanna see it ....out the front door to the left 50 ft and left one block to walgreens, two blocks to union square- 3 blks to Late night burger & crepe place that is super yum! out the front door 2blocks to right parking that will cost you almost as much as the hotel Valet so if i had it to do over ....valet please sir...thank you....unless you wanna move your car every morning to save some $

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jeremyj10
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location (close to unionsquare and chinatown). Hotel is very clean and room are fairly large. Front desk is very friendly and flexible : I booked 2 rooms through internet but travelling with a family of 5 I asked few days before for a rollway bed in one of the rooms and finally they offered me to accomodate us with 1 king bed room + 1 two queen beds room, both joining. That was exactly what I needed. Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco's 'Hidden Gem' is Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: 2CtheWorld4Two
Reviews.Content: To end our delightful “Garlic & Grapes” (Gilroy Garlic Festival & Wine Country) vacation, we stayed a few days where it all began: San Francisco. As always, I consulted TripAdvisor before booking and was SO satisfied with this choice! The Orchard Hotel is the only place we will stay while in SF and here’s why: The moment we walked through the door, the staff made us feel welcome and instantly offered their help with our luggage. While my sweetheart supervised that, I checked us in. Every question we had was answered with a smile and a great deal of knowledge (well-trained staff!). Car whisked away via the valet for a few days, we headed upstairs to our room. Our bellman opened the door. Breath in, “Wow! THIS is nice!” Breath out, “Ahh... it feels good to be home, at least for a few days.” Our room was perfect. Nicely decorated (see photos) in my favorite style, Art Deco, it was a real refuge from the hustle and bustle of the city. Couldn’t hear a thing from the streets down below. The bed beckoned so we plopped down for only a moment. (Heaven!!!) We had lots of sightseeing to do. Super soft and comfy, I looked forward to lingering later. The bathroom was big, clean, and modern with complimentary toiletries that followed the “Eco-Friendly” theme that pervades this hotel. Nice to know your stay isn’t over-taxing our environment. Literally a few steps to the trolley, it is centrally located in the city, a few blocks from Chinatown, a trolley ride away from Fisherman’s Wharf, and a brief stroll to Union Square. If you don’t eat at their organic restaurant, “Daffodil,” there are lots of great places to eat within walking distance. Having taken your (the reviewers) advice, we are happy to say “Thank You!!! Our stay in San Francisco was perfect and The Orchard Hotel exceeded our expectations!”

Reviews.Title: “One of my Favourites in SFO”
Reviews.Author: CarlMaxxJ
Reviews.Content: Love the position. Close to town, on the tram line, close to ChinaTown. Have stayed here 3 times in 5 years and its a consistent performer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: Rudas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best values I have found in the city. Our room was great, nice linens, good size bathroom. The location is convenient and the staff was super friendly. I will stay there again next time I visit SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: apple77733
Reviews.Content: I was in SF with my family and we all loved this hotel. The service was great, everyone was very helpful and friendly. The room was very quiet, and we had good sleep at nights on comfortable beds here. When I go to San Francisco next time I will stay there again. Cable Car close to the hotel was a good addition, and it was fun to go to the Fishermans Wharf on Cable Car.

Reviews.Title: “cozy rooms, lukewarm showers”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer025
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Orchard Hotel this summer. It is in a very convenient location and the rooms are quite large by San Francisco standards. The rooms are clean and the beds are extremely comfortable. The front desk staff was welcoming, but I wonder if they are trained to overlook some customer complaints. We mentioned to the front desk that we were not getting hot water in our shower. They suggested that perhaps we were using the shower at a busy time of the day, when everyone else was showering. Yet this lack of hot water was also at night, not only in the morning. We did not have a hot water shower during our entire stay, and settled on taking short lukewarm showers. I heard other customers also complain about this at the front desk, and the desk staff kept saying "We'll have someone look into this." The restaurant is also overpriced, and usually quite empty. I kept thinking that perhaps if they charged less they would entice more customers into the restaurant. We had breakfast there one morning, and the buffet was minimal for the price. Other than these issues, we actually enjoyed our stay due to its location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheJets0ns
Reviews.Content: We went to San Francisco to celebrate our 25th anniversary and really enjoyed our stay at The Orchard Hotel. We prefer smaller, more intimate hotels and this is one of the nicer ones we've stayed in. All the staff, without exception, were great ~ very friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious, attractively decorated and exceptionally clean and well-maintained and the bed very comfortable. Our only complaint was a loud banging noise off and on throughout the night and we were unable to tell if it was coming from inside or outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: guidotz
Reviews.Content: the room was spacious, clean and nice. great location near Union square. Reception staff was friendly and helpful. Do not call a Taxy by the porter, he increases the fare to get some money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BurtoninLove
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Orchard was wonderful! My Fiancé and I stayed here for four days, and were pleasantly surprised by the size and quality of our room. The location is perfect, staff very helpful, and we even used their free movie rentals (much to our surprise) and were impressed with the surround sound! This hotel is a phenomenal value and we will most definitely make this our home base on return trips. On a side note, don't avoid the neighboring restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Location, D- Service”
Reviews.Author: cscala
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a beautiful weekend getaway to San Francisco and Napa. The city, and Napa are both really unbelievable! The location of this hotel is fantastic as well, being in the heart of downtown S.F.: close to Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, the Fisherman's Wharf, etc.! With that being said, there are a few things I would like to tell future travelers to this hotel so they know, before they go: 1) We arrived early in the morning, because of our flight schedule, and while I understand the hotel room was most likely not going to be ready, the reception we received, upon arrival was disappointing. They took my husband's cell phone number and promised to call as soon as our room was available. Hours later, after touring the city on our own, and arriving back to the hotel around 7 PM, and still no phone call from the hotel, the lady at the front desk proceeded to talk over my husband while he tried to find out why a phone call was never made to us. We took that as a sign that they prefer not to answer any questions about their service, but rather talk over us instead. That was just the beginning of the mediocre service of this hotel. 2) Upon entering our room to freshen up, from our morning travels and day excursions in the city, I found the toilet to be in not working order. Luckily, it was a simple matter of lifting the cover of the tank, moving things around the inner workings of the tank, and making the toilet work, that we did not need to call for further hotel assistance-thanks to my husband's knowledge of how toilets function, because if it were just myself in the room, I would have been calling downstairs, requesting help in a heartbeat! 3) While I applaud the efforts that this is a "green" hotel, and part of the L.E.E.D hotel chains, they really need to decide what they want you to enjoy, as far as basic amenities are concerned. For example, I would consider myself a fast shower-taker, as well as my husband, and yet, in the morning (or even in the evening for that matter), we would find ourselves with no hot water to take a shower. While, on occasion, he or I (depending on who went in first) would find that turning the handle to the extreme hot side would, on a whim, give the 1st person lukewarm water for the first 15-30 seconds of a 3-minute long shower (that's even a little too quick for either of us, but trust me, you wouldn't want to stay in there any longer than necessary either). I gave up on even hoping for warm water by the 3rd and final morning we were there, and just dealt with taking an ice-cold shower. While some people may enjoy an invigoratingly cold shower, I am not one of those people. 4) On the 2nd night of our stay, we decided to stop into the hotel's restaurant, Daffodil's, and grab a dessert to eat in our room, after enjoying a nice dinner in the city. Much to our further disappointment, my husband's flour-less chocolate cake was not only extremely dry, but tasted as if they had made it a week prior, and were still trying to pass it off as if it were made fresh that morning. The "homemade" trio of ice cream (caramel, strawberry and oatmeal cookie-a strange combination, in my opinion, but the caramel flavor was really and truly the only enjoyable and seemingly fresh tasting one of the 3) were scooped out with a tiny melon baller, to which the hotel had the nerve to charge $8 for each lousy dessert. 5) We decided it was unfair to give the hotel restaurant only 1 shot at proving themselves to be a good restaurant, so we went down for breakfast the following morning. When the waiter finally came over to ask if we would like anything to drink, we both ordered coffee, and when they came, the waiter did not bring any milk for the coffee, which seems like a standard in most places, but OK, a small oversight, no big deal. They have a small "buffet" for $14/person, or you can order a la carte from their somewhat limited breakfast menu. If you're expecting eggs, waffles, pancakes, etc., included in the buffet-style breakfast, you'll have to rethink your idea of a breakfast buffet. I will admit, they did have eggs on the table, but they were hard-boiled and cold-no scrambled eggs in sight! Also no pancakes or waffles either. They had 3 different types of mini bagels with a selection of plain or chive cream cheese, butter, and 2 different types of jam. They also had 1 type of mini scone and croissant, as well as a choice of white or wheat bread. They had a small selection of pre-sliced fruits that did not look appetizing, at all, and a choice of granola or another dry cereal, accompanied with plain yogurt or milk. There were also no plates anywhere in sight. There were only large and small bowls. I guess the hotel seems to think people enjoy eating bagels in a bowl! We were there to witness more people come in for breakfast, and plates were never placed on the table. But that's just a knit-picky observation of mine. To me, it was more of a continental style breakfast, but I ordered the "buffet" anyway, and asked for 2 eggs over medium, at an additional a la carte price of $2. They did manage to bring my eggs on a plate (if you could call it that)-a super thin oval-shaped plate, that barely had room for my 2 eggs, and an orange slice, for decoration, but in a conscious effort to be green and not have to clean big plates in the wash, I can appreciate the gesture. What I can't overlook is the fact that the waiter only came back once to check and see if we needed a coffee refill, which we did, but also I had been needing a glass of ice water, but never had the opportunity to get his attention to request a glass, until he finally showed back up to our table, towards the end of our meal, to ask about the coffee. But, in the end, he did manage to bring both of us a glass of water, and our coffee refills, so I can't say that our needs were NEVER met, they were just not met in a timely manner. 6) I really don't like writing so many negatives without also giving the positives, and truly there were 2 REALLY great things about this hotel: First, the location. Hands down, incredible!! We could walk everywhere and see and do so many different things all within a 30-minute (max) walk! And secondly, the beds. We slept like babies every night! The hotel was in a quiet area, and the beds were extremely comfortable! Well done with the mattress, pillow, and comforter selections. :o) All-in-all, while this may seem like a negative review, I simply want everyone to understand that if you want a fantastic location and a great night's sleep, this is your hotel! While I don't know how much it cost, since it was a birthday present from my husband, for your money, I would consider looking up reviews for other hotels in the area and comparing other peoples thoughts and recommendations about the service and quality of another hotel. I am very big about quality of service and I was left with a very bad taste in my mouth about the quality of the front desk staff, as well as, in the restaurant. There was a very helpful and friendly doorman/concierge man who, unfortunately I never got his name, but he was great and I hope the hotel recognizes what a great employee they have in him. He recommended places to go eat, arranged our airport shuttle for us, and even accompanied me, and helped me learn the tricks-of-the-trade with the ice machine on our floor that was giving me difficulty earlier in the day. That reminds me: another tip for the hotel, if you plan to go to Napa and by white wines and want to chill them in your room, they only have ice machines on levels 3, 6 and 9 (of a 10-floor hotel). So if you don't mind going on the elevator to another floor to get ice, don't worry about what floor you'll be on. :o) Also make sure to ask ahead what kind of room view you'll have. Unfortunately we were on the inner side of the hotel, facing another hotel, with no city view in sight. Again, I don't know the price of the hotel, and I'm sure there are cheaper and more expensive hotels around the same area, but the location was perfect, and even a lack of quality service couldn't ruin our weekend in San Francisco, because being there with my husband made the trip absolutely perfect anyway! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great loacation, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: iva_van
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The location is great - close to Union Square, Chinatown, Cablecars and some great restaurants. The rooms were clean, the staff were very kind and polite, the bed was really comfortable. We enjoyed our stay and I can highly recommend this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: suzie-travels
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here on a Sunday night. We were greeted warmly at reception when we checked in after 5:00. We were advised that our room had been upgraded to a suite. I was a little concerned when we got there as it was just next to the elevator. No need for concern at all; the room was incredibly quiet. The suite was fantastic with a living room, bedroom and very large, impeccably clean, bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were a dream. We had tons of towels for the bathroom. The shower was so clean that I felt guilty not having a squeegee for the glass when I finished. There was a separate tub and the rest of the bathroom was just enormous. Though we didn't use it, there was a pull out couch in the living room. We were greeted whenever we left or returned. All the staff were just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here for Room Size, Comfy Bed & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SonjaWitt
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Great location at Bush & Powell. Trolley to Wharf on Powell St. Quiet street, but only three blocks from Union Square and two blocks from Chinatown/Grant St. All staff members very helpful, friendly, and accommodating. They even told me where to park cheaper than hotel offered. Not only does the place look clean & well kept, but it smells clean. Bigger than average room which is the reason I chose it. SF is notorious for small rooms. One of the most confortable beds I've slept in. Highly recommend it. I'm 45, and went w friend, but it would be great for couples, too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Floridalady201
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. great restaurant, Daffodil on main floor.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and value for money”
Reviews.Author: CheesyPerth
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, clean! Rooms were made up neatly and cleaned thoroughly every day when we asked. Front desk people are friendly and concierge people are helpful with booking shuttles etc

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, really nice people”
Reviews.Author: whitney449
Reviews.Content: The Orchard was recommended by friends, and we are so glad they did. The room was a great size for 4 people (parents, 2 tweens). The bathroom was HUGE. The Powell cable car went right by the property which was so convenient. Short walks to Chinatown, and Union Square. While my husband bemoaned the fact that you could not open a window, the double paned windows made it super quiet. We had a king suite, which are all located between the elevator and ice machine (usually a deal killer for me), but shockingly, it was not a problem. The one downside was the sofa sleeper in the living area was really really uncomfortable. Not a shock, but we have had better luck with other hotels on that - thicker mattresses, or newer. There are plenty of places to get a quick bite around the hotel, so we did not eat in the restaurant. We had breakfast at Lori's Diner just around the corner and it was great (we did not want to wait in the line for Sear's and I have no regrets that we didn't). They have free movies to check out to play in DVD players in the room, but we could never figure out how to make either one work. The person at the front desk was very nice, and tried to explain it to me, but her accent was so thick, I never could get it. I would suggest they put written directions in the rooms to help with that. We will definitely return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: SFOTRAVELER72010
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant stay. The location was excellent. Close to Chinatown, Union Square, SFMOMA, Yerba Buena, restaurants, shopping, and transportation. Within walking distance of all major attractions. The manager was kind enough to honor a 10% discount on the room rates for first time lodgers. Were helpful and responsive in providing information. Front desk very friendly and helpful. Only had problem with one person who directed us to walk to the Francis Hotel down the block to flag a taxi, instead of calling one or getting doorman to do so. (said taxis would not respond to calls); we had no problem booking one ourselves for next-day pick-up over the phone. Ended walking all the way to the Orpheum, since it was difficult to flag one on the street. The experience made us realize, that if you have enough time and energy, you pretty much can walk all of SFO. The room was clean and well-appointed. Ample enough for two in twin beds. Bathroom was impecable, with plenty of towels and toiletry. Staff was non-obtrusive. I enjoyed the bed. Thought is was quite comfortable and had a great night sleep. My companion found it too soft for a bad back. Only issue I had related to the locked controls for the AC. Was set at 75F, and I prefer thermostat around 70F. We called and they offered to send a maintenance person, but it was night-time, and we declined. The system was unlocked two days later, during our absence from the room. I would not book with breakfast included. Expensive if you want a hearty breakfast. Not very good quality products, and service is rather poor. "Honey, Honey" on Post Street has good prices, variety, and excellent quality. To get there walk down Powell towards Union Square, turn right on Post; restaurant is on left side corner, a few blocks away - no hills to climb. If you are travelling by car, be aware that SFO square footage is high dollar. The hotel had Valet parking for $40 + tax (I assumed it was per day). Saw parking in nearby places at $9/hour. Leave the car outside the city limits and use public transport. Better yet, leave your car in your own garage.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: mitigen
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is very clean, tastefully decorated, and has the friendliest hotel staff I have ever encountered. I usually stay at the larger chain hotels but this was a pleasant surprise. Whenever in San Francisco this is where I'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: chelun
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to the Trip Advisor reviews, and we were a bit surprised when we arrived. It was a bit more run down than we had expected, although that had a certain charm to it. But overall, we weren't sure why this place was rated so high. Our room was clean, but a bit dark and musty. The hotel is located in a convenient area, just up the hill from Union Square, but far enough away to be quiet. The staff is friendly and very helpful with information. It's a great place due to the location, but I wouldn't recommend it for couples looking for something a bit more romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Average and a bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LouiseY78
Reviews.Content: Perhaps because I expected such good things after the reviews on this website, I was disappointed with this hotel. The rooms were a good size but a bit tired, the windows were quite filthy. There was no bath and very poor water pressure in the shower. On checking in they asked us if we wouldn't mind staying our first night in another hotel, as they had guests who wanted to say beyond their booking. We declined as we were only in the city for two nights, had a large amount of luggage being on a round the world trip, and had already paid up in full. I thought the request was quite inappropriate. Why not ask the supposed guests who wanted to stay longer to move to another hotel, as they were the ones causing the inconvenience? I suspect there were no such guests and the hotel had simply overbooked itself for the July 4 weekend. I have since read on this website about similar incidences with the hotel. Finally they billed our credit card for the mini bar which we did not use, and although they eventually refunded it I had to write to them twice and received a rather curt and unprofessional response. Oh, and our free newspaper was never delivered to our room. On the whole I just found the hotel a bit average and disappointing. I would like elsewhere in the area for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good option”
Reviews.Author: blenheim72
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights in this hotel and it turned out to be a very good choice. The location is great - close to the city centre and all forms of transportation. A good idea is to get a multi day MUNI pass so you can hop on and off cable cars, streetcars, buses etc at will. The city's transportation services work really well and we also used the BART to get to and from the airport (it is only a short walk from Montgomery Street Station but rather steep). The hotel is a bit tired around the edges but overall is well maintained and our room (top floor facing the street) was spacious, well equipped and surprisingly quiet for an inner city hotel. We didn't use the restaurant (and neither did many other people as far as we could see) but there are many dining options in the area. The free WIFI worked well during our visit. Value for money this hotel was exceptional. We did an online booking directly with the hotel on a pre-paid and non-refundable basis at only $107 plus tax per night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sonicfab
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at the Orchard hotel in June 2010. The hotel is at a great location, near the corner of Powell and Bush streets, perfect to access public transportation including the cable car on Powell. Union Square was just a short walk away down Powell St. The hotel staff were very friendly, and quite helpful with advice and directions. I booked the special rate on the hotel's internet site, and the room turned out to be quite large for one person. Comfortable bed, big bathroom, good bedding. Because of the noise of the cable car nearby, I would advise people to book a room on a high floor or facing the back. Only one complaint : the free Wi-Fi is somewhat unstable and not very fast, the hotel needs to something about that.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced choice Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: vizli
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orchard Hotel for two days before heading off to Napa. This hotel has a great location - a short walk from Chinatown. Many restaurants were also within a short walking distance. The room was pleasant, certainly nice for the price. We were on the 10th floor so we had no issues with street noise. The staff was excellent. We had some issues with the room safe and the repairman was swift and efficient. We also had left some belongings in our car and the front desk retrieved them within minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced location to base their trip to the City by the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: DrRingDing
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the staff are courteous, and the location is great. But these don't compensate for the sleepless night we experienced when the garbage trucks emptied dumpsters in the adjacent alley at 2am and 3am. The hotel staff is irresponsible for not warning guests of this nightly occurrence. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Constantine-TA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orchard on July 1-6 and had a great time in San Francisco. This hotel is located very conveniently to many sights, shops and restaurants, and a cable car stops right on the corner. You are also about 20 minutes away on foot (down hill) from the Ferry building. Our room was very comfortable, clean and quiet. Bathroom was huge with nice toiletries. Fast Internet worked well with a cable but WiFi didn't work work at all. The hotel does not have a business center - we went to the Orchard Garden (2 blocks away) to print out a couple of documents. The restaurant is overpriced in our opinion but it does offer a $5 breakfast (coffee + bagel) on weekdays. In any case, plenty of coffee shops and restaurants around. Overall - very reasonably priced hotel with helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Ellen3434
Reviews.Content: This is a really pleasant hotel. The staff is friendly, the rooms and bathrooms are decently sized and clean. I loved the mini bar (reasonably priced) and bathrobes. The beds are quite soft. I didn't use the restaurant for breakfast - there is a diner on the corner and 2 Starbucks a block away. I asked for a quiet room, without any adjoining door and away from the elevator - they delivered and it was indeed quiet - I could not hear any neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, safe, clean hotel with friendly, attentive staff and quiet rooms in a busy area of S.F.”
Reviews.Author: frabza
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 2 blocks away from Union Square, but from the moment we walked into the lobby we felt like we were far away from the hustle/bustle of the city. Staff were helpful regarding our request re: departure. We had an evening flight, and they were willing to let us stay in the room for up to 2 hours longer if we needed. After that time, they held our luggage for us. Our room was good size and contemporary design without being trendy/cold. Bathroom was also good size. And everything was clean. We were on 6th floor, and room was completely quiet and restful. The value was incredible! We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: podrozniczkaEdmonton
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Did not expect such a comfortable room and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ksamwell
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel in a really great location. Our room was a really decent size. Definitely on the large size. The bed was comortable and the sheets, pillows etc clean and of good quality. The furnishing were all quite old school, but that dididn't really bother us. The bathroom was big and the shower pressure always good and were were on the top floor. Again the bathroom could do with an update, but that doesn't mean it's old, jut looking a tiny bit tired. The location is amazing. Couldn't have asked for a better location to be in the centre of things. The staff were lovely. Extremely helpful and we always seemed to have nice chats. Overall, we had a lovely time at this hotel. It was exactly what we were looking for, for the price we were paying. NO frills, but really a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a good place to stay,breakfast a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: 6092Bob
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in San Francisco, we would stay there again.Ask for a quiet room on an upper floor because of noisy garbage pickup at 3am every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Every aspect was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Chuck92054
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, very near the corner of Powell and Bush. Cable car nearby, Union Square a few blocks away, access to everything is easy. The staff is attentive and efficient. I felt like a priority whenever I needed anything and the door staff was always ready to help with dining tips, luggage help, or simply chatting. This was my third visit to the Orchard Hotel and I intend to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location~I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: tara_ann2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was so friendly and accommodating! Davis gave us recommendations and a map to be able to navigate our way around the city. The front desk staff were also very friendly and helpful. The lobby is not very big but the rooms are a good size and the beds...oh the beds, were so comfortable! We had a full schedule of places to go and things to do so the location made it easy for us to see and do the things we wanted to with out having to go too far out of our way. I liked that we could catch the cable car right outside the hotel and take it to Fisherman's Wharf. Great access. Everything in the hotel was clean and comfortable. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable, clean place to stay. I'll be back....

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we expected it to be (as it was #4 on TripAdvisor)”
Reviews.Author: LPLG09
Reviews.Content: This hotel to us was very average. What I liked the most: the bathroom was very clean itself (room was average clean). Location is good, space is also good. What I disliked: our room was very outdated and it did not resemble the pictures on their website at all (this is to be expected, but I didn't expect it to be so significantly different in regards to how outdated it was). Also, the "gym" is only a room (a transformed hotel room) with two machines in it. not much of a gym... better to go out and take long San Francisco- Hilly walks. Finally, our safe didn't work, and there wasn't a proper place to put your toletries in the shower so you have to put them on the floor. Just for additional info: Valet parking is 40 USD a night, which we are told is ok for San Francisco. Wifi is complimentary (password free network though so I guess anyone can access it?) Next time we will try to go higher up on the ranking as this room/hotel had nothing more to offer us but average service.

Reviews.Title: “Location & room excellent.”
Reviews.Author: emmahamilton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at beginning & end of 3 week trip. First room was on a lower floor at the front so a bit noisy from the cable car on Powell but the second time on top floor at the back & it was very peaceful. Room spacious with 2 easy chairs & the bed & pillows were excellent; decor was restful - dove grey & cream. Had b'fast in resto once & was fine but most of time went next door to Roxanne's or over to Taylor Café. V good food at Postrio's too for dinner. The computer for guest use in the lobby was stolen just before we arrived the second time so had to use those at Orchard Garden Hotel which in fact was better as they have 2 in a business room - much better than standing at the front desk in full view & amidst all the passing hustle & bustle. The quality of this hotel for the price was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Spot in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Speedywheeler
Reviews.Content: Spent three great days at the Orchard Hotel. The room was excellent and the location of the hotel can't be beat. The restaurant in the hotel (Daffodil) was very good for breakfast. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. If you are driving, be prepared to pay $40.00/day to valet park your car. This is the standard daily rate in the central part of San Francisco. Otherwise, the overall value for this hotel is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - fantastic location - accomodating staff - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cjb23005
Reviews.Content: My 80 year old mother-in-law and I stayed at the Orchard for a week. Neither of us had been to SanFran and we both decided just to go see it. We didn't want to stay in one of the big chains so we decided on the Orchard based on reviews and location. For us, we were thoroughly pleased with this hotel. Not sure what others were expecting from a 3-star hotel, but this one met our expectations just fine. We arrived early -- several hours before the check in time -- but were taken directly to our room. We had a room with two oversized twin beds. While our "view" was not all that great, that did not concern us since we only came back to the room to sleep. The beds were comfortable & the room was clean. After the first night, I discovered that the bed frame platform was broken which caused the mattress to sink a bit in the middle. I spoke to Marissa at the front desk the next morning and when we returned that evening, the bed frame was fixed. All the front desk personnel were friendly and helpful. We did not eat in the hotel as it seemed a bit expensive to us but there were plenty of options near by. Our favorite for breakfast and late evening dessert crepes was the Cable Car Cafe...jusr around the corner and down 1/2 block on Powell street. Reasonable prices, good food, and the owner was simply delightful. The last few days of our weeklong trip, he would provide us "extras" at no charge....a cup of fruit...a bowl of ice cream, etc. We also tried Uncle Vitos and would say it was OK. The Orchard's location was outstanding. We did not have a car but we had no trouble getting anywhere in the city. While the Cable Cars were pretty crowded in the evenings, we figured out ways to avoid the crowds and usually got on without a problem. I would recommend purchasing a 7-day pass for the public transit system for $26 which is an outstanding buy and permits you to ride the buses, cable cars and trolleys. Other reviewers mentioned the homeless people being very agressive.....we did not find that to be the case. Homeless people congregate in all large cities and SanFran is no exception. However, most that we encountered simply asked for a handout and when we passed them by, they didn't say or do anything more. My experience has always been ... "you get back what you give out." When you "ask nicely" (not demand) and are appreciative of others, most people will return your kindness. Oh....and one last recommendation on things to do. Go down to the Wharf area on Hyde Street and rent a Go-Car! www.gocartours.com Drive the GPS guided tour of the city in a 3-wheel scooter/car. If you can imagine two old ladies zipping around town in one of these things, it was a hoot. The most fun I've had in a long time. We are probably in more people's vacation photos than you can imagine!

Reviews.Title: “Number three on Trip Advisor?”
Reviews.Author: MitchCalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard for six nights in May 2010. First off I must note that this is a three star hotel. We stayed here because of the reviews on Trip Advisor which have never let us down, until now. This hotel ranked as number 3? Check in was simple and easy but the 3:00 pm check in is strictly enforced. We asked for a high floor that was quiet. We were given room 906 which is high but NOT quiet. There were garbage trucks dumping bins three nights at 2:30 am loud and clear along with slamming doors at all hours of the night. We had to ask for a portable fan to run all night to try and cover up the noise. I realize that all hotels have some noise but this is #3 on Trip Advisor and is not expected. It takes very little money to have soft closures installed on all the room doors to stop the SLAM at all hours of the night and this is not dependant on the star rating in any way. Three days there was no hot water for the second person who wanted to shower. We stay in hotels in India that have more hot water than this one. We went to eat at the restaurant at 8:30 pm on Sunday and were told the kitchen was closing at 9:00 pm and besides, “They were out of most things anyway”. When we finally did try this restaurant the wine glasses were very dirty and even the ones they brought to us after we complained, were dirty. Is this not #3 on Trip Advisor. The “gym” is as mentioned previously by other reviewers, has three machines which are very low cost machines. Our home machines are better quality than the ones on offer. To make up for this the hotel offers guests a “deal” on a nearby fitness centre for only $15 each a day!!! The good points: The staff was very good! All were classy and professional. Temperature control in the room worked well and the room itself was clean and well kept. As well the bed was quite comfortable. We asked quite a few people who work and live in the area what the best food was and were told it is a must to eat at Uncle Vito’s pizza. We did and it was average pizza. Location is good if you want to shop. The homeless are all around and are very aggressive. They swear, yell and follow you if you turn them down. The famed Tenderloin is only four blocks away so it is not hard to see why the homeless are plentiful. I can’t stress this point enough. 20-30 people a day will ask you for money and 50% of them will cuss at you if you refuse. In summary this area is not a nice place to visit. We were told by many people not to go too far this way or that due to the “danger” in all directions at night. Even in the daytime the beggars are nasty! The wharf is a nice place to go as the beggars are a little fewer there but beware late at night. We closed a blues club around midnight and it was very doggy trying to get to the tram. It actually reminded us of Mexico City at night! Perhaps we are just used to a better class of hotel but there were deficiencies in the Orchard that are not acceptable in any star rating! I do realize it is three stars and this is the only reason it received a three from me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JJ2411
Reviews.Content: I booked in on the spring special, think it worked out to cost around $108USD per room per night (combination of weekend and weekday rates). We stayed here for 3 nights and had 3 rooms as was travelling with family. We arrived early and were greeted warmly. As it was prior to check in and the hotel had been fully booked the night before, not all of our rooms were ready. But they were able to give us one room that we could all put our bags in. They even had a welcome note on arrival also offering a free drink at the bar. They recommended a great chinese restaurant in China town which was only 2 blocks away (5 min walk to Chinatown gate, another 5 mins or so to the 'Oriental Pearl' restaurant). That filled in our time until the other 2 rooms were ready. The rooms were all spacious, including the bathrooms, and very clean. The location is great, 2 blocks to Union square and right on tram stops. The staff were always friendly and willing to help. Have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone, business or holiday, couples or families. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not a perfect stay. could have been”
Reviews.Author: montanacwby
Reviews.Content: The Front desk personnel were great, the room was fine although small, but you expect that from a SF boutigue hotel. The bed and linens were first rate as was the large flat screen TVand dvd player, you can get free dvds down at the front desk. I ate at its sister property in the evening and it was great. The down side and I do consider this a serious downside, was that I left my Ipod in the drawer and discovered it about 15 minutes later. I called the hotel, sent an email from the Airport and called and left several messages with house keeping. None were ever answered. The Ipod was never returned. This is not what I expect from a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly very good, but a couple of bad points.”
Reviews.Author: Joe2316
Reviews.Content: Pluses and minuses follow: +Location was great, near business district and the shopping etc. +Trams right outside for easy travel to Fisherman's Wharf :-) +Hotel reception were friendly, helpful and efficient. A real credit to the hotel. +The linens were good quality and the bed was very comfortable, top marks. +Air-con was quiet and easily controlled. +The bar staff serve generous drinks! (hic!) ;-) +Late 2pm checkout was *really* appreciated on last day as I could freshen up before flying out. The problems were a lack of attention when things went wrong... -Phone not working properly (unbearably noisy) never fixed despite 2 reports :-( -WiFi & wired internet 95% down for 2 and a half days! Business users beware, as the hotel will pass you off onto the WiFi Guys tech support (i.e. "not the hotel's problem") - surely it's the hotel manager's job to resolve this, not the customers job to spend 30 minutes in a call centre queue reporting the problem? -Water takes a long time to warm up in the mornings and shower is quite weak (floor 7) -Noise from next room *if you have adjoining doors*, avoid those rooms, as otherwise the noise suppression is pretty good. -Breakfast was lowish-quality & the staff at the breakfast sitting were truly miserable and surly, when they bothered to make an appearance. But some of the above negatives are avoidable, such as the room type etc and overall, the experience was positive. SF In general... Recommend: the taxis in SF- cheap, clean and fairly operated. Food at Boudin for an easy lunch. Fog Harbor Fish House for a fancy night out. Westin Hotel bar (2 blocks away) for it's good atmosphere & sexy staff! The Saloon 1232 Grant Avenue for dirty blues. Avoid: the alcoholics beggars & the Mexican bar round the corner as the food sucks and the Margharitas are too sour.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay at The Orchard!”
Reviews.Author: BrowneyedBaker
Reviews.Content: The husband and I stayed three nights at The Orchard Hotel. We loved the convenience of having a cable car stop right outside the hotel, and it was only a short walk to the subway station. We highly recommend getting a Muni Passport - it allows for unlimited use on all muni lines, what a great deal! Our room was extremely comfortable and clean. Staff was very acommodating and took out the snack bar items from the fridge so that we could put our own items inside. We loved the free DVD rentals. Our room faced the street and we did not have any problems with noise. We got a great deal on our stay from hotels.com. Next time we are in S.F. we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, friendly staff and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ibemygg
Reviews.Content: We received a very warm welcome upon arrival and the staff were friendly and helpful throughout our entire stay. Our room was quiet and comfortable. The location of the hotel was excellent: walking distance to transport services, shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SHS2010
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is the perfect location for walking all around San Fransico - pretty centrally located. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the rooms were clean and well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: apples99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard in late May, early June and though we usually stay with the usual chain hotels, the prices were way to high and some didn't have any availability. So we looked around, and we chose Orchard and we had wonderful stay. The beds were amazingily soft and comfortable. I wish the towels were a tad bit more softer, but it was fine. The room and the bathroom was spacious and it was great being right in the middle of it all and not having to pay a fortune for it either. Parking is expensive, but use the parking lot just down the block (Stockton and Sutter parking) for a fraction of the cost. It was because we stayed here, we fully able to utilize this parking lot. It's just down the block and its safe. The front desk is helpful, and since not a big hotel, you can't really get room service whenever you need it, but that's the beauty of it. It's nice, not loud and ideally situated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GravityLady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you are looking to be in the middle of it all without being right on union square. The trolley car was right out our door to the left and the city bus transit was right out our door to the right. The rooms were quite, clean, and updated. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay there again without hesitation!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeannieO23
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a couple of times on business over the past few months. It is "hands down" one of my favorite hotels. It's quiet and comfortable. The restaurant is terrific. Try the braised short ribs.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, 3 blocks to Chinatown, on a cable car line and down pillow-licious”
Reviews.Author: teefore2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found The Orchard maybe seven years ago and found its location and room rate attractive. Cornell, the concierge/doorman, has been there for 10 years and knows good spots to eat, museums, all the stuff that makes visiting SF a joy. The hotel could use a bit of touch up paint, but the staff is friendly, the bedding in the rooms very nice and being on the Powell Street cable car line makes getting around "old style" really easy. There is a tasty Mexican eatery literally around the corner, Scala's (lovely Italian place) is a few blocks down the hill, as is Union Square and Sears, a classic breakfast joint. We've also stayed down the block at the sister Orchard Garden Hotel...it is also a bargain. When we go back to SF we'll book either one of these spots if they hold their pricing down.

Reviews.Title: “This is a GREAT hotel!! at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: possumpal
Reviews.Content: Arriving after traveling for 24 hours the very helpful reception staff checked us in even though it was only about 11.30am. This is a huge bonus when you are very tired and really want a shower to wake up! The room was clean and well maintained with a King size bed and a large bathroom. Good quality toiletries, towels and robes were provided. We stayed three nights and housekeeping provided clean towels and more toiletries as required. The hotel is centrally located with a cable car stop at the corner and is easy walking distance to shops, restaurants and Union Square..

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, couldn't really fault it.”
Reviews.Author: dee_jay_ay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while on holiday in San Francisco last year. It's reasonably centrally located. The staff were friendly and attentive. The rooms were comfortable, with free Wifi. I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “good value particularly for the location, well managed”
Reviews.Author: aavery
Reviews.Content: Obtained a very reasonable rate on the hotel's website, stayed 4 nights, very close to Union Sq. and Nob Hill for a fraction of the price of those locations. Beware however, parking a car costs $45/night incl. tax! Room was attractive and clean, bedding comfortable, free wifi, large bathroom. Asked for and received a high floor room facing the rear to avoid street noise, however, no view to speak of except a roof and another hotel. $5 fast breakfast option nice to have when you don't want more than a muffin and coffee. Some irregularity with the hot water, at least up on the 10 floor, where sometimes it took forever to get hot or we couldn't take a long enough shower before it ran cold. One concern is that some of the funishings seem flimsy (e.g. luggage rack falling apart, TV cabinet/Chest of drawers kind of "cardboard-y", and despite the nice wood veneer seemed like it came from Ikea, rickety ironing board and hissing iron which I feared might burn my clothing). This hotel may need a make over in a few years but for now one can't complain and I would opt to stay here again due to it's convenient location, reasonable price for SF, and friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel oustide of Union Square!”
Reviews.Author: tcouncil
Reviews.Content: Decided on a last minute trip to San Francisco with a lady friend and caught a great rate from The Orchard through hotels.com. The location is very good as it is just a couple blocks outside of Union Square. The staff was very friendly and helpful with their advice. Great eats and shops all around. The room we had was a king bed room, decent size, which was very nice and quaint. The television in the room needed to be upgraded though. It was old, big and bulky.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a GREAT value! Very nice, but a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: me4travel_10
Reviews.Content: We were warmly welcomed upon arrival, and Cornell helped us plan our day looking at our map since we only had a half day in San Francisco. The staff was very helpful, and the room was amazing. We will definitely stay at The Orchard Hotel again and will recommend it to our friends and family. We do not usually do valet parking, but surprisingly this was the best option for the money and convenience at The Orchard Hotel. We learned that parking is an issue in general (and very expensive) in San Francisco, so we feel better about using the valet service. The view from our room was not great, but the location was perfect--just a short walk from Market/Powell Streets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, clean, perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: tupinamba
Reviews.Content: We went to San Francisco for our honeymoon and we could not have chosen a better hotel. It exceed our expectations and we did recommended it to our friends. The location was great and very near there were breakfast restaurants and diners, so there were no need to have breakfast in the hotel. The staff was most friendly and willing to guide us in our sightseeing. If I ever go back to SF, this is the hotel where I'll be staying!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value, comfortable and quiet, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ileftmyheart2010
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed a week at this hotel on our first visit to SF. Our room was very comfortable, clean, had everything we needed, and the rate was not expensive. The hotel is nicely decorated art deco, in keeping with the San Francisco style. Staff are friendly and helpful. I would agree that this hotel is "perfectly" located at the "edge" of Union Square. It was quiet (we slept peacefully every night), yet only a 5 to 10 minute walk to all the fabulous shopping, restaurants, and bustle of activities in Union Square. Chinatown is also walkably close. And, since this hotel is right by one of the cable car lines, getting about by transit "muni" is really convenient (and fun). I would definitely stay here again and I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wabina
Reviews.Content: I was traveling alone and felt very comfortable at the orchard....the rooms are very nice...I am very picky about hotel rooms.....it looks like the price has almost doubled in a months time....maybe that is the season.....or all our wonderful reviews....I loved the radio stations on the tv and loved the sleep cd...I even bought one for home.....bed was great...loved how clean everything was and no smell (green).....front desk and doorman very helpful....great location for everything.....I want to come back.....I could faintly hear the cable cars at night but it was a nice sound......found some amazing restaurants w/i walking.....only complaint.....in the middle of the night I couldn't get cold water to work....only hot came out so I had to take a water from fridge.....also they could give us 2 soaps...but I would stay again any time......and hopefully will get the chance....my free internet worked fine.....

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Samiloupepperell
Reviews.Content: Stay ed for 3 nights after a long flight from London. The room we were allocated was very spacious and had a homely feel to it. The reception staff were really helpful and friendly as was everyone we came across in this great city. The location is excellent, right at the top of Powell Street. We didn't use the restaurant preferring instead to try the local diners and restaurants. We would definitely stay here again during our forthcoming visit to SF in June 2010.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Visitor0510
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on previous comments. The room and bathroom were spacious and clean. Services were great. Staff was helpful. Breakfast was good. A great location. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfulfully appealing and very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: all4metobe
Reviews.Content: Prompt friendly service at all times. The room was beautiful and roomy and I appreciated the Deep Sleep 101 book and CD.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: highlander88_10
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms were clean and comfortable, staff very friendly. Breakfast was expensive but there are many options outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: pattypattypatty1
Reviews.Content: We booked our 5 night stay at the Orchard Hotel based on the great TripAdvisor reviews (and the price) and were not disappointed! We were upgraded to a suite on arrival, and were very happy with the size and cleanliness of the room, the location and the very cheery and helpful staff. We will definitely stay there again, and recommend it without reservation to anyone looking for a very nice, comfortable, eco-friendly hotel in the city. (The only negative was the free wireless internet was quite slow)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: freebird47
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. At check-in I told them that my mom was joining me and asked to have a room with 2 beds. I was upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite with pullout sleeper/sofa. The room was fantastic! My mom loved it. I can't say enough about how friendly the staff were, from the time we checked in to leaving. It was the best. The location is great. You're on the corner of Bush and Powell so the cable car stops right there. A few blocks from Union Square and a few blocks from Nob Hill. I would definitely stay at this hotel again while visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “spacious, comfortable and clean rooms with very good restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: jpe1260
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the largest rooms of any we have stayed in San Francisco. Clean, well decorated and with nice touches like robes and illuminated bathroom light switch. The restaurant serves excellent food and the chef is very aware of gluten free food preparation making it a safe choice for those with gluten intolerance or celiac disease.

Reviews.Title: “Practical comfort at the Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DickDean
Reviews.Content: We stayed again at the Orchard Hotel in late April, 2010, and had another good experience (we've stayed there 4 or 5 times over the last several years). I like the readily accessible internet service, my wife likes the proximity of shopping and the closeness to Union Square, and we both appreciate the comfortable rooms and furnishings. We got a great rate from an internet special offer. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. No doubt we'll return next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Overlook This One . . .”
Reviews.Author: Tenorman2
Reviews.Content: We got an especially good promotional rate (directly from the hotel). This turned out to be a great value. Excellent location (not too noisy at night). Just off the Powell Street trolley and a simple walk to restaurants and shops in Union Square. Courteous staff, easy check-in / out. Rooms are a bit small but totally functional. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “basic great value”
Reviews.Author: Daryl_G
Reviews.Content: I waited too late to book at my regular, trendy hotel so I chose this one because it had a high rating in TripAdvisor and I'm glad I did. It saved our company money and it was a comfortable, clean, quiet stay. The king standard was plenty big and the room bar had some healthier choices along with the normal Snickers etc. The rooms and lobby are cheerful yet nothing special. Not a meeting spot. While there they had, in restaurant/bar one afternoon, a wine tasting sponsored by an organic vinyard with a few other green vendors exhibiting their goods. The bed was a little too soft for my taste but it was fine

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place in S.F.”
Reviews.Author: Pounette166
Reviews.Content: Loved this boutique hotel. Decided to pick this one after the Trip Advisor review and this was definitely a good choice. Its location is perfect, a 2 minutes walking from Chinatown, about 30 minutes to Union Square or Fisherman Wharf (opposite direction). Yes, it is hilly but since we both love to walk, we took it all in strides (litterally). San Francisco is a beautiful city and the neighborhood are just stunning at this time of the year, with trees and flowers blooming everywhere. We walk through Telegraph Hill to see the parrots, then went to the Lombard street to see the crooketed street and to Union Square with their high end shops. The day after we went to Fisherman Wharf - it is highly commercialized, but still worth the visit. The hotel is simply beautiful, the bathroom is huge (no bath) with impressive walk in shower. There is free internet in the room, although a bit slow, but still working fine. There is a very small gym on site, one bike, one elleptical and one treadmill and we used it both days without problem. I loved this place and highly recommend it. Staff was very friendly and helpful and there is a BevMo (where you can purchase liquor, beer or wine at low price) within a block of the hotel. I have already made a new reservation for next week.

Reviews.Title: “Great nites sleep in amazing San Fran”
Reviews.Author: indysydney
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly and efficiently greeted on my late nite arrival and throughout my stay--and had an amazing room with the most comfortable pillows in many a road-warrior stay (bed comfy too!) and lovely amenities in a roomy single. This was walking distance to my conference down the street and the Bart station though I wouldn't always recommend walking to the hotel with luggage--those last two blocks are not as easy on the hotel side of the street due to steps. European Breakfast buffet included with the room was pleasant, but not necessarily worth the difference in room rate as the menu items for entrees were less than the amount of the expanded continental breakfast. Would stay there again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBella1972
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Orchard Hotel. Friends of ours had stayed there a year ago. Great location, trolly stop right out the door, immaculate rooms with tasteful decore, wonderful linens and warm and helpful staff from housekeeping, doormen and front desk. We highly recommend this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old on outside but NEW and COMFORTABLE inside.”
Reviews.Author: publictransportation
Reviews.Content: Reasonble rate for the fully upgraded room with modern bath. Also liked the computer/ internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel - watch out for the hill though”
Reviews.Author: jerseyshoredeb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Orchard many times over the past 5 years (many = probably close to 100). I must say that with the new ownership it's gone a little downhill. But that's not to say that it isn't still a fabulous boutique hotel. In fact, I think the beds are the most comfortable that I've ever stayed in. The shampoos that they give you now are not quite to par, there now is only 1 soap given (hello, needs for hands and body!). The plush bathrobes are still in the closet - yay! No longer is a complimentary continental breakfast served (or maybe it only is during the week and not on weekends). Also, the wireless Internet connection in any part of the hotel (including the lobby) is either Low or Very Low. This has been consistent over the past few years. Ask for the cable to plug into the wall at your desk if you're going to be using your laptop. Also ask for a high level room or one in the back of the hotel. The hotel is located at Bush and Powell which means you are hearing the cable cars until midnight and stating early in the morning. Overnight parking is $40 - not to be surprised at since this is San Francisco. Union Square is within walking distance - do not underestimate the big hill on the way back (going uphill when returning from Union Square). Free DVD rentals from their collection at the front desk (maybe about 100 to choose from). Overall I will continue to stay at The Orchard. I just wish some more of the personalization that made it a great boutique hotel would return. At least the comfy beds are still there......

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price...”
Reviews.Author: utmikeg
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 year old daughter, and I stayed here in late April 2010 and really enjoyed the hotel. The room was nice and the service they gave was great. They were extremely helpful in accommodating us and the staff was very friendly. The only knock I have is the noise from cable car can be heard fairly well if you're staying in a room facing the street (which we were). It's nice having the cable car so close but I wish the walls and windows were more sound insulated to not hear it as well. As others have mentioned, the hotel doesn't have much of a lobby so there's no nice waiting area if you're waiting for a cab or tour bus. Overall, we'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Reemer01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard for 4 nights for a vacation in April 2010 and had a fantastic time! The hotel staff were very accommodating throughout the trip. Our flight got in early in the morning (10am) and we were able to store our bags securely and for free all day. When we got back to the hotel after a day of exploring the city the room was ready and the air conditioner was on. The hotel gave us a room on the 8th floor and they were able to meet our request for 2 beds (as I have an injured back) . The room was impeccably clean, the beds were very comfortable and bathroom was fantastic and extremely large! We were a little concerned about noise in the city, but the room was almost silent at night, and we both had great sleeps the entire trip. The only thing I would like to see is the windows washed a little more often as they were a little dirty which was a shame as the view was actually pretty good! The location was fabulous, right on the cable car. As the stop is close to the bottom we never had to wait once to catch the cable car. The proximity to Union Square was great, less then two blacks. On block is pretty steep, but was really not an issue as it is so short. There is great dining and shopping minutes away, and it was so easy to head to the wharf for an evening. We had to lease early in the morning to catch our flight, and the wake-up call went well, the checkout was seamless, and a cab was already waiting. The staff and condition of this hotel, for the price are amazing. Definitely a five star in our book. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Everything about the hotel - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: joriemay
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the spacious rooms, the robes that were provided, the coffee maker in the room (with tea/coffee provided), the tv's and dvd players, comfortable bed and pull out sofa in the suite. The location was perfect, just half a block from our rental car return and 2 blocks from Chinatown and 2 blocks from Union Square. Hop on the trolley car on the corner. We would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a visit to San Francisco, and we we hope we can return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with terrific friendly staff and great prices.”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesTravelSnob
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old daughter and I were looking for a good value near Union Square. The Orchard Hotel was a terrific find. It is only two blocks from Union Square, right next to the cable cars with lots of great restaurants (and a wonderful little convenience store) within easy walking distance. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. We went to the convenience store a block away and, at the staff's suggestion, used the mini-bar fridge in our room to store breakfast items. We also used the hotel's small gym almost everyday. This is a smaller hotel, so if you are looking for all the amenities of a large chain (concierge, business center, multiple bellmen, large gym), this isn't the spot for you. But if you want a nice room in a great location at an unbeatable price, the Orchard Hotel is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ndeborah
Reviews.Content: The orchard hotel is in a great location ontop of nob hill, with cable cars right outside your door to take you to popular fisherman's wharf, china town and north beach. A ten minute walk down the hill to Macy's and the fantastic shops that surround it And there are plenty of restaurants, cafe's and bars right outside, it's a real find! The staff were polite and helpful, the beds comfy and rooms were classically and tastefully decorated. I purchased the rooms on wotif and was very pleased with the value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great room.”
Reviews.Author: wendyrae_d
