Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on a room at the Orchard for two nights in early April and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. The front desk staff were kind and professional, and the Bellmen were also wonderfully helpful. The room was very nice, everything was very clean and the bed linens were very high quality and I slept very well. There was some street noise, and some hallway noise from other guests but nothing unreasonable or unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathleen1945
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay at this hotel in August, 2009, while my son had surgery in UCSF. The surgery was delayed and the manager of the hotel, graciously issued us all gift certificates to use for our next stay (we had prepaid for the room using the hotel's website and booked a "nonrefundable" rate. So when we needed to go out in January, we used our gift certificates (full amount that we had paid) and applied it to a Winter Getaway rate. The rooms are lovely. Large, comfortable and very clean. All the staff was very friendly and accomodatin and the restaurant was excellent. We were there for 10 days and everything was perfect. It's a great location; 2 blocks from Union Square; lots of restaurants and a laundromat and cleaners just down the street. Very near Chinatown, too. Our taxis were handled by the doorman, and the mgr. Mary Ann Haney was extremely accomodating and helpful. My son had stayed there again in March and will continue to do so as he commutes to UCSF.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sgsilva
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco frequently and have stayed at many hotels. The Orchard is a great find. The location is excellent. The rooms are modern and clean though I had no view. I didn't really care about the view though as we didn't spend too much time in the room. The bathroom was large with a big shower and no tub. I prefer this set-up to the standard tub/shower combo. The room was also a nice size. What really sets this hotel apart from other small hotels is that it is in a new building. Most of the small hotels I have stayed in SF were nice, but in older renovated buildings with slow elevators and tiny bathrooms. The service was friendly and helpful. This is my new favorite hotel in SF for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique Hotel. Great location!”
Reviews.Author: courtneyelc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orchard hotel in December 2008 for six nights. (I know, this is a very late review!). The hotel is in a great location, right next to a Cable Car stop, that could take you down to Union Square or to Fisherman's Wharf. We used the Cable Cars quite a lot and they were a lot of fun to ride!! The hotel itself is quite small, but after all it is a boutique hotel! Our room was very large and had two King Single Beds which were by far one of the comfiest beds throughout my whole trip. The Decor of the hotel is very outdated which suprised me however this is not a major factor, just something that I thought I should point out. The staff were good at the hotel and were always polite and friendly. Overall, the Orchard Hotel is a good hotel, with a location you just cant beat! There was a starbucks and Subway only down the street. I have recommended this hotel to family and friends and had friends stay who have also enjoyed the Orchard!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel close to Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Esher_Steve
Reviews.Content: Booked the Orchard on the back of recommendations on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. Good location a couple of blocks north of Union Square with helpful staff. Initially was in a standard room which was fine - but after a water leak in my room was upgraded to a suite for the final 2 nights, which was an excellent experience (and if the price differential is low then do upgrade as you get so much more space). Rate included breakfast - which was a solid continental affair and ideal to start the day. Probably only minor gripe was the restuarant where I eat on my arrival night - admittedly straight off a 12 hour transtlantic flight - foof okay but nothing special! Overall the Orchard is great if you are looking for a comfortable, smaller boutique hotel - I'd certainly stay there again when next in SF

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, will go back!”
Reviews.Author: LB75
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in March 2010. Gorgeous room overlooking Bush Street. Very comfortable bed, lots of room, bathrobes, tea making facilites, huge bathroom, very clean. Loved the location, cable car just outside and if you don't go B&B then Roxanne Cafe next door does a brilliant breakfast. Also agree with another comment about Maru Sushi, which is just around the corner - lovely food and fairly priced. Fell in love with San Fran, and would go back to this hotel without any hesitation. I have to say the hilly location didn't bother us at all. Happily recommend it. Other notes about San Fran: If you plan on using the public transport you can buy 1 day ($13) and 3 day ($20) passes. Considering a single journey on the cable car is $5, then this is worthwhile. It is also valid on the metro, buses etc. You can buy these passes from Walgreens which is just round the corner from the hotel. If the weather is nice a bike ride over the Golden Gate Bridge is fab. We used Blazing Saddles - not impressed with their bikes so maybe shop around before you choose. We continued to Sausalito - lovely place and worth the extra ride - be prepared to cycle on the road as this part isn't on a cycle track (however it's downhill for this part and you get the ferry back to SF, so you won't have to cycle up the hill!) Colibri Mexican restaurant has great fusion food, guacamole made infront of you, scallops to die for! Can recommend. If you are an international traveller head to Macy's - 6th floor customer services - and get a 10% discount card valid for 1 month.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_A_SD
Reviews.Content: My husband, 8-month-old baby, and I stayed 2 nights at this hotel (3/15-3/17). The staff was super nice and quick. We stayed on the 10th floor, facing Bush St, and had no problems with noise. Extremely happy with the cleanliness and brightness of the room/bathroom. We felt safe in the neighborhood. We did not have a car, we walked everywhere. We took Bart from SFO to the hotel (Powell St Station). It was a fun walk, through Union Sq. We are in-shape, so we did not mind the steepness of Powell St. We liked the location, close to the park (between Grace Cathedral and the Fairmont Hotel), Union Sq, and Chinatown. The European breakfast was nice. We were very happy with the homemade yogurt. It was delicious and it was nice for our baby. Finally, the price was reasonable for the location. We will most definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, will return”
Reviews.Author: rabadac
Reviews.Content: What a great experience. The hotel is very clean. The rooms are spacious. The staff is very helpful. Will definitely stay again next time

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing Find for a Hotel Chain Traveler”
Reviews.Author: stevelieb
Reviews.Content: I opted to stay at the Orchard based on other reviews in tripadvisor. I was not disappointed, great staff who were not afraid of suggesting restaurants within walking distance, a large room for the city and a comfortable bed...all at a very reasonable rate! I know some people were cranky about the hills, but isn't that part of San Francisco. Walked to a great dinner place hidden in an alley, and found Peets just a few blocks down on Montgomery. I would rate sleep quality a 5 given the hotel supplies you with a sleep cd in your room, but the Cable Car running up and down Powell made some noise, but I am not complaining. Valet is $40 plus tax, but again, it is the city. THANKS ORCHARD STAFF!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Wine4Love
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended by friends. We were not disappointed! We visit San Francisco often, it is a great city close to home. We have stayed in many of its fine hotels but will be making The Orchard our first choice in the future. Great location, nicely appointed room, very comfortable and quiet! Couldn't believe how reasonable the rates were.

Reviews.Title: “Simply awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: pleht
Reviews.Content: Simply awesome stay with very affordable price. I had a great couple of days after business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch hotel at great value”
Reviews.Author: rowdyroo
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would find a more-than-reasonably-priced hotel in the heart of San Francisco. The room was clean and tastefully appointed; the bed was luxuriant; and service was prompt and friendly. The hotel is within walking distance of Chinatown and great restaurants, and half a block from 2 cable car lines. Be aware that valet service is pricey ($40 for one night), but that's San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!!”
Reviews.Author: solucky71
Reviews.Content: When in San Francisco I will only stay at The Orchard. The rooms are amazing, the staff is so kind and welcoming and the location is by far the best. So far I have visited the Orchard twice and will continue to stay there. The fact that it is a green hotel is icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were right. A great place to...”
Reviews.Author: MazRGL
Reviews.Content: The reviews were right. A great place to stay. Nice clean and comfortable rooms. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: GL_from_NYC
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is an excellent value for staying in San Francisco. I have been staying there for several years on my trips to San Francisco, and it has been consistently clean, friendly, and comfortable. I highly recommend the hotel for people looking for good value and comfort. This hotel is not the height of elegance or extravagance, so don't enter with those expectations. I have eaten at the restaurant, and it is good. However, San Francisco is filled with excellent restaurants. Its one slight downside is the location, two blocks above Union Square -- almost literally. The last block to Bush Street is quite steep. If you walk around SF, you'll quickly get used to it. If you stay there and like good sushi, I recommend Maru, which is half a block down Powell Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: turnleftpreferred
Reviews.Content: Small lobby area but very welcoming friendly desk staff. Room was very cozy with a large bathroom. Amenities had a fabulous aroma. I only ended up staying here 1 night as found it a little far up the hill carrying all my shopping. They say its only 2 blocks from Union Square...and it is..but the top of Union Square. Most of the shops are right down passed the bottom of Union Square. I shopping was not my aim when visiting, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, ordinary room”
Reviews.Author: stellaseattle
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good value in a very good location with friendly staff. Rooms were just fine- beds a little to soft for my comfort, decor very ordinary but clean. So much to do within walking distance you're not likely to spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: monteroamy
Reviews.Content: Great service, great staff, very large, comfortable and clean rooms, excellente location, excellent food at the restaurant, i definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Jarrah14
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchard Hotel for 4 nights with a friend in November 2009. Loved our stay at this hotel, close to everything, all the staff were lovely and helpful, always willing to help in regards to good places to eat, sight seeing etc. rooms were comfortable. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JennLynn1981
Reviews.Content: This hotel was small and quaint, but when in your room you felt like you were in a large luxury hotel. The rooms were beautiful, the main lobby was small but elegant. It was quiet and comfortable. The location was absolutely perfect, only a short walk from Chinatown, shops and restaurants. The staff were polite and very helpful, and the level of cleanliness could not be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “rushing san francisco”
Reviews.Author: BozzyNY
Reviews.Content: Incredible price/quality ratio. I am thinking right now what possibly I could expect more from a hotel for a two nights stay, probably nothing... Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Marcel_Overseas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 days over the Christmas holidays. Perfect location (close to the action, but far away enough from the noise of Union Square), great service and very clean. Room (up on level 9) was spacious and quiet (I asked for a room looking out over the neighbouring property). Linen was changed almost very day. The only point for improvement would be the quality of the coffee for the cofee maker - we all know that American coffee is awful, but this organic blend was particularly unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “I loved The Orchard Hotel. Wish I could've stayed longer.”
Reviews.Author: purplellamas
Reviews.Content: We arrived a couple hours early for our weekend getaway, but the friendly front desk staff checked us in, no problem. The room was comfortable, clean, and rather spacious compared to some other city lodgings. Free internet, too--can't beat that. I also liked the eco-friendly nature of the hotel, from the organic toiletries provided, to the green guidebook (in-room copy, but available for purchase at front desk). Housekeeping staff greeted us with, "Good morning" and "Have a nice day" as we passed them on our way out. Super friendly staff, all the way around. Location was great--literally steps away from the Powell Street cable cars, but the room was insulated enough that I was not bothered by the street noise (we were on floor 6 of 10). It was very convenient to hop on the cable car down the hill to the Powell Street BART/Muni station and travel all over the city with ease. Numerous restaurants, shops, and Union Square sights were within easy walking distance too. We stored our luggage for several hours after checkout, and even the bellhop guy was very helpful and asked if we needed transportation or directions. Next time I hope to try the hotel's Daffodil restaurant. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff very professional”
Reviews.Author: GozzyAussie
Reviews.Content: Our stay was 2 nights. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The doorman suggested and organised a tour, which we throughly enjoyed. The location was just wonderful. Close to transport, shopping and great restaurants. The rooms were extremely clean. A beautiful Hotel. I strongly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean friendly, happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrandpaPap
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights en route from Boston to New Zealand. Very happy with the choice, made on hotels.com. Deserves the good reviews. No negative comments from us; we were pleased with the room and the service

Reviews.Title: “great place; great value”
Reviews.Author: bds01
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last weekend. Great room for a very fair price. Just a block or so off Union Square so easy access to everything (including a public parking garage, if you opt against valet). We had dinner at their restaurant (Daffodil) and were very pleased. Limited menu but quite good and fairly priced. There was some confusion over our bill (over-charge at dinner) which they dealt with quickly and efficiently. I would go back in a second ... and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoodyG
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful small hotel in San Francisco. Rates are very reasonable. It's located close to Union Square and right at the corner of a cable car stop. The room was large and clean and the staff very attentive. I couldn't have asked for a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: andypark
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through Tripadvisor as top #5 in San Francisco. My wife and I stayed only 1 night, but it was everything we needed in a hotel. Check-in was quick and easy even though we arrived early (around noon.) The valet staff was friendly and efficient. The parking fee is average for the area at $40 per 24hr period, but for us it worked well as we like the open in/out option as opposed to other public garages. The room was clean and relatively spacious. The TV was small, but had a bunch of cable channels including Spanish, Chinese, and Korean. They have a library of DVD's down at the front desk, but my advise is to get there early as most of the newest releases were taken after dinner. Viewing a DVD can be a little tricky as the remote flips open to reveal a hidden keypad to operate the DVD player. Ask the front desk and they will be happy to help you if you have trouble. The bathroom was clean with a large shower (no bath for our room). We didn't eat at hotel as there are a lot of great restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. There is wireless available and download speed was fairly fast. Check out was quick and painless. They have printing available for 50 cents for boarding passes, etc. Overall, the Orchard is a nice place for a night's sleep in SF. Clean, conveniently located, friendly staff with quick service. Would definitely stay here again if we swing by SF again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: noincal
Reviews.Content: We were satisfied with everything about this hotel. Very central location right next to Union Square, good breakfast with plenty of fruit, very friendly staff, beautiful rooms with supercomfy morning robes and a pleasant atmosphere. The price is good for what you get(location and really good hotel) I will stay here the next time I go to San Francisco, eighter I travel with family or friends!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: cwfrank
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. (Very) Reasonable accommodations for the price (well worth it). Other visitors and travelers at the Hotel & Restaurant were of a business class - dressed well, and with good demeanor (not rowdy).

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: casslee16
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel. the free in-house wifi service was a great bonus. The fitness centre was small, not the best equipped (1 threadmill, elliptical trainer, bike), however it served us well. The location was great, and the car rental agent across the road is a great convenience.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ohiotraveler31
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel. We came for the Christmas holiday. The location is great for shopping and was also close to my son's apartment building. We used a "Warm up the winter" rate that was advertised on the Internet. It turned out to be a great deal. The rooms were super clean, quiet and the beds very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MackaySpecial
Reviews.Content: Clean and safe. Great location with walking access to SF Museum of Modern Art, China Town, and Ferry Building. Union Square located right around the corner. Walked to theater district. Great value for price. ( I would easily pay $50 more dollars for room.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ahbutz
Reviews.Content: If you want to explore San Francisco, this place offers an excellent location. It is just 2 blocks from the gate to China town, 50 feet from the Powell-Hyde Street cable cars, 2 blocks from Nob Hill and the Top of the Mark, and 2 blocks from Union Square. The Muni is just 6 blocks down the street on Market Street and Japan town is a walk of 12 blocks. The hotel itself is simple (there is no lobby for relaxing and there is no free parking). Parking costs an additional $40 per night, but that seems to be the going rate in this part of town. There is a restaurant downstairs across from a relaxing water feature at the hotel entrance. The rooms are comfortable, clean and safe - my three most important criteria. The flat screen tv in the room does have subwoofer attached so that the DVD's available from the front desk (complimentary) sound like theater quality. Although we had some problems getting proper magnetic cards for our room door, the service and staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: WilliamBOjai_CA
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, clean room. Although I usually stay at the Marriott, I decided to try The Orchard based on the reviews from TripAdvisor. I was pleasantly surprised by the general hospitality of the staff. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Shh don't tell.....”
Reviews.Author: MChristineB
Reviews.Content: Too many people about The Orchard or it will be impossible to get a room. This is our second stay and it was as great as the first! The location is excellent. Cornell at the front door is always helpful and has a great smile! The front desk staff was quick and efficient. Our room was large by SF standards clean and the bed comfy. The bathroom was clean and amenities were nice. The hotel maid service is quick, efficient and quiet when one is sleeping late, no loud noises coming from the hallway. The restaurant is not inexpensive but the food is good. The cable car stop is a few steps aways from the front door which is a great convenience. Try the pizza place across the street it is yummy. I have nothing but good things to say about The Orchard. It is our first choice when visiting SF. The ONLY thing that could improve the location is the elimination of the hill from the BART station. It'is a killer when you are toting luggage! (LOL) I highly recommend this hotel, you may find one for less $$$ but you won't find one that is as great!

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: geenes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the dates of 14th December - 18th December. The location was absolutely brilliant and easy to get to. If you are catching the BART (train system) from either airport (SFO or OAK) get off at the union square station and exit to powell st. This is sooo much cheaper than a taxi and really easy to do. When you get out of the station however, you may want to grab a cab up the hill to the hotel. The hotel is only a few blocks up powell st, on the corner of powell and bush st, however there is a steep portion at the top (totally walkable usually, but with two heavy bags it was easier to get a taxi). On arrival to the hotel we were greated very warmly and check in was quick and easy. They provided information to us, such as the free DVDS available to watch, the free computer and printer in the lobby for use any time, etc etc. We requested a high level room away from the elevators and were given one on the 4th floor, away from elevators. We checked in early, around 10am, so it was great that it was ready for us then. The room was beautifully decorated in calm tones with great prints of the local area. A decent sized room, with a bay window area with work desk and chair which made for a cosy work area. The bed was comfortable, however sheets didn't seem to fit very well. Bathroom was a great size and nicely tiled with sophisticated details. Water pressure was brilliant, something I always look out for, and hot water was perfect and consistent throughout the whole stay. We had a connecting room and could hear the loud people in the room connecting, also could often hear people in the hallways and the doors slamming through out the day and night. This is usually unavoidable in most hotels though, it just seemed a little louder here, but may be because of the boutique building. Noise from the street was minimal, however there was also a constant high pitch ringing sound that never went away - it took us a long time to figure out that it was the fridge!! Could be very annoying to those sensitive to sound. Parking seemed expensive at $40 per night, but why you would have a car in SF i don't know - all the one ways streets and so many public transport options to get around instead! Free wi-fi in the rooms worked perfectly the whole time. Over all, the stay was lovely. The service wonderful - turn down service each day, staff always asked if there was anything they could help you with, etc. and location really can't be beat - I looked at many hotels when chosing which one to stay at in SF and am glad we chose this one at union square, in amongst the lights at christmas time and shopping and lots of transport options, instead of down at fisherman's wharf, which was very touristy and not that much to do really - would have hated being in a hotel down there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, comfort and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Joedolson
Reviews.Content: The Orchards was excellent. The room was very spacious, the bed comfortable and the staff friendly. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will continue to stay here in SF”
Reviews.Author: Tripper134
Reviews.Content: Third trip to the Orchard and we love this hotel and the staff. Everything from the comfy beds to the excellent service made our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Visiting_vistas
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, which is well situated close to Union square and Chinatown. I had the good fortune of an excellent "50:50" promotion ... $50 per night with the stipulation that at least $50 would be spent per day in the restaurants. A good bet in any case, but exceptional with the promotion. The restaurant at the sister hotel was superb. I ddin't eat at the restaurant in the Orchard Hotel, so I can't specifically comment on its quality.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Value; Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Aby77
Reviews.Content: Great location, 2 minutes from Union Square, great location to visit any part of SF. Brilliant & helpful staff, free DVD'S if you get the time!!!! Thought the rooms could be better but Im not complaining.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-kinda-girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with a a friend. It is incredible. The staff are amazing, the rooms beautiful, breakfast lovely and we got a special offer so it was quite reasonable cost wise. Like everywhere else in San Francisco, you have to climb uphill a bit to get to it, but it is in a really good location for the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peng-Wai
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and everything was perfect. The room was very spacious and the bed was really comfortable. Best of all was the bathroom - clean, well lighted and bright, and with all necessary amenities. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful and service was impeccable. I had a minor problem with the TV and the problem was sorted out within 15 minutes. Complimentary wireless internet worked flawlessly. Location is great - just a couple of blocks from Union Square with lots of eating places and shops. Will definitely stay here again on my next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Eco Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joniann612
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about The Orchard. Everything was beautiful. And they are green hotel located at the bottom of Nob Hill. Loved every minute there. Flawless service. Excellent restaurant and right near Chinatown. We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very peaceful and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: SacramentoProfessor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Orchard Hotel when we visited San Francisco. We have stayed at numerous hotels in S.F. over the years and decided to try the Orchard Hotel because of the great reviews we read about it. The rooms were very clean and spacious, and the bed comfortable. Although the hotel is just two blocks from the heart of Union Square the hotel is a quiet respite away from the noise of honking of cars and cable car bells. This hotel is a great value and I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Meet our expectations - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: nyrookie
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is great - clean, well-appointed, good location, friendly staff, and decent prices by comparison. This was our second visit (the first was about a year ago) and we'll definitely be back next year for our annual mother-daughter trip to SF. So the details in no particular order: - The hotel is 20 minute BART ride from the SF airport and then a quick 5 minute cab ride up Powell (and I do mean up...the hill near the hotel is much too steep for pulling on luggage). Don't make the mistake of taking the cable car up to the hotel because the line is too long and the ride is crowded, especially with luggage (but do ride the cable car at least once on your trip...it's fun). - It's a smallish hotel, so check-in was quick and easy. - Space is a premium in most of SF, so they provide two oversized twin ("three-quarter") beds in the double rooms instead of two full- or queen-sized beds. We honestly didn't notice much difference because they were VERY comfortable and still quite roomy. - We were given one of the wheelchair accessible rooms again, which had its pros (better view of the city from a larger room in the corner) and one con (awkward hand-held shower with low water pressure). - Unlike our first visit, we had some difficulty setting up the free wi-fi this time around, but a somewhat lengthy and involved call to the help desk got us up and running. - We didn't order room service or eat at the lovely-looking restaurant, but there are decent enough restaurants within walking distance in Chinatown and the Financial District. -The hotel doesn't have a vending machine, but there is a slightly overpriced neighborhood convenience store about a half block away if you crave snacks (the minibar in the room was locked and we didin't request the key). - On our last night, some guest(s) starting smoking somewhere near our room (it's a non-smoking hotel), and the smell came into our room through the vent. I guess other guests also noticed this because when I called to complain, the front desk said they were aware of the problem and that security was working to catch whoever it was. It was definitely a mar to an otherwise nice stay, but the smell dissipated within about an hour and we were able to fall back asleep. - The doormen were super friendly and helpful, giving good restaurant recommendations, getting cabs for us, helping with luggage, etc. - Cabs sometimes confused The Orchard Hotel with The Orchard Garden Hotel, so be sure that you know the address or intersection. That's it. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel at an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: nycrite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel for three nights. The hotel was clean, well-maintained, and in a very safe and convenient location. We stayed in a king deluxe room. For two light travelers, the room was spacious and included all necessary amenities. We could not ask for more. The hotel is well-managed and delivers a very balanced experience to its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Busss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel for 3 nights in August (after reading the reviews on TA). We were not disappointed. Rooms are spacious with a great bathroom. We were staying in one of the top floors and there it was very windy/draughty on the hallway outside our room. Wind blowing sounds and very cold on this hallway! Location is very convenient, central but quiet. We always ate our breakfast in the place on the corner of Bush St. and Powell St. Doormen were all very friendly and reception staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: C_tigerC_tiger
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely but I had to submit a review about the amazing service that the hotel staff provided. Davis and the others staff members were incredibly helpful and friendly. Davis, the doorman, went out of his way to give us directions that were easy to follow and saved us time. The entire staff displayed an amazing geniune concern for our needs that made us feel special and added to the wonderful experience of visiting SF. The hotel room exceeded all of our expectations. Quiet, clean, and comfy. The hotel location was perfect. Close to everything but not in a noisy or touristy locale. We were able to walk to absolutely everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: LorraineLondon36
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel on Bush St is a perfect hotel to stay in. The staff are friendly and helpful. My room, if typical, was a good size, with a very comfortable bed and pillows, most important for me. I could walk to the heart of the city in no time at all. A special mention for the concierge, all of them, who where most helpful and friendly. I would certainly stay in this hotel next time I'm in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and perfect location - Hotel Perfeito”
Reviews.Author: JPCuritiba
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, I couldn’t imagine how nice it was... Our stay there was perfect. The front desk guys are friendly and nice, the room was spacious, clear and pretty comfortable. The location is just perfect… few blocks from Chinatown, Central Square and Dow Hill. There are many restaurants around, but the neighborhood is pretty quiet, and at night we even heard any noise. I would go back. Hotel muito bom, com quarto amplo, limpo e arejado, pessoal de recepção atencioso e educado. A localização é singular, muito próximo dos principais pontos turísticos de São Francisco. Se voltar para lá, certamente ficarei hospedado neste hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: steph628
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel exceeded our expectations. We had a HUGE suite with a huge bathroom. The bed was so soft and comfy. The Cable Car runs right outside the building, so its very easy to take it for a scenic ride to the waterfront. It's also very close to the buisness/shopping district, Chinatown and North Beach (Little Italy). I didn't realize it until we left, but this was the hotel Kristin stay at when she visited Steven on Laguna Beach. A little cheese bit of trivia for you! There is no parking (as it's a city) but they will valet the car for $40/24 hours, and there are several parking garages right near by, so there is plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay ANYWHERE else in SF again”
Reviews.Author: merri175
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Orchard Hotel in Bush St and it did not disappoint this time, as it did not 2 years ago. The location is fantastic, walk 5 mins downhill to Union Square, 5 mins to Chinatown, a great walk (20 mins?) to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel is small in number of rooms, but has all the ammenities that a traveller needs. The rooms were immaculate and generous in size. The king size bed was comfortable, and the staff friendly and helpful. We stayed 3 nights at one time, travelled north up the coast and then chose to return to the Orchard for our last night in San Francisco; it's location and price was great compared to other hotels we looked at for our last minute booking. We love San Francisco, and plan on returning a lot- honestly would not even consider staying elsewhere we've been so happy with the Orchard Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, small hotel; convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jadedem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orchard Hotel for a week in early October and loved it. This was our second visit to this hotel and both times the staff were friendly and helpful; room and bed were comfortable and the location was convenient. The restaurant was also very nice-- the meatloaf was great! Didn't have time for breakfast most days but it looked nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “Experience of this hotel started off badly and then deteriorated”
Reviews.Author: 1North
Reviews.Content: Booked a two day stay based on TA reviews. On arrival we were told that some guests had not booked out of their rooms and there was no availability for us, and as a result they had arranged for us to stay one night at the Club Quarters and they would refund us the cost of one night's stay in compensation for the inconvenience. There was not a lot that could be done about the situation although it was fairly annoying as we had chosen the Orchard for its proximity to Union Square and Club Quarters is in the Financial District. Upon checking in to the Club Quarters we were given a tiny room with a queen bed, - apparently CQ does not have rooms with two beds or so they claim. This was certainly the smallest hotel room I have stayed in and the bathroom was similarly minute. The following day around 2.30 pm we duly turned up at the Orchard to check in, to be told that rooms were still being made up. When eventually we got a room, the wireless internet did not work. After spending half an hour talking to the wireless service provider without any solution, I then found that the issue was due to our room being too far from the wireless node for a strong enough signal to be detected by the laptop. Some time later another network was set up which worked. On checking out of the hotel, I enquired as to how the refund for the first night's stay was going to be made as I had booked through a travel web site and pre-paid. I was then told that no refund would be forthcoming as I had booked online and that was that. Needless to say I was less than amused that they had reneged on their word. We also had a maid come barging in to our room despite there being a Do Not Disturb sign hung on the doorknob. She wanted to check the minibar fridge and when I said we had not used anything she then left, grumbling away in her dialect. Putting all those issues aside, I would say that the staff are not overly friendly, the service (what little we saw of it) was average, the room, furnishings, TV and bathroom were dated. I won't be bothering them again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “First class service, elegantly appointed and maintained, excellent dining.”
Reviews.Author: buddy1997
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is a favorite in San Francisco. I've stayed at the Park 55, the Hyatt, the ANA, and others and have found this smaller property is a jewel that can stand up to any of the major hotels. The service is first class, the rooms elegantly maintained and larger than most SF properties. The bathrooms are spacious and beautifully done in marble with contemporary fixtures, etc. I frequently travel alone on business and the dining experience provides attentive service and excellent food. The friendly wait staff alleviate any awkwardness that a woman dining alone may feel. I'd recommend this property for business or pleasure. It has the connectivity you need for business, conveniently located near Union Square and within walking distance to the financial district, and it has all the comforts for a very relaxing vacation stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Brilliant Location, Very helpful and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_V_Rossi
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed for one week at the end of september/beginning of October. We booked based on the reviews here and we weren't disappointed. It was our first visit to San Fran and found it quite hard to get our bearings after catching the BART, but eventually got where we needed to be. The hotel is in an excellent location, just about 2 blocks from Union Square (Go to the cheesecake factory for lunch - in our opinion, the best value meals), and literally on the corner of the cable car stop. China town is 5 minutes walk away, and so too is the Westfield shopping centre. Our room was very big and had a very large bathroom. We couldn't fault anything. It was very clean and housekeeping did an excellent job. The bed was huge (compared to our standard double back home!) and was actually the comfiest bed I've ever slept in! We stayed on a room only basis so didn't get the breakfast option, however, we ate in Roxanne's (on the corner, next to the hotel) and in the Cable Car Cafe (on Powell street, almost opposite to the entrance to Roxanne's). The cable car cafe was very good value for money - Bagels, crepes and healthier options were very good. Reception staff were always very friendly and the concierges were brilliant - we asked for restaurant recommendations a couple of times and they were spot on. (For excellent Pizzas you have to visit Uncle Vitos, opposite corner of the intersection - it doesn't look too inviting, but is the best pizza we've ever tasted). Wireless internet is free and more than adequate for our needs. There's also a laptop in reception and you can print for a modest fee (handy if you want to check-in online and print your boarding passes). If you want to travel about a bit the cable car works well but can be very busy with tourists. We found it easy enough to use our 7 day muni pass and caught the buses and F-line wherever we wanted to go. We could sit here and sing the praises of this hotel all day, but that would make this review too long and boring! In short, if you want a great hotel, in a great location, with great staff then this should be your first choice. Overall, we found San Francisco quite an expensive place (maybe because Sterling just isn't as strong as it used to be) but there are gems worth paying for and this is one of them.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: jprocter
Reviews.Content: I chose The Orchard Hotel based on the reviews in tripadvisor. The hotel is everything good said about it previously. The room and bed was so comfortable and the front desk personnel pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: gwaredd
Reviews.Content: First time stay in SF using The Orchard, it was excellent. Large rooms (for SF centre), comfortable bed, quiet (for SF centre) and with excellent in room facilities. Tastefully furnished, well maintained, excellent housekeeping staff etc. The only two negatives are parking is expensive (but reasonable for SF) and in a nearby garage (Valet is available) and the coffee in the room was of substandard quality. Other than that, a very highly recommended hotel, and we would very happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fulcon
Reviews.Content: We were in SF to visit aging relatives but we wanted to be downtown so we could savor a little San Francisco atmosphere. The Orchard had comfortable beds, a friendly and helpful staff and telepathic service. Its in a great location. We were able to squeeze in some shopping in Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf because they were both nearby. The only problem we had was slow dinner service at the Daffodil Restaurant but they discounted the bill to make up for the wait and the food was good. My mother and sister stayed in a very comfortable suite and my wife and I were in a double which was small but adequate. Like all top-tier SF hotels, the price was breathtaking but no more than any comparable place. All in all I would recommend the Orchard and return there myself.

Reviews.Title: “Can hardly imagine a better hotel in the very heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Mister_Simple_Truth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply the best we had in our 2 week trip. Best comfortable beds in a long time, very clean and spacious room for san francisco. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Location is perfect, cable car right on the corner. Next to a lot of good restaurant. Contrary to other reviews I saw here, our hotel room was very quiet and no out-of-the-odrinary noise for a downtown bugged me or my girlfriend. Highly recommend to anyone who wish to have a great place to start exploring san Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lateralus_59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard for two nights in August. Check-in was freindly and efficient. Our room was spacious (for downtown San Francisco), well appointed (although it must be time to swap the CRT TV for a flat screen!) and comfortable. The bathroom was bright and pleasant, with a large shower stall but no tub. Our room was at the back of the hotel, so no view, but nice and quiet. The location is great, just a couple of blocks from Union Square and the neighbouhood seems perfectly safe. Although its not the cheapest hotel in this area, it certainly compared very favourably with others I have stayed at in this price bracket and I will certainly consider staying there again next time we visit this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: cbmm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on your reviews. Once agan TA users don't dissapoint. The room was better than expected. A delightful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: maidenvoyager
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in a fabulous location for exploring San Fran either in foot or by tram. Union Square and the waterfront are both within walking distance, as are a great selection of shops, bars, restaurants and convenience stores. The hotel is clean and well maintained. Our room was a good size, as was the bathroom. We had plenty of room to put away all of our belongings. We ate breakfast in the hotel as it was included in our rate. It was fairly basic, but good as a pit stop before heading out for the day. The hotel bar is in the same room used for breakfast, so it doesn’t really have much ambience of an evening, but it was good for a nightcap on the way back in. To be honest, with so many great bars and restaurants on your doorstep, you probably will want to go elsewhere anyway. The hotel offers a great DVD rental service, which is good for when you’re relaxing in your room after a long day exploring what the city has to offer. The staff are very helpful and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “The best and most convenient choice in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Tricastravelers
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by TripAdvisor. Web rate was excellent as we paid in advance for a reservation to stay three months later. Staff is very very helpful and the hotel is located downtown, five minutes walking to Union Square and Market Street and close to a tram stop, very convenient. We would recommend to take breakfast in any restaurant by Powell Street better than in the hotel, although service is good as well. Rooms at the upper floors have good views of downtown buildings. Don't make your opinion for your first impression of the reception desk, rooms are large and very well-equipped. Very good choice in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heart beat!”
Reviews.Author: ali4gator
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased that we chose to stay at The Orchard Hotel. I accompanied my husband while he attended a meeting at the Marsconi Center. He was able to walk there daily and I was able to get around S.F. easily from the hotel's location. The bed was wonderful, the room quiet, the room clean, breakfast in the hotel reasonably priced and good. We felt fortunate that we had chosen the place in spite of being unfamiliar with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jervis76
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at The Orchard as part of our honeymoon. I contacted the hotel beforehand to arrange for flowers and champagne to be in the room on arrival as a surprise for my wife and the concierge sorted it all out ready for us arriving. On checking in the hotel gave us a voucher for a discount to eat in their restaurant and there were chocolates and a bottle of wine from the hotel to accompany the flowers and champagne which was a nice gesture. We had a room on the top floor (10th) though there's no great view even from here. The room itself was fine, plenty of space, clean and with everything we needed. A well stocked mini bar which was even reasonably priced, there was a dvd player in the room and a selection of films to borrow from reception if you wanted to relax in the room. The bathroom was large, modern and a good range of toiletries provided. The only negative thing we found was that if taking a shower in the morning we had to leave it running for several minutes to get hot water though it was fine at other times of the day and we got hot water straight away at the sink. Reception, the concierge and housekeeping were all very friendly and helpful whenever we needed anything or when we just passed them going in and out. The hotel deliver a newspaper to every room each morning free of charge which proved to be helpful as we used that to see what events were going on in the city each day and found a couple of things to do that way that we otherwise probably wouldn't have known about. The location is great, just a couple of blocks walk down to Union Square , the cable car runs right past the hotel and it's not far to catch buses to anywhere else you might wat to go in the city. If you don't like hills though or you've over indulged at the Cheesecake Factory in Macy's the last block when walking up to the hotel from Union Square is short but very steep. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back to The Orchard if we ever make it back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel providing a friendly high standard of service with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Westcountrygirl_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great to stay in, the staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the standard of service provided was exceptionally good. Overall the hotel provided good value for money along with a great location. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FuntravelsCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. Our room was a king suite on the 9th floor overlooking Bush Street, with great views. It was a very spacious suite with nice furnishings and a comfortable bed. There was very little street noise or noise from other rooms, which was a pleasant surprise considering we were in a busy part of town. The hotel staff was very accommodating and pleasant. The location is perfect - 2 blocks to Union Square, the Powell cable car right on the corner, and walking distance to many fine restaurants. We will definitely stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MB500SEC
Reviews.Content: The Orchard is a great find in San Francisco. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The staff are all superb. The beds are the most comfortable we have found over many years of travel. The location is very central and safe at night. We highly recommend the Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in middle of downtown S.F.”
Reviews.Author: btrip
Reviews.Content: Terrific service from front desk folks-they go above and beyond to make you happy. I am a light sleeper. Front of hotel you can hear the cable cars and back of hotel has early morning trash collection noise, but of course this is beyond the hotel's control. Otherwise it is fantastic eco-friendly, trendy, new hotel with beautiful clean large rooms and large bathrooms. You can easily walk to Union square and world-class shopping from hotel. Also not far to walk to Fisherman's wharf or the Ferry building if you don't mind walking hills. Otherwise take the street car. Comfy bed, free wireless. I was able to get an incredible special on the price, but even at full price, cost is extremely reasonable for downtown S.F. I am very picky about hotels and would definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big rooms particularly for San Francisco, very clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: SueUKTexas
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed for 4 nights, the location is great, close to Union sq, China town and the Powell St cable car (although everyone that went by was full so try walking down the hill a stop or two). The rooms are a good size, very comfortable bed with good quality linens. the staff are friendly the car valet was efficient, i cannot comment on the breakfast as we did not take that option. My daughter is working in San Francisco and we will definitely be happy to stay here on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and good size rooms”
Reviews.Author: HanD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very central location in the financial/shopping/china town area as opposed to the beach area. In my view this is the better area as it is an area with more locals and non touristy restaurants. The hotel rooms and bathrooms are large and are tastefully decorated but not in a modern style way. The hotel staff are really friendly and helpful and there is 1 computer at reception you can use for internet, emails and to print boarding passes. There are loads of restaurants nearby - Scala at the Francis Drake hotel for a posh meal and Louis Dinner for breakfast which is on Powell Street just one block down. There is a nice coffee shop at the corner of Powell and California (Illy coffee) if you fancy a light breakfast. We got the BART to Powell Street and walked from there (less than 10 mins) Montogomery Bart is not quite as near but the area is a slightly nicer one to come out into.There is a steep walk whichever option you choose! Overall a good hotel for a central siteseeing location in a brilliant city.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: Harveysgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 6 glorious days in San Francisco and one of the reasons for such a wonderful time is the Orchard Hotel. We picked the Orchard Hotel based on the reviews that we read and this is one time when everyone got it right. From the moment that we checked in we knew we had made a great choice in the Orchard. The location was wonderful. The cable car stopped on the corner and Union Square was 3 blocks behind the hotel down the hill. You couldn't beat the location. The room was clean and spacious and had everything that we needed for a comfortable stay. There were robes hanging in the closet, a safe, good quality toiletries, nice soft towels and a very comfortable bed waiting on us. The refrigerator was stocked but if you used anything there was a charge. We just walked down the street to a liquor store and stocked up on soda, water, etc and put our stuff in the refrigerator. Each time that my husband and I went out or came back in we were greeted by the staff by our name which was nice. The staff made it a point to always ask if we were okay, if we needed anything or if we needed directions, suggestions for eating, tours, etc. The hotel has a restuarant, The Daffodil. I can't rate the restaurant since we didn't eat there but it was beautiful on the inside and there were always people eating there for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The price for this hotel was very competitive and we received a first timer's discount. I know that everyone has different experiences but I could never rate this hotel the way I did if I didn't have such a good experience here. I highly recommend The Orchard Hotel to anyone who is going to San Francisco! I started planning our next trip back to SF before we even left with the Orchard Hotel at the top of the list for our accomodations!

Reviews.Title: “Great and Comfortable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: HI_Travel_Bug
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed at the Orchard Hotel six years ago and was very pleased with my stay then, so I was hoping that the Orchard was able to maintain this level of excellence after all this time when I made my booking for my recent trip to San Francisco. I wasn't disappointed. The room rates were very reasonable (we opted against the breakfast because San Francisco is packed with wonderful places to eat), the rooms were clean, plush, spacious, and comfortable, and the location was perfect. Although we spent most of our stay in San Francisco away from our room, we were happy to return to our room every night for a restful sleep and wake up to receive the paper outside of our room door. The bathroom was equipped with all of the amenities, plenty of counter top space, and lots of space to move around and get ready in the morning. We also enjoyed watching DVDs at night before we turned in for the night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They provided us directions to several places we were interested in eating at, gave us coupons to use while shopping around Union Square, and scheduled a car service for us on the morning of our departure. I highly recommend staying here and will be sure to reserve a room the next time I am in San Francisco! Thank you Orchard Hotel for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brickwick
Reviews.Content: We were well looked after for 3 nights here and got a really great deal. Room was comfortable with large bed, coffee maker, good TV and pleasant, clean bathroom. Not masses of character here but a great location just off Union Square (albeit with a pretty big hill to get up - but where isn't there in SF?!) Internet access was free and useful and a copy of the Chronicle appeared every morning. A good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Four star accomodation at very reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: breccia
Reviews.Content: Though the lobby of this hotel is nothing to write home about, the room we were given was very tastefully appointed with a super comfortable bed and nice linens. The bathroom was also more than adequate. The location is great, within easy walking distance of Union Square. If you are looking for a comfortable, clean, upscale but not posh place, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: etang56
Reviews.Content: A small upscale hotel with a great location near downtown San Francisco. The service provided by ALL staff was friendly and excellent. The everything in my room were first rate and in excellent working condition.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: BrowsingRome
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Easy access to everywhere. We only spent 3 days in SF and the location makes it easy to see the city. I requested for a high floor and was given a room on the top floor. Clean and spacious rooms. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, hotel, location, staff”
Reviews.Author: kemper1974
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed the hotel and room. Great location close to shops, cable car stop, Chinatown. Nice area to walk in.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience all the way around”
Reviews.Author: DivaSt_Paul
Reviews.Content: What a great find. Nice value, young woman during reservation did all she could to help me get a great deal as well as ask what we were doing while we were in SF. Perfect location, nice deal on breakfast, everything fresh. The staff were so friendly. Nice rooms. Loved it all.The fitness center was not really a fitness center with 3 machines and no weights but oh well

Reviews.Title: “Close to Union Square, very clean, free DVD rental”
Reviews.Author: ashatan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. It was a very comfortable stay. The room was huge and modern. The bathroom was very clean and new. The cleaning service was provided twice a day. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and nice, not too tiresom. There was no big lobby. it was possible to borrow dvds for free from the reception and watch them in the room with good sound system. Free high speed internet (not so fast). I guess the only negative side was that it was not possible to open windows in the room. The air condition was silent and good though.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: lundunNM
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 6 day stay at the Orchard Hotel in July. It is perfectly located, with easy access to all the public transportation, great restaurants nearby, easy walking distance to galleries. museums (Modern Art and Asian), Chinatown and stores. The hotel itself is great with a pleasant and extremely helpful staff, rooms that are quiet and relaxing with beds that are fantastic after a long day taking in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Value, and Comfort in Downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: PGfromClayton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in mid-June 2009 and we loved it. The price was extremely reasonable for the location. Our room was larger than most downtown city hotel rooms I've stayed in. The room was clean, comfortable and the bathroom was especially roomy. The complimentary in-room internet access was appreciated, as many city hotels like to charge extra for this convenience. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We never ate in the hotel restaurant because there were so many great options within a block or two of the hotel that were less expensive. We were on-the-go most of the time so we went to the Cable Car Cafe or Lori's Diner for a quick breakfast most mornings and then hopped on the cable car or Muni to explore the rest of the city. The hotel is centrally located and convenient to everything you could possibly want to do in San Francisco via walking or public transportation. With the streetcar located literally 10 seconds away from the hotel entrance you have easy access to the city. I would definitely stay here again. TIP: buy a Muni Passport for unlimited rides on public transportation and save A LOT of money on getting around the city. This includes unlimited rides on the cable cars (which cost $5 one-way otherwise) as well as unlimited rides on the Muni system. http://www.sfmta.com/cms/mfares/passports.htm

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ijabber
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ochard for our honeymoon. Great location. You can walk to just about anywhere or take the Cable Car which stops right at the corner. Like most boutique hotels the rooms are small but charming. It has a great resturant and lougne. The staff was very helpful. We would love to re-visit and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard Hotel was clean, nice, and conveniently located to all tourist areas.”
Reviews.Author: janeth120
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to stay in San Francisco. My only complaint would be their business center, or lack of, and very slow internet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and a great value”
Reviews.Author: jeyjae
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to stay here again. The hotel is nestled in a great location, in walking distance to many things such as Union Square and China Town. The staff was friendly, the rooms clean and spacious, and you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: J57-NC
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Orchard after reading the reviews here and was not dissapointed, and the spring into summer rate was a great value compared with other hotels in the area. The king room was quite spacious with an extremely comfortable bed and I especially loved the fluffy towels and bath robes. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The location is perfect and the cable car practically stops at the door although sometimes they're full when they get there, but a quick walk down to Market Street and you can pick up a cable car at the turnaround or hop on the F-Line to get to Fishermans Wharf. If you bring a car the valet parking is quite expensive and there are cheaper garages in the area if you self park.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a night”
Reviews.Author: bobonthego
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just fine for a night if you have business in the financial district. It isn't exciting, but it offers everything the business traveler needs in a prime downtown location and not all that far from some good restaurants. This would not be my first choice as a tourist, but for business it was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - spacious, clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pi314
Reviews.Content: Our main objective for our hotel in San Francisco was for it to be centrally located for easy access to Union Square and the main sites. As we intended to spend most of our 3 days in SF out exploring we didn't want to spend a fortune on a hotel, but (especially as it was our honeymoon) we did want somewhere nice. The Orchard Hotel met this and so much more. The hotel lobby was a bit smaller than I had expected, but the front desk were very friendly and we were checked in quickly. Our (standard) room was very spacious and the bathroom brand new and huge for a city hotel room. We were on the 8th (9th?) floor, so were well above any traffic and didn't hear a thing from outside. They had matched an expedia offer I had seen for $135pn, which I thought was a bargain for this room. We dined in the restaurant one evening and not only was the food delicious, but that evening they had wine at 50% off so cue the $100 2005 Swanson! When we checked out we had to get back to the airport to pick up our hire car and the hotel quickly grabbed their chaffeur to drive us there in style, at a similar price to a cab ($40). A fantastic hotel for business or leisure, and at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient comfort”
Reviews.Author: raetzelman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard while attending a trade fair at the Moscone Center, which was just a ten minute walk away. The hotel was a model of efficiency, with one of the crispest check-ins and check-outs I have ever experienced. The room was spacious, and the bathroom big enough to swing a cat - and all immaculately clean, with nice linens. I had asked for a high floor in my reservation request, and was assigned the top. Overall a first class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic - don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: radbash
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a beautiful suite at the Orchard Hotel, and could not have been more pleased. The room was beautiful, with a huge bathroom. The hotel was very central, but quiet, and very reasonably priced. Best of all, they don't nickel and dime for the small stuff. Internet is free of charge. I made a xerox and sent a fax, and they didn't charge. There is a whole list of movies available for FREE at the front desk, to play on the DVD player in your room - a big hit with the kids. Best of all: the staff were terrific ... helpful, courteous, efficient, speedy, with good advice. This was true of EVERYBODY, including Bell desk, Front desk, maintenance and housekeeping. We'll be back! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel trifecta! Excellent hotel, great location AND incredible value!”
Reviews.Author: Austin_TexasDonna
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little early, yet our room was ready for us - not only did it match what I saw on the hotel's website, but it exceeded my overall expectations, in terms of size, comfort, cleanliness and style. All staff we encountered were very friendly and professional. We didn't require transportation arrangements or other concierge service, but the desk staff was prepared to assist with anything we needed - we were able to check our bags in the bell room after check out while we enjoyed a few more sights before leaving for the airport. The location can't be beat - Union Square, Chinatown and public transit are within very easy walking distance. There was nothing like coming back to a great room after a long day of sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SamHouTX
Reviews.Content: I booked The Orchard Hotel on their website, pre-paying and saved a TON of money for this great hotel steps from Chinatown and Union Square. The rooms are very spacious and nicely appointed. The bathrooms are huge! The only inconvienice is the fact that the free internet access is imited to one computer per room. We will definately stay here on our next trip to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Siobreezy
Reviews.Content: I was embarking on my premier journey to San Francisco so wasn't sure what to look for. The Orchard was the best value for what seemed to be a good location and tolerable amenities. Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised. The location was absolutely prime- a few blocks from Chintatown, a few blocks from the downtown shopping, and cable cars all around. Perfect for travelers going w/o a rental car like we were. The staff was friendly and prompt, they even supply each room with a DVD player a the front desk has an library to choose from. The room even came with robes and amenities (that smell AWESOME). The only complaint would be no mini fridge in the room and no continental breakfast, but for the value of the room cast, it's worth walking the 2 blacks to Starbucks for breakfast instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: floweryflipflops
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and had a preferential rate. It was very comfortable and pleasant and it had small thoughtful touches I haven't seen in a lot of other hotels like for example DVD rentals for free. It's also right next to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel, great location, very comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Valkrien
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is a great place to stay, just 2-3 blocks from the action in Union Square. The perfect comfortable hotel, good staff. Excellent cocktails in the lovely bar/restaurant by DJ

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Visit”
Reviews.Author: movienut12
Reviews.Content: My wife rated the Orchard as one of the best hotels she has ever stayed at. Bed was very comfortable. Room was quiet even though it faced the road. Never had to wait for an elevator. Great location-very close to Union Square without the crowds of Union Square. Try Uncle Vitos Italian at the corner !. Friendly staff. A very welcome alternative to chain hotels. Well run and comfortable. Do yourself a favor and stay at THE ORCHARD HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, fantastic, fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: RedSlippers6
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel was the best experience I had during my recent 4 week stay in the U.S. in numerous cities. Conveniently located, super helpful & friendly staff, beautiful room & the MOST comfortable bed for which I was very grateful after a long haul flight prior to my arrival in San Fran. Highly recommended to all travelers for a fantastic stay in this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marsy00
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Great Price, Great Service. The beds/linens were especially plush comfortable A+

Reviews.Title: “Top place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wingingpom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard hotel with my wife and I can recommend it to anyone both for the size and style of the rooms and also the location close to the shopping on union square right next to the hotel is a stop for street car

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Shojin
Reviews.Content: Large room, comfortable bed, large bathroom, clean, friendly and helpful staff. Will return here next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value”
Reviews.Author: carrot2001
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at this boutique hotel. Friendly and helpful staff, and the location was close to everything, downtown, Chinatown, cable car to Fisherman's Wharf is at doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Stay just for the bed!”
Reviews.Author: SueScotter
Reviews.Content: Wonderful bed! Perfect location, could walk everywhere. Staff were freindly and helpful. Great value fo the price!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Gem”
Reviews.Author: mumziepooh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel for the beginning of our trip to celebrate our 25th Anniversary. It was a perfect way to begin. From the street, you have no idea that such a lovely hotel is behind the doors! When we checked in, to our surprise and delight, we were told we were upgraded to a suite. A gift awaited us to help us celebrate our anniversary. The room was lovely and, most importantly, comfortable! The bath was clean and roomy. Although we were on the front of the hotel, road noise was never an issue! We had a great view. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast - try the scones - every day is different but NONE disappoint! We ordered a nice side of ham to accompany the meal and one was plenty for 2. The fruit was delicious - so fresh. It was a great way to start the day. We found the staff to be so friendly and accommodating. It was hard to leave for Napa! We had lovely stay and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: pagabrie
Reviews.Content: Well we spent two nights at this hotel, when we came the first night we where told that there where no king beds available. We made our reservation through expedia and it said king bed. That much said, we where on our honey moon and felt kinda wierd sleeping in two different beds. but ok for one night.. cause the receptions said that the next day we where going to get a king bed.. do you think we got one.. no! the next day, we where told that there where still no king beds available.. but that if we wanted we could move to a different hotel. that could offer us such a bed. that was just a hassel so we figured we could do one more night.. i asked for some kind of compensation, maybe breakfast.. all we got was a lousy coupon for a bagel and coffie, i had a glas of milk, and had to pay 3 dollars extra.. oh my god! i told the receptionist that we thought this was outrages. Then he said what i thought was the best! well we could expect what we ordred through expedia, cause they where a 3. partner... wow! enough said!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: taace1i1a
Reviews.Content: Though I only stayed here a night, this place was great! I've been traveling a lot this last month, and out of the many hotels I've stayed in, this one sticks out as the best. Easily. The hotel is beautiful and really clean. There's a really cool wall fountain when you walk in. The location is great. Close enough that it's a short walk to China Town and Union Square, and far enough away that you don't have the feeling your falling asleep in the subway because it's so loud, bright and in the middle of everything. The staff was awesome. You could tell they were happy, which always rubs off on me when an employee is legitimately happy working where they are, and not faking it. They greeting us coming and going every time, we were offered a taxi, asked how our stay was, and always with a smile. The rooms were great, the bathroom was HUGE! My hubby walked in and said "Wow hon, the bathroom's a cave!" Anyways, I loved this place and say you should go! It's a little bit of a walk from bart, but if you came to SFO, you knew you were going to walk anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mcrus
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel based on the trip advisor web site and booked directly with the hotal and received a very good rate. The location of the hotel is excellent with easy access to all public transport especially the cable cars. A short distance from Union square and the major shopping areas. The room was very comfortable and spacious, the front desk were incredibly friendly and efficient and the room was serviced very eficiently and to a very high standard. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and relatives but I would advise them to get a room at a higher level and as far away from Powell Street as possible as the noise levels from the cable cars can be a bit of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Central, business friendly, great service and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Kuchinga
Reviews.Content: I last stayed at the Orchard 5 years ago and it was a blink of an eye to be back. The hotel is perched on a hilly location at the junction of Bush and Powell streets making it easily accessible from conference venues but just an arms length from the madding crowd. Surrounded by good shopping, a variety of restaurants and next to nice views of the city (take a walk to the Mark Hopkins and Fairmont), this hotel has an great location. Although they don't advertise this - the location makes it great for taking public transport around the city and further afield. You can start by hopping on the Powell Street cable car that passes just next to the hotel. The service was friendly and very professional. I left a file behind and unlike prior experiences of this sort, the staff too the trouble to search and managed to retrieve it. Internet and continental breakfast were included in the room charge - usually extras in other hotels of this class. I've stayed at the Hyatt Regency and some botique hotels like the Alexander before but the Orchard is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: carlybaby1
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in room 607. A large room with a street view with two windows. Very comfortable king bed with a large bathroom which had a granite counter top and large, glass enclosed shower. Fantastic location just steps a way from a Powell Street Cable Car stop. Roxanne's Cafe, literally just outside the front door, was a nice place for breakfast as was Lori's Diner and Sears, both just a block to a block and a half away, with Sears being the best. Uncle Vito's Pizza, diagonally across the street on the corner, may have served the best pizza I ever had. Front desk very accommodating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Waterrecycle
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Orchard on the 19th June for 4 nights after a very long journey from Australia. The reception staff were super friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 10th floor facing the street and was very spacious and well decorated. I have seen some of the posts complaining about the beds but it was fine. There is a coffee maker and coffee in the room which was much appreciated. The only downsides were that the shower would often turn cold and housekeeping staff were forever (it seemed) knocking on the door wanting to check the minibar, turn down the bed etc etc. Besides that it was an excellent stay and would recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, terrible bed :-((”
Reviews.Author: AthensSoloist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard for 8 nights. When I booked this hotel I was very excited, because of its Trip Advisor ranking. I prepaid 100% and got a great rate (directly at the hotel website). Once I got there everything seemed perfect. Fast check in, all my special requests taken care of (high floor, room at the facade), big room, king size bed, lots of pillows, beautiful bathroom, soft towels, spotless bed sheets, TV with more than 50 channels, even a CD with music to smoothly fall asleep. BUT I did not enjoy sleeping there, because the bed matress was so soft, that made me wake up 2-3 times every night in pain. It was a torture. I am not a nagging person and I was really surprised, because I can't remember having ever complained about beds in hotels. I was surprised to learn that the matresses were all replaced last year. Other than that... Breakfast: you can choose between menu and buffet. There is also an express breakfast ($6 for a coffee and a muffin / pastry). The buffet ($14) offers a rather poor selection, only cold stuff and no ham or cheese except for Philadelphia.
