I had flowers delivered 3 days in a row and they were always in our room in water/vase when we arrived. James and Bob (doormen) can do and will do anything you need. They are professionals at taking care of the details. A great treat was meeting the hotel owner Mrs. Huang. She told me "I tell my staff that I only have the money our guests spend here to pay you. So, treat them with respect and treat them well so they'll come back and so they'll refer their friends to us. Otherwise, we won't be able to stay in business". Trust me, the staff hears and responds. If you're looking for a great place to stay in San Francisco, make one phone call - to the Orchard Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was everything and more! All the little extras, very nice breakfast. Free internet and movies.Will defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 2 blocks from Union Square and all the shopping you can handle. It is beautifully decorated. The rooms are large, spotless, and fully equipped with anything you need. The fitness center is easy to use and is open most of the time (4 machines.) Your car is parked in a nearby garage and takes about 30 minutes for it to be pulled up in front of the hotel for you. Most of the staff is friendly, helpful, and professional. The dining menu was limited and we did not eat in the hotel (many places nearby.) The only problem we had was in the lounge. We waited for drinks and left after 20 minutes. Our stay was very enjoyable and I would re-book in this well managed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond....”
Reviews.Author: DavisTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard hotel with a friend for a getaway weekend in the city. We were greated by kind and genuine employees from the front door to the front desk. Shortly after arrival I received a call from the front desk that my car wouldn't start and couldn't be moved to valet parking. Several of the staff came out and we all tried to figure out what was wrong. This was of course well after closing of repair shops but they helped us find numbers for AAA and for a local dealer and made what could have been a crummy situation as easy as possible. I feel that they went above and beyond the call of duty and can say that the rooms and amenities in the rooms were in line with this assessment as well. Good size rooms for the city and very comfy beds and the bathroom is bigger than the one in my home. So, I will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Fantastic Location, shame about the resturant/bar”
Reviews.Author: MarkCornwall_UK
Reviews.Content: First trip to San Francisico and loved it. We had a suite on an upper floor with a view of the front street and cable car. The reception staff were lovely and helpful and the suite was very nice, spacious, clean and quiet. The location is absolutly perfect for getting around. The only negative was we were very disappointed with the service we got from two male members of the bar staff. We were visiting with our two children aged 7 and 14 and we had spent a day doing a lot of walking, in the evening they were very tired and we allowed them to stay upstairs watching TV whilst we decided to go down and eat in the restaurant. We asked the barmen if we could have two cheese sandwiches sent to the room for the boys. They said this could not be done as it wasn't on the menu, we persuaded them to go and ask the chef but apparently the chef said that although he had both cheese and bread there was no way he was going to do this. When we explained that the boys were upstairs watching TV after a long day and just wanted something quick and easy one of the two barmen commented that perhaps the solution would be to turn off the TV! In fact both of these barmen had a friend at the bar and were more interested in discussing "adult" web sites with each other thank attending to their guests. Yes it was a quiet night and the restaurant was empty and we were the only two at the bar, however this is no excuse. Needless to say we declined to eat at the restaurant and went down to Subway to get a sandwich for us all. We really feel this let them down a lot and was not the sort of service that appears to get them such a good rating on trip advisors web site and so accounts for them not getting 5 stars from us. We would like to say that the young girl who works the restaurant floor and the lady who works on the bar were very nice, chatty and helpful and perhaps the two gentlemen might take a lesson in good manners and a helpful attitude from them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard hotel for two nights (June 5th to 7th). Cannot complain. The rooms were very comfortable and clean, spacious enough for two adults with huge luggages. Wasn't much of a view but that is to be expected. The bathrooms were bright and spacious - very cheerful - though ours only had a shower (so be sure to ask for one with a bath if you need one). Continental breakfast served was more then adequate and in a nice and pleasant restaurant in the hotel. Again, very bright and cheery. The staff were superfriendly and location is great. The option of renting DVDs from the front desk was a nice touch Only drawback would be the limited room service. So we found ourselves in a small fix when we ended up hungry at 2 am as a result of terrible jet lag. Nevertheless, the hotel is surounded by nice restaurants so if you're eating at normal times, there is little need for room service. Having stayed in many larger chain hotels, the Orchard Hotel was a really pleasant surprise. I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Terranova65
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel was absolutely fabulous. I choose to stay there based on the reviews I read on this site, not to mention the awesome rate I received. Everything I read was right on, down to the very professional and courteous staff. I was traveling alone and felt safe in their care. The location is prime. The hotel is definitely within walking distance or a quick cable car ride to the best sites in San Francisco. The rooms were immaculate and the Aveda products were a plus, not to mention their complementary robes which are to die for. I think you can purchase them also. This trip was business but the next is pleasure with my kids. I will not hesitate to stay at The Orchard again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne_tc
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. We spent two nights here and very much enjoyed the location, the ambience, the breakfast, the staff and the room. The room was spacious with a large bathroom. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and the breakfast was nice. We couldn't help but feel like we were in Europe. The display looked like and felt like an European setup. You'll enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lacunar
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel is an excellent choice for someone looking for an above average hotel at a reasonable rate. The location is superb. Located in Union Square, you are within walking distance of the financial district, quality shopping areas, Chinatown, and Little Italy. The Cable Cars stop half a block from the front door of the hotel, providing quick and easy access to Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel rooms are of an average size but are tastefully decorated. The showers are powerful, and it only takes a few seconds for the water to become hot after turning-on the faucets. The breakfast included in the room price is above average, featuring coffee cakes, fruit, toast, hard boiled eggs, ham, cheese, and a selection of juices/coffee/tea. My only complaint with this hotel was the poor quality of the pillows. Other than that, I was very pleased with this hotel and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Superb ratings”
Reviews.Author: CK1668
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard on May 6th, 7th, and 12th for three nights. We couldn't enjoy more. Everyone at the front desk, especially Tammy, were extremely helpful. Check-in & check-out were a breeze. We loved the bed sheets, comforter, & pillows. They are Frette linens, top quality European linens, super comfy & soft so we were able to sleep very well at night. There were a variety of TV stations to choose from, including my favorite Satellite channels: Food network, In Style, and Bravo TV. Also complimentary were the wireless, high speed internet. You couldn't find more in a hotel under $200 around Union Square. We thought this was a steal! We booked the park & stay pkg so our parking was only $18/day (a bargain in Union Square), with unlimited in-&-out priviledges. It was nice since we just notify the front desk that we needed the car, and the car will be available to us in 15 min. Very convenient indeed. To add to this, breakfast was complimentary & included fresh bread & muffins, cheeses, cold cut, hard boiled eggs, fresh fruits, & plenty of juices, coffee & tea. More than enough to start our day. The hotel is located far from the tenderloin area & we felt very safe walking back & forth without stepping onto the bad area in town. All in all, we would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have been happier with a hotel, the staff, and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't think that a reasonably priced hotel needs to be anything but a great experience. This was perfectly situated (I mean right on a cable car line) and the staff were the friendliest and most helfpful I've experienced anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Else Compares for sub-$200 Category”
Reviews.Author: koolchas
Reviews.Content: Before my stay at The Orchard, I was convinced that any hotel priced under $200/night was a dump. The Orchard proved me wrong and I say with a smile, I am glad I found a perfect place that fits all my needs when in SF on business trips (which is several times a year). When booking, I requested a high floor room and stated I would have a late check in (did not arrive until 11pm). I was so happy that I got on the top floor as typically such a request is a shot in the dark when you have a late check in a full hotel. The staff was very friendly. Everyone was smiling and very communicative about the services offered by the hotel. I was even more happy when I opened my door and entered my room. For ONCE, I was in a very clean room. No stains! I knew the hotel offered a DVD player as well as a DSL connection but, as typical in other hotels I stay in, I did not expect much when turning on the TV. I turn on the TV and guess what .... The Orchard offers free standard cable and HBO; not your typical 10 or so channels. Also, the TV is a normal TV not tied to some hotel menu driven system in which you have to pay for movies or pass a menu screen first. So in this respect, you have a feeling of being at home. They offer a wide variety of movies for free use at the counter. But, knowing they have a DVD player, you can always bring your own too. Since I was there on business, I bring a laptop. The DSL connection service is great. Simple to set up, logon, and use - they even provide cables if you forget yours. Unlike tourist (I used to live in SF so know the City), when in SF, after a long workday I typically just get take out after work and head to my hotel and relax. So, these simple accomadations are very important and made my stay very comfortable since I spend considerable time in the room. The hotel itself is very clean and nice. You won't get fancy high-end furnishings (REMEMBER this is under $200/night) but, you will get nice up-to-date simple, clean and modern furnishings. Very clean bedding with very soft pillows. The bathroom is nice with Avena products. My room also had a bar area with a fridge and coffee maker. The included breakfast is basically coffee, juice, a few cereal options, a wide variety of bread choices, fruit, jelly, cheese, hard boiled eggs, and lunch style meat. Nothing fancy, nothing made to order but, very decent and FREE. You do have options for parking. There are several garages around the hotel but, I chose to valet park at approx $39/night. Bascially, the garage up the street parks your car for you. You can park in the same garage directly yourself for a few dollars cheaper if you wish but, if you are going in/out USE the hotel valet service since if you park yourself, you cannot go in/out and have to pay each time you exit. There is also another garage down the street from the hotel that can be even cheaper but, I beleive you have to park after 5pm and leave by 7am the next othewise, the standard downtown rate of approx. $35-40 applies. If you book on the Orchard website, they do have a "Park and Shop" special which includes parking but, it was not available when I booked this stay. Luckily, I return next month and that package was available. If available, nothing beats that package and the daily rate is still well under $200. Expect to pay around $230/night if paying for parking separately (still an excellent value for what you get in this hotel). Can't say enough about the staff and customer service. You'll get a reminder email about the hotel a few days before your reservation date too. Also, when I checked in, the front desk was very speedy ... I did not see the same person until I checked out 4 days later and as I walked out of the elevator she addressed me by name which I found impressive. The bell hops, parking attendants, and maids were all very friendly too. Now is this hotel without any issue? Ok, in all honesty (with all my reviews) there was only ONE thing. My room had a door that connected to another room. That door is not a good sound barrier. One morning, I did hear a conversation in the room next to me but, in fairness I know the person was on a cell phone since she was talking business and talking very loud and standing right next to that door. The rooms have a surround sound system too. I can see a possible issue if someone next to you is not "polite" at night and decides to blast that system watching a DVD. But, for my stay that was not an issue. So to sum this up ... a SF hotel for under $200/night that provides a clean room, a free DSL connection, a good variety of TV choices, a DVD unit which you can bring your own or borrow from a wide selection, up to date simple furnishings, a good parking package for the area (if available), free breakfast, and a very friendly staff .... I know it sounds too good to be true but, IT IS! The Orchard can't be beat for the price in a great downtown location. It's just a few blocks from Union Square. For being in downtown, the location is actually quiet. I did not see any of the negativities normally seen in SF around this hotel (such as the homeless). Needless to say, I was impressed. The front desk also mentioned they are in the process of building a second hotel nearby this one. I've posted a few reviews on SF hotels here and honestly, this is the first positive review of mine for SF hotels priced under $200/night. Looking forward to my next stay which is already booked in June!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: beckysharpe
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Orchard with my family. I have stayed in various hotels in SF over the years (the Triton, the Juliana, the Rex) and this was far and away the best. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. The maid service was excellent - on two days our room was made up while we were at breakfast. We had a suite which was spacious, well-furnished and in good condition. The complimentary breakfast was great and very plentiful, and we appreciated the free internet access - as another reviewer pointed out, most hotels charge for this. The central location is very handy for Downtown shopping and the BART station. It is true that the garbage trucks are noisy (I was woken about 5 am on two mornings) but I guess this is to be expected for a centrally located hotel. I didn't hear any noise from other rooms or from the corridors, even though we were right by the elevators. I would probably recommend the hotel to business travellers (who seemed to comprise the majority of the guests) and couples without children, rather than familes with small children, but having said that I would definitely stay at the hotel if I return to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Convinience and service excellent!”
Reviews.Author: catwings
Reviews.Content: Very good service. A nice room on the 10th floor with all the things you expect from a business class hotel. Large room, king sized bed, mini bar, iron, hair dryer, good sized bath. Breakfast is included. It's a cold buffet with a selection of baked goods, fresh fruit, plain yoghurt, cereal and even sliced cheese and ham. The only complaint was that it was exactly the same every day. In house excercise facility was very small. You can go to a gym down the street for $15 / day if the streets of SF don't provide you will enough excercise. Very convinient location. Good value. Excellent, helpful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. You won't find a better hotel for the price - we got it for $179/night through The Orchard's website. The location is right off Powell, so the cable car stop is right at the corner. Chinatown and Union Square are each just a short walk away, and it's not far to Market Street where you can catch BART or a city bus to get around easily. The front desk staff was helpful and pleasant, there are Aveda products in the bathroom, the rooms were comfortable and clean, and they have a large selection of DVDs available for loan. There are plenty of restaurants and shops in the area. We would definitely stay there again, and since we had a great time in San Francisco we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reviews were WAY overboard. It was very average. Rooms were nothing special at all. It was clean......good location. But very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchard Hotel in San Francisco, CA. The hotel was really nice. It was clean and pretty. They had a nice continental breakfast. Great location in San Francisco. Staff was very friendly they even helped me when I was lost in China Town. One of the staff was able to direct me to a great restaurant. They also turn down your bed and give you a mint. My family was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolineN
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a short, but wonderful first time visit to San Francisco. I booked our reservation at the Orchard Hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. I love to travel and have stayed at many wonderful hotels, and the Orchard is definitely one of my top five. The location is perfect for walking or riding the cable cars. My daughter and I felt totally safe and as a result, slept very well. Our room was cleaned immaculately, and all the employees we encountered were very helpful and nice. I don't normally watch movies while on vacation, but after a full day of sightseeing, shopping and walking the beautiful (but steep!) streets of S.F., it was nice to go back to the hotel, pick out a DVD and relax in our room for the evening. All the subtle touches add up to make the Orchard outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Aboout the Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Puter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, the staff great.....but... I notice that persons who stay at the Orchard Hotel are paying for parking. If you book this hotel through hotelres--- and get a "parking package" the parking is often included and the price is the same as if you did not do this. hotelres--- is a consolidator which many San Francisco hotels use, to make sure their hotel is as full as possible. It charges no fee, and does not charge your credit card, nor give you a noncancellable reservation. Once you make the reservation you deal with the hotel and its own cancellation policies. If you reserve online they send you a printable confirmation, otherwise they mail it to you. It really is a good resource. We stay in San Francisco several weekends/year and have favorite hotels. Once, when I tried to book ahead at one hotel, they told me they were full on that date and handed me a page of hotel listings and the hotelres--- site and advised that I try that.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Close to everything, wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SantaBarbaraHipster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful; room was updated, very clean and spacious. Only problem was they had lost their liquor license, consequently there was only water, soft drinks in the room fridge. The hotel breakfast had everything we wanted: hard-boiled eggs, cold/hot cereals, yummy bisquits, bagels, toast, coffee, tea, fresh squeezed orange juice, ham/bacon. We literally were within walking distance to everything - we never used our car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Orchard after reading all the reviews. We were not disappointed. This was a clean, quiet Hotel. Close to all the shops and dining. It was great fun catching the Cable cars up and down the hill, but it was also just as easy to walk. The room was small but just perfect for a few days stay (what do you need a big room for anyway ? most of the time is spent outside exploring this lovely city). The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom spacious ! We stayed in room 911 which they probably give to overseas visitors as I don't think many Americans would be happy with this room number. The room over looked the street and was very quiet. We will stay at The Orchard again !

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in SFO”
Reviews.Author: Roseville_CAJoan
Reviews.Content: I am always on the look-out for a clean, comfortable, convenient, friendly, quiet, upscale-contemporary Hotel when I travel, (since I travel alot). Recently in SFO for business, this was a real find. Not only was the bellman helpful and friendly but the desk staff also. The I-Net connection was a breeze (available on any floor), and its free! They give you a password at check-in and cables, if needed. They also have a DVD movie library available. I also loved having a CD player to listen to music in the evening. Since this is a newly constructed Hotel, they installed special double pane windows that muffle the sound and although the cable car bell could be heard during the day, it was very quiet at night. The down comforter and pillows were a treat and the second pillow is not down (in case you are allergic). Our room was spacious and everything said in other reviews is true. It was a nice suprise to have Aveda products in the bath, robes and Frette linens on the bed! If you are in need of a small meeting room, their Boardroom is "state of the art", with no extra charges for wireless. Parking; valet at $38, is normal. You are in the city. Stay up the hill a little ways and it is $50 per night! Continental breakfast was perfect. Even with the tons of wonderful eateries close by, we stopped in one evening for a light dinner and drinks at the restaurant and had the most wonderful foie Gras and seared scallops. We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: Hannahsheffield
Reviews.Content: Just had a wonderful stay at the Orchard which I would not have found if it wasn't for trip advisor so thank you to all previous reviewers. I found the staff wonderfully helpful and informative as well as being cheerful, something not seen in all hotels! My room, on the eighth floor was spaceous and very comfortable. I agree that the bed was quite firm and my only complaint was that the pillows are way too soft and provide no support at all. The bathroom was much larger than I am used to and the Aveda products were lovely. All in all a great place to stay. The muni travel pass is a must if you want to avoid the steep hill from post to bush using the cable car ($24 for 7 days). My advice is to avoid the large queues at the terminus at powell/market and wait at the first or second stop futher on, indicated by brown signs. That way you do not have a long wait and it is usually not a problem to hop on. Would recommend the Orchard and absolutely stay here again on repeat visits.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard for three nights, March 26 to 29. I would not have found this place without Trip Advisor! Thanks - because this place is great - the room, the location, the price! and breakfast, too. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was large with lots of towels, robes, magnifying mirror, hair dryer and aveda hair products. The room included a desk and dsl internet access which was great for doing a little work while on vacation. The computer at the front desk includes a printer for printing out airplane boarding passes. The hotel is a two block walk uphill from Union Square. The cable car route goes up the nearest cross street (Powell) so you can always catch a cable car if you don't like walking uphill. The other Cross street (Mason) has a nasty stairway - stay off this street/stairwell.... The breakfast was perfect - more than breads and fruit - there were hard boiled eggs, cheese, ham for sandwiches, yogurt, and lots of juices. The doorman arranged a cab for my husband - a nicer car, leather seats, etc - all for the same price as the taxi you grab on the street. Overall, this hotel is an excellent value. I would definitely stay here on any future visits -

Reviews.Title: “Well Rested at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: TexasRock
Reviews.Content: Being in San Francisco for the first time I find The Orchard efficient and remarkably quiet. The room was just right and you can not beat the price. The hotel location (Powell and Bush Street)is also its best feature, near the Cable Car(around the corner), China town (two blocks) and shops (all along Powell Street). Oh by the way, the Bart Station is five blocks walk from the hotel and if you are not used to walking, it could be a strenous exercise so better bring comfortable shoes and lugggage with wheels. Although the Continetal Buffet need some help I find it filling. The complimentary use of the computer should be removed from the lobby and be placed in a more private setting. Otherwise, the intimate and relax atmosphere made my first experience of San Francisco a memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “loved to orchard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: phenomenal hotel, excellent location, very friendly staff, excellent rooms. would definietly recommend and if returning to san francisco would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: HIohana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard for 2 nights- 3/15-17, and had a wonderful time. It felt like heaven after coming from the Hyatt Embarcadero. Upon arriving at the Orchard, we were warmly greeted by concierge/bellman, James. He was most welcoming and helpful throughout our stay.:) Check in was fast. The room was equipped with a nice DVD surround sound system. Complimentary DVD's were available at the front desk, which we took advantage of every night. The room was clean with crisp bedding. The bed was somewhat hard and not that comfortable,and the pillows were too soft. However, the down comforter was most comfortable. Bathroom was clean,but little grout needed whitening, and not luxurious. Nice Aveda products. Comfy bathrobes and nice tea/coffee with coffeemaker. The complimentary breakfast buffet was an added bonus and a perfect touch. It consisted of a selection of 2 cold cereals, an instant hot oatmeal,yogurt, fresh fruits: cantalope, watermelon,oranges,apples and bananas, sweet breads, mini scones, bread for toasting, hard boiled eggs, sliced ham and cheese, coffee, tea and juices:(apple, orange, cranberry and grapefruit). The hotel was in a good location, close to Chinatown, Union square and shopping areas. The only negative was the hike up the steep hill from Post to Bush lugging all of our packages! :) A good Japanese restaurant less than a half a block away was the "Tempura House". Reasonable prices and good food!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Orchard, Pacific Tours and eateries”
Reviews.Author: driftwoodii
Reviews.Content: We just got back from San Francisco and stayed 4 nights at the Orchard. The Nob Hill location was excellent, central to everything...especially close to the cable car stop at Powell and Bush. The room was tasefully decorated, clean and the king size bed was ultra comfortable. Breakfast was a buffet style and we had more than we needed, I liked the fresh fruit and croissant...coffee was not so good but I like it stronger. Tammy on the desk was especially helpful suggesting great spots to dine...she knows her restaurants! James the doorman, was all smiles, friendly, knowledgable and willing to help. We took a great tour in a mini bus by Pacific Tours for 3 1/2 hours and it was the best way to get around as we had not rented a car..the driver was friendly and knew the interesting history in the areas that we toured. The 3 day pass on the cable cars, F-line street cars, and the Muni at $18 is a must. Our favourite meals were at Sam's Grill, Scala's, Great Eastern, Cafe de la Presse, Siam Thai (lunch) Martini's at The Top of the Mark to see the sunset. A thirst quenching drink at Beuna Vista near the cable car terminus. Awesome holiday...we were not disappointed at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days and 3 nights in San Francisco. The Orchard made our stay wonderful. Good size rooms, nice bathroom, friendly and reliable staff. The location is great. Central to Knob Hill, Union Square, Russian Hill, Chinatown, the Financial District and just a cable car ride away from the wharf. Although not the Four Seasons or the Ritz, the price you pay per night (breakfast included) will leave room for shopping sprees at Saks and dinner at Gary Danko's. I would stay at the Orchard again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but overrated”
Reviews.Author: RStokes
Reviews.Content: The ratings seem very high for what is on offer here - perhaps there is some manipulation of the ratings going on. Overall the hotel is pleasant, clean and centrally located but this is not New York and that alone does not justify the prices. Parking is 34$ per night, the rooms are small and internet access is only available on floors 1 -3. Services are limited even for a boutique hotel Breakfast is a simple continental breakfast of fruit, croissants, yoghurt etc. They do supply dvd players in each room but thats to make up for a limited set of channels on TV. Overall the hotel is nice in a good location. Facilities are somewhat average - bathrooms are clean but luxurious is somewhat of a stretch. Showers are of the nozzle over a bathtub variety. It is more expensive than some other more luxurious hotels in San Francisco that I have stayed in on previous trips. Overall the stay was a pleasant unpleasant experience and it wont hurt to stay here but I've stayed in better for the money even in New York. The rating seems manipulated.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While my husband stayed at the Hilton for business purposes, I chose to stay at The Orchard. Both hotels are beautiful but The Orchard is small, intimate, quiet and personal. The staff were friendly and attentive without being intrusive. The breakfasts were delicious and fresh. The room was exceptionally clean with a luxurious bathroom and a very comfortable bed. It was a pleasure to stay at The Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyndtan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orchard from February 18-20 and thought it was excellent. The location was great, just a short walk to Union Square and Chinatown. We stayed in a suite since we were traveling with a baby and wanted a separate room. It was clean and very pleasant. The bathroom was spacious, with a separate shower and tub. Service was good, and everyone was friendly. Breakfast was a little disappointing but fine. Overall it was a good experience, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: anon126
Reviews.Content: I think I agree with one of the previous reviewers. I was expecting more after reading some of the reviews but was slightly disapointed. I'm not sure any more of what a 'boutique hotel' is as this is the way the Orchard is described but, in my opinion, isn't. The rooms are a bit bland but large with some good features such as a good TV but the beds are really hard and our view from the windows (which you can't open) were poor. Generally, the room was quiet but we were on the top floor (10th). The breakfast was ok but limited in choice and the staff were efficient and friendly. The location was pretty good, under 10 minutes walk to get to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “rave review on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: isabella243
Reviews.Content: We visited 2/5/06-2/9/06. The best hotel in usa and look for their 2 nd garden hotel in san francisco due to open 2006. The location was the best- 2 blocks up the hill from Union Square and 1 block from the Mark! The hotel is run impecably and the staff could not do more to make your visit absolutely perfect. There is an excellent restaurant in the hotel if you have a big day of sightseeing! I would stay again in a heartbeat! Haverford,PA

Reviews.Title: “A Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Perceptric
Reviews.Content: The Orchard is a really excellent boutique hotel. The staff are tremendously friendly, from the always happy doorman, James, to the staff at the front desk and on through the hotel. It is extremely well priced for its position, just a few steps away from Union Square. I travel to San Francisco between 6 and 8 times a year and tried a lot of hotels that suited my budget and were small and friendly before I settled on the Orchard. It is streets ahead of the big hotels that I have stayed at like the Omni or the W, where you are paying twice or three times the price and not getting any increase in value.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to SF in November for a girl trip and we really had a good time. The hotel had a special that weekend so we ended up paying $145 a night. It was three of us in the room and it was perfect. I know some people talked about how small the rooms are but I thought they were fine! The service at the hotel was the absolute best, everyone was friendly and extremely helpful. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Orchard, Great Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: blueshark
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four and decided to stay for a week, in the end of December, at the Orchard, based on Tripadvisor's reviews. Great choice. The Orchard is a solid 4 stars using an European rating . The hotel is new, decor nice, large rooms, very good location and service. We paid US$ 140 for a standard room and 240 for a suite, including breakfast. You get what you pay, and the relation cost/benefit at the Orchard was very, very, very good. We would stay again for shure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: poppybabe
Reviews.Content: We chose the Orchard because of the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed. Check-in for our stay in October 05 was swift and efficient, all staff were polite, friendly and helpful. Our double room was spotlessly clean and the bed extremely comfortable. The bathroom was also clean but it did suffer from 'flooding', presumably under/over/through the shower curtain. After one wet episode, during the early evening, we used the towels to mop up the excess water. On our way out that evening, we asked at reception if we could have fresh towels and, when we returned, not only had the fresh towels been provided but the bathroom had been cleaned again. The complimentary buffet breakfast was better than we have had in other hotels, we were even able to get a decent cup of tea! We made good use of the complimentary wireless internet in the lobby area, using a wireless PDA, and were also able to use the laptop provided at reception. The location was excellent with the cable car being just on the street corner - down the hill for Union Square, up the hill for the Fisherman's Wharf area. The owners are developing another hotel nearby which will be more upmarket and which promises to have green credentials. If we are ever in San Francisco again we will be very happy to stay at either of these hotels. We unreservedly recommend the Orchard to others.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve Trip”
Reviews.Author: lsm112375
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here 4 nights- departing on New Year's Day. The doormen are extremely friendly and were helpful in arranging for a town car to transport us to the airport on New Year's Day morning. Check-in was easy and the front desk staff always greeted us coming in from the street or coming out of the elevator. When asking them about local attractions, they were helpful as well. The room was ok- but I expected a bit more from the reviews. Our bed was awfully hard- and I rarely sleep in one that is. Hubby and I did not address this with the staff, figuring all the beds were this way, that of course may not be the case. The bathroom was fine- but not spectacular. Breakfast- such a big issue witht his hotel. I will admit- when Hubby and I went down the first day and saw the selection- I thought it would be the one and only time we ate the breakfast- then I tasted the croissants. They were great! The key is to hit breakfast when they are not packed- a much better selection. Also tried several of the coffee cakes and breads, which were above average. For the location and price (with breakfast included) it was a pretty good deal. By booking early- the 4 nights averaged out to $140 a night. I would stay again if I could guarantee the bed would not be as hard. And I will recommend it to others. If you are looking for a reasonable priced hotel in a good location, The Orchard is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Rivercat2
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight after a business event and was pleasantly surprised, especially for the price. Goes one better on the usual SF boutique hotel experience with a cosy bed, robe & slippers, in-room DVD player (borrow movies at the front desk), turndown service, and pleasant attitudes from the staff. The location is between Union Square and Chinatown (not a bad area as one reviewer implied), so if you don't want to walk up a pretty steep hill at Powell, take a cab. Parking is all valet, so be sure to give them 20 minutes to retrieve your car from down the street. Cafe de la Presse at Bush & Grant about a block and a half away is a good non-chain place to have a casual meeting, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Union Square(ish) Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonProf
Reviews.Content: Just stayed a night on business. Positive reviews here are deserved. I was upgraded to a suite, very nice rooms for a hotel at this price ($189). Great sheets and comforter, spacious, DVD library with free movies in lobby, Wired AND Wireless FREE high speed internet, tub and glass shower. Check in and valet were very friendly and efficient. Good continental+ breakfast. A couple block easy walk from Union Square. Highly recommend it as a boutique choice.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: quesoreina
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel was OK, but it wasn't as nice as I expected after reading all the great reviews on this site. Check-in was fast and easy and the doorman was really friendly and helpful. Our room was nice looking. Since the hotel is only a couple of years old, its fresh and clean. The room did not have a microwave, but it did have a mini refrigerator. The refrigerator was part of the mini bar, so you had to get a key from the front desk to use it. That was a pain. The room had a nice large TV with a DVD player. The sound system was decent. There was a speaker built into the ceiling right above the bed, and there was also a subwoofer. I thought that was a nice touch, even though we didn't watch much TV. The bathroom was OK. There was no tub, just a huge shower stall. I didn't like the shower stall that much because it didn't have a shelf to put my shampoo and soap on. The Aveda cosmetics didn't really excite me at all. I don't understand why other reviewers are going nuts over these average (at best) cosmetics. There was nothing wrong with them, but I just don't understand what all the hoopla is about. The breakfast sucked. Why did the breakfast suck? Let me count the ways. Primarily, lack of selection. They had some fruit and a few pieces of bread, and boiled eggs. They had two very plain and boring cereals. They made a big to-do over it, and tried to act all stuffy over it. Instead of just letting people come in and sit down, they had one of those “Please Wait to be Seated” signs. The worst part is that there was no one there to seat anyone! We wound up just walking in and sitting down after a nice customer told us we should. For some reason, they were using white linen tablecloths. There were no disposable cups or plates, which meant we could not take food to our room, or take a cup of coffee to go on the way out in the morning. Of course none of that mattered since there was nothing worth taking. The breakfast scared us away from ever ordering anything from room service. I know hotel continental breakfasts are just supposed to be a light meal to get your day started, but I also know that the breakfasts I have had at chains like Hampton Inn were a thousand times better than this garbage. All in all, I would say The Orchard Hotel is really overrated on TripAdvisor. I don’t really agree with the reviews. I don’t think the people who wrote them get out too often. The place was perfectly acceptable, but not amazing by any stretch of the imagination. Also, I agree with the last reviewer who mentioned that the location is not that great. The combination of so-so location, high price (I know stuff is expensive in SF - but still) and lack of fun cause me to give it a rating of 3/5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel and we were disappointed with the location and service. The staff were not accommodating and the location was a bit shady and too far from Union Square. We had problems in our room and no one could help us either. It's a nice hotel when you enter the lobby, but beware as it has several problems in service.

Reviews.Title: “Posted reviews are correct!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just a note to let future travelers know about the Orchard Hotel; we had a great stay. The European complimentary breakfast was much better than the usual Continental breakfast. The staff was exceptionally friendly and most accommodating. The rooms and amenities were well appreciated. Jerry & Sandy Patterson

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 month old daughter and I stayed at the Orchard based on a coworkers recommendation together with tripadvisor reviews. We loved it! We stayed in a suite, which was crucial with an infant who goes to bed very early in the evening. The bedroom was spacious, the bathroom ridiculously huge, and the living area smallish. Street noise didn't bother us, and we stayed on the 5th floor, street side. I'm a light sleeper so I was a little wary of this, but it wasn't a problem at all. We loved the separate shower / tub which allowed one of us to shower while the other bathed our daughter, or washed her clothes in the tub. The hotel is in a great location, very close to more shopping than you'd ever need, china town, etc. We didn't have a problem catching the cable car at the stop right on the corner. We ate breakfast at the hotel, which was reasonably good, and lunch and dinner out on the town. One early evening the room next to us was playing music extremely loudly, and we complained to the front desk. They said they'd look into it, but it didn't stop for at least another 20 minutes (our daughter was sleeping so it seemed like an eternity to us!). It did stop, however, and we were satisfied. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. All the staff ooed and ahhed appropriately over our daughter (which naturally thrilled us- ha!). The only real downside is the ridiculously expensive parking. Don't hesitate to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Upscale Roomy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonyraisins
Reviews.Content: The Orchard Hotel, San Francisco. Great location and hospitality. Superb customer service, spacious rooms, and a splendid breakfast. After reading all of these positive reviews, we don't have much additional information to add. Oh, we found the breakfast to be more than adequate- we disagree with the more negative breakfast reviews. The breakfast was served on a 14 foot long buffet table, and included: coffee, teas, orange-apple-cranberry-and tomato juice, two cereals, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, english muffin, two breads, three freshly baked cakes, watermelon, cantaloupe, honeydew, bananas, apples, oranges, two marmalades, honey, scones, croissants, swiss cheese, and Boars Head ham slices. What more can one hope for at an expanded complimentary buffet? After returning from our Chinatownwalk, we ventured down Powell Street and headed into the Gold Dust- which is a petite 1930 vintage jazz club. We mingled with tourists and locals alike- and had a superb time. The following evening we went into Lefty o Douls, just south of the St Francis Hotel, and sang along at a piano bar with a lively and animated bunch. Bottom line - if you don't expect the Ritz Carlton, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base in a Great City!”
Reviews.Author: paulaura
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three very wet days in mid-December, and are pleased to report that everything we had read about this hotel is true. The location could not be beaten - literally yards from the fabled Cable Car line (Powell Street), either down the hill to Union Square or over the hill to North Beach and the Fisherman's Wharf area. Rooms were excellent for what is really a three and a half star hotel. Clean, large and tastefully furnished. The breakfasts were a little basic, but included in the price which is reasonable for a hotel with such a great location. We did not eat dinner in the hotel - there were too many other temptations in this food-lovers' paradise. Despite the rain, we walked a fair bit around this beautiful (and hilly) city. The Orchard is ideally placed for downtown shopping, Chinatown and the revitalised Embarcadero (don't miss the Farmers Market at the Ferry terminal building every Saturday). Don't expect luxury (e.g. marble floors - as a previous reviewer griped) for these prices, but if you are after a comfortable, convenient and friendly base when visiting San Francisco, you will not be disappointed with the Orchard. We would not hesitate to stay here again on our next visit to the Bay Area.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard Hotel is the Best!! You have to stay at The Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just want to share with you the wonderful experience to my 1st visit to San Francisco and The Orchard Hotel. The hotel staff of The Orchard Hotel has given us a memorable vacation that we can't stop talking about. Tony Llanos whom is the Controller of the Hotel has highly recommended that we go and visit the hotel for approximately 1 year now. I am impressed with the condition/cleanliness of the rooms as well as the customer service. The staff all around does express the true meaning of "Customer Serivce". From the time we arrived till we departed the hotel. The staff immediately honored each request that we have with no hesitation. The Hotel sits on a great location, we were out and about everyday of our vacation and were close to everything. I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends and family of Hawaii!! This is the place to go on our vacation. Mahalo to everyone at The Orchard Hotel, we will return with more of our Friends and Family!! A Hui Hou!! (Until we meet again).

Reviews.Title: “Still smiling!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orchard during our 15 year wedding annivarsary celebration. To state it simply our stay was simply the best. The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. At any hour of the day we walked through the corridor we always recieved friendly greeting. Everyone, especially James, was great. The location was perfect. When we return to San Francisco, there's not doubt we will be staying at the Orchard!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable 4 star boutique hotel suited to the average tourist”
Reviews.Author: Thomson_aus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in November 2005. It is a comfortable 4 star boutique hotel suited to the average tourist. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, go to The St. Regis or Four Seasons Hotel, as The Orchard Hotel would be only 4 stars in terms of finishes and service. Good points: -Convenient location two blocks from Union Square -The Aveda bathroom toileteries are fantastic (you get Rosemary and Mint Shampoo, Conditioner, Bath Soap, and Facial Soap - very impressed!) -The bed and duvet are very comfortable -DVD player and large screen TV in room Room for improvement: -Doormen are very lazy and do not open doors for guests consistently, and sometimes are not on the property at all (one time I had to hail my own cab!) -Bathrooms are tiled in ceramic wall and floor tiles (for an upmarket property, I was expecting the bathrooms would have been done in marble) Overall, a comfortable stay, and I would return as it is good value at $135 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Any time again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had chosen the Orchard Hotel for its close-to-everything location and prior reviews. Everything good they say is true. The rooms are very tastefully decorated, the bath was luxury size with beautiful tiles and the rosemary&mint shampoo a real experience. The staff is friendly and helpful at all hours of the day. You woulnd't want to get out of their super comfortable beds if it wasn't San Francisco waiting outside. The complimentary breakfast and newspapers are a great start into the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dpayne1962
Reviews.Content: A great experience. Close to Union Square and within walking distance of Cina Town. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Ajudes
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Orchard Hotel where I'd made reservations for 5 couples. I did quite a bit of research, including Trip Advisor, before making the reservations. Even so, I held my breath until we arrived. From the moment we were driven up and were greeted by an enthusiastic James, to the helpful folks at the desk, we were thrilled. The location is very convenient & we were able to walk most places. The rooms are immaculate with lovely decor, beds & pillows are very comfortable, the bathroom is tastefully done & the outside noise isn't particularly loud. Since we don't want to start the day with a 1000 calorie breakfast, it met our desires well. With a variety of cereals, breads, croisants, ham & cheese, fruit, boiled eggs, juice, coffee, tea, etc., we were grateful for so many choices. Provided the rates don't increase greatly, we'll stay at the Orchard on our return to this exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard for three nights. We were both pleasantly surprised at the beautifully decorated room as well as the cleanliness of our room and bathroom. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the owner, Mrs. Huang, was very often visible, chatting with guests making sure everyone was truly happy during their stays at the Orchard. Not a very common thing these days. We look forward to staying at Mrs. Huang's new hotel the Orchard Garden opening in July 2006. Mrs. Huang and her staff truly understand "customer satisfaction".

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at the Orchard Hotel. I'm always nervous trying new hotels, but this one set me at ease right away. The doorman, Cornell, was very friendly and accommodating. The location was excellent. Just a couple of blocks from Union Square, China Town and Nob Hill. We walked almost everywhere. A cab ride into North Beach only cost us about $6.00. The room was very spacious and clean with huge windows. There was quite a bit of street noise at night and some sort of truck noise early in the morning. Typical of being in a large city though I guess. My only complaint would have to be the complimentary breakfast. My husband and I had to keep reminding ourselves that it was free and not complain too much. Both mornings there was only white bread for the toast and warm milk for the cereal. There was deli ham and cheese, however nothing to put it on except for the white bread. With that being said, prior to our stay we had been in the wine country and had experienced huge warm wonderful breakfasts that were also complimentary. I understand that we can't compare the two, but that may explain my dissappointment. We did not have a chance to have dinner at the hotel, but I heard that it was excellent. I will definitely stay at the hotel again and try for dinner next time.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard is Great”
Reviews.Author: dcLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard for 4 nights in October 2005 and have to say this is a great hotel. First, the staff are friendly and professional. The rooms are very nice and the hotel itself is in the perfect location - you literally step out of the hotel door and you can get the cable car to Fishermans Wharf, or stroll one block to Union Square. It is ideal. Complimentary breakfast was also much better than expected. Overall this is a great place to stay in San Francisco and I highly reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Sept 2005 - excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: spotter92
Reviews.Content: Superb location for city centre (only 2/3 blocks from Union Square) and transport to outlying areas - yards from trams. Quiet spaceious and well appointed rooms kept spotlessly clean. Service throughout was excellent. Plentiful breakfast and although we didn't personally dine here in the evening, other guests we spoke to highly recommended the restaurant. Would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: leonc1234
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here many times at this point. Just wanted to give them a big thumbs up. This is how a hotel should work. This is the kind of service and value you should get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous before arriving at the Orchard. I usually stay at the upscale chain hotels, but thought I'd try something different this time. It turns out I had no reason to worry. The staff went above and beyond for us, the room was beautiful & comfortable, and the hotel is centrally located near Union Square. The breakfast was nothing to rave about, but better than nothing. My only qualm was we were given a handicap room & the shower head was not adjustable for a non-handicap person. I would gladly stay here again (but I'd be sure to ask for a non-handicap room).

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Oldmyst
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Orchard in early September, and loved the hotel. The location is great. You can walk to many places. Everyone at the Orchard is very friendly and helpful, especially the doormen. After we checked in, we wanted to get to Yank Sing for dim sum (the best we ever had) before they stopped serving. We barely had twenty minutes to arrive there. The doorman arranged a ride to the restaurant immediately! We also got to meet the owner of the hotel who is a lovely woman. We enjoyed our talks with her. Our room was nicely decorated, the bed very comfortable and the bathroom was very large for a city hotel. It was a nice touch to be able to borrow a DVD to watch after a full day of sightseeing. There is also a computer in the lobby to use if you want to check your email. The complimentary breakfast was fine. There was fresh melon, bananas, cakes, breads, cereal, yogurt, coffee, tea and juice. The hotel stored our luggage for us after our checkout time so we could have a few hours of fun in San Francisco before we had to leave. I would stay at The Orchard again in a hearbeat and highly recommend it. I was so glad we changed our reservation to the Orchard instead of The Westin St. Francis. We visited the St. Francis and asked to see a room, and they were very discourteous to us, refusing our request saying they had no one available to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Great pick”
Reviews.Author: sugarbugdoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, and really enjoyed this hotel. The location is convenient to all the tourist sites. We didnt rent a car, and we were glad we did not after seeing the lack of parking in the city. Take Bart from the airport, and the hotel is close enough for a short uphill walk, and the cable cars are just outside the hotel. Rooms were clean, staff were friendly, and the breakfast was enjoyable. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for any more from a hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Multanion
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel.Booked on the basis of reviews from Tripadvisor and it turned out to be exactly as was described on this site - great location, lovely big bedrooms, great DVD collection, nice light breakfast and great value for money. If I went back to San Francisco would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DERetired
Reviews.Content: Date: October 8, 2005 Reviewer: Delaware Vactioner My wife and I have recently returned from a touring vacation of the California coast. We found the Orchard to be a very nice, but expensive ($297.54 + $38.77 for valet parking/night - including taxes) San Francisco botique hotel. It was attractive, well appointed and clean. The same can be said for the room. The room and bathroom weren't expansive but were bright and pleasant. Furniture included several chairs as well as a writing desk/desk lamp. The dining room was also attractive. DVDs could be obtained, at no extra charge, from the front desk. The doorman was expecially helpful. Good location within easy walk from Union Square and fine restaurants. The breakfast buffet was an expanded continental breakfast with cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, and a variety of pastery, cakes, etc,....nothing hot. I would certainly recommend the Orchard for a pleasant stay in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBE
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in September and really enjoyed our stay. Good to have a non-chain hotel that seemed to have some of it's own ideas such as being able to borrow a CD from an extensive list to watch in the bedroom and including breakfast, which was perfectly adequate although did not have an extensive choice. Great location for Union Square and the cable car (best to walk down a couple of blocks to get on). Staff very friendly and nice clean rooms. As other reviewers have said, try not to bang your legs into the corner of the bed as there's only one winner of that contest !

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Orchard”
Reviews.Author: gftimes2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in the Orchard Hotel in September. It is in an excellent location, just a block from Union Square and walking distance to all the attractions. The room was fabulous, lovely bed, great bathroom with powerful shower (and bath) and really comfortable. The staff were very efficient and friendly and the free DVD hire was a great extra. We would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Union square, small room but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Castelet
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel very close to the great shops on Union square. Beds a little on the hard side but lovely fluffy feather pillows and comforter. The room was a bit small but had a good bathroom and nice products, plus hairdryer. Cons: Room small, a strange damp smell in the corridor, nowhere to put our icepack in the fridge for our long journey home and no special view. It also cost $34 per night for parking and took 20 minutes for the valet to retrieve the car. Pros: Friendly staff, fluffy pillows and duvet, comfortable room, very convenient for Union Square. This hotel is good value, although there are other similar places in lovely San Francisco, like the Rex and the chic modern rooms at the Addagio.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchard was a great find thru tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: lipper
Reviews.Content: Thought I would concur with other reviewers that The Orchard Hotel is a good find and value. New, modern, clean, contemporary, intimate....all describe it. No, it doesn't have a gorgeous view or fancy lobby; but it has friendly and helpful staff, affordable rates and well appointed rooms. There's a beautiful restaurant and lounge right off the lobby. The AAA rate was great. Nice amenities: Cont'l b'fast was included. Free DVD's in room. Robes. Aveda toiletries. Turndown service. Town car avail. Mini bar. Monochromatic decor. Comfortable beds and duvets, pillows. Quick elevators a plus. Only comment is that it is on the hill going up to Nob Hill and uphill from Chinatown and we didn't quite conquer the Cable Car system.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchard Hotel for 3 nights at the end of September after 3 weeks touring the West Coast. The overall experience was excellent and I would highly recommend this hotel for a visit to San Francisco. The location is perfect to catch a tram which passes within 30 yards of the entrance and China town is a short walk away along with the shopping around Union Square. The staff were as genuine as any we came across during the trip. Less of the standard "have a nice day" patter and more genuine interest in their work. If I was being very critical the room was dark with no real view but that's pot luck with the room you are given and I wouldn't mark the hotel down because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: BEATLESCHICK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard from Sept. 14-18, 2005. I did a lot of research on places to stay in San Francisco, as this was our first trip to CA together as a couple, and I wanted it to be special. The Orchard did not disappoint. After our long cross-country flight, we were greeted promptly by a very friendly doorman/bellhop named Juan. Juan unloaded our bags and and waited for us to check-in and then proceeded to help us to our room. The room was gorgeous! About the bed: My husband commented that the bed in our room was almost more comfortable than the one at home!! We got a king-size bed in our room, and the linens were REALLY nice (not sure what the thread count was, but it was pristine). We each had two full-sized goosedown feather pillows to ourselves, which was a treat considering we usually get three at a hotel where we reserve a king-size bed and have to call down to ask for another. Instead of the usual bedspread (which, frankly, give me the creeps in hotel rooms and is the first thing to go on the floor), ours had an impeccably plush (and clean) down comforter. The bathroom was large, with a stand-up shower and the best part...Aveda products! Aveda soap, moisturizing lotion, shampoo and conditioner...this is good stuff! The Orchard offers valet parking for $34 a day with in-and-out privileges; it proved to be worthwhile. Parking in SF is a pain in the behind, and it was handy to be able to call down to the front desk and have your car waiting for you in 15-20 minutes. A complimentary European continental breakfast was included with our stay. The items included delicious pumpkin and other sweet tasting breads, yummy croissants, fruits, juices, teas and coffee. During our first morning there, we had the great pleasure of meeting the owner of the hotel, Mrs. Huong. She was really sweet, and you could tell she takes great pride in how her hotel is run and, more importantly, how her guests are treated. This type of customer service is a rarity these days. If we make it back to SF, we will definitely stay at the Orchard again, and will recommend it to others we know who may be making the trek out west.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenski
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel staff all very pleasent and friendly fantastic location just up from chinatown and union square.bar staff in particular very welcoming. would definatly stay again and would reccomend to anyone .One gripe is breakfast its a bit small! a bit of savoury stuff wouldnt go a miss! apart from that fantastic place!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: reginalampert
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky to stay at this European-style boutique hotel near Union Square. We even met the owner and listened to her fascinating history. This is an extremely friendly place, with good sized, well appointed rooms, a lovely restaurant, etc. Do stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Orchard was great”
Reviews.Author: nashvillian15
Reviews.Content: The Orchard was really nice. Not as fancy or spacious as some similar hotels, but it was great for us on our honeymoon. Free movies from the front desk were great. Free breakfast was nice. The robes were kind of rough. The bathroom was nothing too special, but it was still nice. Everything was clean. Free internet with our laptop was appreciated. I would definitely recommend the Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “A Definite Return Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: NatickEngineer
Reviews.Content: From the concierge to the front desk personnel to the maids, this hotel was a real gem. While some of the other reviewers are correct that the bigger chain hotels might give you a few more amenities, they can't rival the charm, class and service of the Orchard. From the moment, I arrived there I felt like I was at home. I know people have complained about the breakfast, which I didn't think was bad at all. It is a European style Continental Breakfast and it definitely gave me enough energy to traverse the hills of San Francisco. The rooms were beautiful and clean, the bed was more comfortable than my bed at home, the bathrooms immaculate and the free DVD's were great. When I was there, a light blew in the bathroom. At 7am I went down to let the front desk know and within an hour someone had already fixed it..Now I call that SERVICE!! You won't go wrong if you stay at the Orchard!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchard for three nights over the Labor Day Weekend. I did a lot of research on Tripadvisor.com and other travel-related web sites before we selected a place to stay. I was very happy with our selection. The third-floor king room we stayed in was a good size for a big city hotel. The bathrooms were also very large. Amenities included an honor bar, DVD player, bathrobes and Aveda products. We didn't take advantage of the continental breakfast, so I can't comment on that. We elected to use the offered $5 coupons at Roxanne's on the corner near the hotel. We enjoyed the breakfasts at this restaurant. Parking is a bit steep at $34 a night, but you would be hard-pressed to find it cheaper at any other hotel located near Union Square. The valet parking does offer in-out privileges, though. The location was great. Easy walk to Union Square, Chinatown and beyond (if you're in the mood for hills). Overall, it was a great place to stay. We'll stay here again the next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at the Orchard in August and found everything about it tops. Modern, clean, outstanding service, especially Mr James at the door,great location and an excellant price. I am recommending it to my friends, but not my enemies. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for business or pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Gailm
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel. Since it was built in about 2000, it has all the comforts and you don't have some of the drawbacks of older buildings such as noisy water pipes and elevators. But it still has charm, is well located and the service is gracious & friendly. Beds are comfy, rooms decently sized, all amenities you need. Did not try the restaurant for dinner but enjoyed a quiet drink in the lounge area and a relaxing continental breakfast. Loved it and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Orchard Hotel twice and look forward to returning in November. Everyone on staff is very friendly. The doorman and drivers are more than helpful and kind. I had the best glass of wine in the bar but did find the breakfast to be lacking. I love this hotel! the location is perfect to Chinatown, Union Square, and the cablecar. It is a bit of a walk, but loved the exercise. I found the hotel to be very quiet, clean, and pleasant. The Aveda products are a nice touch for a boutique hotel. PSM - Longview, WA

Reviews.Title: “Best I have stayed in !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis&Johnny
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Francisco and I had picked the Orchard Hotel based on reviews from the Trip Advisor. I can say that I was NOT disappointed. I had requested a suite on a high floor overlooking Powell & Bush and that is exactly what I had. The rooms were immaculate, personnel was great ----ESPECIALLY JAMES!!!!!!!. Whatever directions you asked him for he had little notes already printed up to give to you. It was also nice that they had a computer in the lobby so you could print your boarding pass. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who prefers class, elegance and above all great service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orchard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ava007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchard Hotel from July 23 - 26th and enjoyed every minute of it. I must admit the entry looks some what modest. However, once you enter the small lobby and hear the fountain splashing you feel a sense of peace from the busy San Francisco streets. The front desk was extremely pleasant and attentive and made us feel welcome. Although check in was not until 3PM we were able to get our room at 1:30PM when we arrived. The room was very nice and clean. The bed linens and comforter were heavenly. I loved the DVD surround sound in the room and we made good use of the free DVD rentals. The room is stocked with Wolfgang Puck coffee which is always welcoming first thing in the morning. The free continental breakfast was simple but nice. It consisted mainly of fruits, variety of breads and muffins, coffee, juices and cold cereal. Loved the Aveda products in the bathroom which was very large and updated. The location is perfect! We had ticket to the Curran Theater to see Les Miserables and walked the short 3.5 blocks. Chinatown is approximately 2.5 blocks away and Union Square was an easy 2 blocks away. Market Street (San Francisco Shopping Centre) is approximately 6 blocks away. There is a cable car stop right on the corner of the hotel. However, the cable car is usually full by the time it gets to this stop. I suggest you catch the stop in front of Union Square to increase your chances of getting on the cable car especially after 10AM. I will definitely stay at this hotel again. The staff really made the stay pleasurable and memorable. Everyone I interacted with at the hotel from the front desk to housekeeping was extremely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money for food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The accommodations at the Orchard were OK but there are better places to stay. I recommend staying at an older hotel - in San Francisco, all hotels built after a certain year have to have sealed windows. This makes no sense in a city reknowned for its fresh air (even hotels in Vegas let you open the windows a crack!). So, I had to breathe recycled air like I was at my office. To add insult, the sealed up windows weren't even very effective at keeping out street noise. Hotel is in a busy area that I found difficult to get in and out of - SF traffic is a nightmare; worse than LA's, no matter what they tell you. Amenities were nothing special; probably no better than a good Best Western. I recommend the Carlton on Sutter Street, an older, historic hotel in a better location where you can actually open the windows. Save your money for the wonderful SF restaurant scene.

Reviews.Title: “Orchard was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Redd1Texas
Reviews.Content: We booked back in March 2005 for 10th anniversary trip in July. Was apprehensive b/c never stayed in boutique hotel before but after reading numerous excellent reviews on trip advisor, we tried the Orchard. I must say that my husband and I were extremely pleased with the Orchard. Nice accomodations...loved the size and feel of king-size room. Followed posted advice re: upper front-side floor and we did not hear garbage trucks. James (concierge) was most accomodating. Gave me number to florist and he arranged for rose petals and bouquet to be placed in room. Hotel also gave red wine and truffles (free)! Front desk courteous and helpful, as well as other doorman. Location was perfect as stated in other reviews. We bought a 3 day pass for MUNI, cable cars, and buses for $15 and got around wonderfully. We thoroughly enjoyed our first (but not last) visit to San Fran and the Orchard! P.S. Nice added bonuses, dial-up and DSL free and also free DVDs that we borrowed.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sbc1023
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in SF @ the Orchard Hotel. This was my first trip to SF, but with any luck, it won't be my last! What a wonderful town! The weather was fantastic--I listened to the various postings and brought a light jacket and NO SHORTS--it was perfect. Temperatures ranged from 68-72 during the day, and once the AM fog was gone, the sun shone brightly all week. Evenings were cooler, I think it may have dipped to the upper 50's one night. Several establishments chose to forego the air conditioning in favor of open windows to take advantage of the breezes. The Orchard is well situated between Union Square, Chinatown, and Nob Hill. The staff couldn't be more helpful. The room was spacious and clean. Following the advice of previous posts, we requested a room in the front, to avoid the alley and trash pickup. Some people had said that, being in the front, they were bothered by the cable cars--they stop about a half block away, we hardly heard them at all. The daily "European-style" continental breakfast saved us from having to run around in the morning to find a place to eat----fresh fruits, cold cereal, coffee, tea, juices, and a lovely assortment of European breads and mini scones was an adequate, if not extravagant, start to each day. We booked our Alcatraz tour in advance, again following the posting advice that trips sell out, which, in fact, was good advice, as they had. Took a tour of Muir Woods and Sausilito--loved the woods, didn't get much time in Sauilito, so we took the ferry over again later in the week. Also took a tour with SF Tours of the wine country--a combination of Napa and Sonoma wineries. Next time, I would rent a car and spend a couple of days--it was a nice introduction, but I definately would have liked to do some more exploring. For a fun evening, don't miss "Beach Blanket Babylon". Have dinner before hand at Trattoria Cantadina, just a block away. We also had a great dinner at Julius' Castle--the food and the views were both top notch. Plan to be there for sunset. We also took a dinner cruise on the Hornblower--pricey, but good food, spectacular views, and live music. An aside about the cable cars---don't look to them as a reliable means of transporation--take them instead for the novelty of it, when you aren't in a hurry to get to where you are going. Unless you wait in line at either end point of the route (which can be up to an hour wait) your chances of getting on along the way are slim to none, as the crowded cars will not stop to pick up more passengers, and routinely pass by the stops with would-be passengers. Buses run frequently and are easy to navigate. As an "easterner" I found San Francisco to be a city of friendly, happy people. No trace of the harried, hurried pace found across the country. And---what a concept---cars actually stop for pedestrians!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: WestCanTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many SF hotels, but decided to try the Orchard after reading TripAdvisor reviews ... and I could not agree more with all the good press the hotel gets. I paid $140 on AAA rate and it was excellent value: comfortable, quiet room; helpful staff; good location (only two blocks from Union Sq); includes continental breakfast. Unlike some of the SF hotels (The Monaco, e.g.), it has none of the pretentious attitude. I will stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels! I've stayed here time after time, and haven't been dissapointed. Extremely comfortable rooms, free high speed access, and great breakfast. You can down comforters and pillows - a very decent sized room, DVD players, and a free hotel DVD rental library. You don't get a huge lobby etc, but once you enter your room, you're extremely satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously comfy”
Reviews.Author: Rosie94
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orchard for 3 nights in July. I'd just come back from 14 nights camping in some very grotty campsites - anyone who has anything bad to say about The Orchard should try one of those! The staff were all very friendly and courteous - especially the doormen - I noticed they were all really sweet to the little children coming in and out with their parents. The rooms are fantastic - excellent beds, huge bathrooms etc (although actually the bath was very shallow and short - but that's a seriously minor quibble). The view isn't exactly panoramic (I was on the top - tenth - floor) but it could be a lot, lot worse - the number of hotels I've stayed in and looked at a wall / air conditioning unit! Thoroughly recommended.
